When asked about which rosters looked the scariest, Rossy immediately listed two powerhouses. “I think Team Heretics is the easy pick here. Heretics and FNATIC in my opinion. I think FNATIC's playing with their original roster and Sayonara . That Sayonara guy looks really good… Heretics and FNATIC look really scary.” As for which teams seemed easiest to beat, Rossy couldn't seem to come up with any. “Uh, I don't know. Maybe us. Maybe us.” he laughed. “Maybe we'll be easy to beat. Those are all good teams, I truly don't believe anyone is easy.” Rossy's attitude towards the OFF//SEASON events may seem lax, but his overall thought process behind it put his perspective of the event into one of practice and improvement. “You can't really put a lot of stock into it; I think it's so hard to tell. Last year, Heretics and Gen.G were the two best teams, and both struggled in the OFF//SEASON. Heretics played back to back events and lost, Gen.G lost to FUT Esports in Convergence . Obviously there are teams like Sentinels who did good and had a really great year.” “If you [think] ‘this OFF//SEASON event is gonna make or break us,' I think that's a little bit interesting and I don't think that I agree with that.” Overall, Rossy seemed prepared and ready to put the work ahead of the 2025 VCT. His attitude and demeanor displayed confidence and understanding of his team's position this year. “I'm blessed to be here and have this opportunity to play on C9 and I hope that I can lead them to a great year and maybe break the Cloud9 regular season curse and actually make an international event with these guys.” Good luck, Rossy! (Photo: David Lee/Riot Games) “We know we're good. Any day we can come up and just beat anyone, but it's just about being consistent; being consistently good every single day. But that just comes with practice. We might be ready right now, we might not. We're a pretty young team and are just going with it. We're not looking too deep into the future or the past, just focusing on the current moment. We're definitely improving every day and that's all that matters right now.” Cloud9 will face FNATIC today in their opening match of the fifth annual Red Bull Home Ground, a rematch of last year's grand finals.

title: Wolves Esports parts ways with aluba
cleaned_content: Wolves Esports has parted ways with Zhong " balua " Haojun (钟皓钧) , ending his time with the organization after just one season. aluba was mainly the Wolves' Controller player, playing agents such as Omen or Viper while also occasionally filling the Sentinel role through Killjoy or Cypher. Perhaps his most memorable performance for the organization was one of his earliest. In the team's first match of China Stage 1 , he dropped a sever-leading 74 kills and 292 ACS in a 2-1 loss to Titan Esports Club . Before joining Wolves, aluba played for three different pre-franchising organizations that are no longer active as of 2024. He started his career in 2021 with Invictus Gaming Academy before moving to O2 Gaming , and Monarch Effect , before finally landing with Wolves ahead of the 2024 season. He competed in all 13 of the team's matches in VCT across China Kickoff and both Stages, but the team fell short of qualifying for any playoffs or international events. They finished the league stage in ninth place. Since the end of their 2024 season, Wolves parted ways with their entire coaching staff and player pl1xx . They have since signed former FunPlus Phoenix standout Lysoar and China Ascension-lifting coach Fayde . aluba did not compete in any of the team's OFF//SEASON competitions, with the team integrating its newest signings early. Wolves Esports ' roster is now: Pong " SiuFatBB " Gaa Hei (庞加曦) Chang " V1yA " Rui-min (张睿珉) Huang " Yuicaw " Yung-chieh (黃湧傑) Liu " Spring " Jiunting (刘俊霆) Liang " Lysoar " Youhao (梁优好) " Simple " (Manager) Chong " Fayde " Hoc Wah (Head coach)

title: benjyfishy: "We never put expectations on ourselves"
cleaned_content: It's been almost three months since Team Heretics lost to EDward Gaming in the grand final of Champions 2024 . Now, Los Niños are set to return to the stage for the first time since then for Red Bull Home Ground #5 , one of the biggest events of the VCT OFF//SEASON , in VCT EMEA's home city of Berlin. Entering the 2024 season with three rookies, a fourth player who played only one tier-one match in 2023, and poor offseason results, Heretics was expected by many to rank towards the bottom of EMEA. Four grand finals and zero roster changes later, the team is widely regarded as one of the strongest and most consistent in the region. benjyfishy walking on stage at the Champions 2024 grand final. (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) However, zero roster changes doesn't guarantee a repeat performance for strong teams. The 2024 season saw teams like FNATIC and Paper Rex unable to replicate their 2023 heights on the international stage despite impressive domestic performances. “A problem that I believe that FNATIC had for this year, at least at the start of the year, maybe is that they were scared of experimenting a bit,” Benjamin " benjyfishy " David Fish commented. “We were changing comps so many times throughout the season and I think that's why we were so good. We're very experimental and I think that's why we're also going to do good next year.” He also doesn't believe that the experience Heretics gained this year will stifle their motivation or their identity as a young and hungry team. “All of us still have the hunger to want to win and the hunger to play and grind and everything you need to be champions, but we've also got that experience that young players don't have on big stages…so I only see it as a good thing that we got all the experience this year.” Although confident, the team isn't feeling any pressure to perform right away in Red Bull. “If we lose, we lose,” benjyfishy said. “Naturally people are going to have high standards for us, but we never put expectations on ourselves; we never take outside views or outside perspectives.” Looking ahead to the event, benjyfishy is hoping to face T1 , who qualified by winning the APAC Play-ins . “I love stax , and I love the players in T1, carpe as well,” he said. “I'm a very big fan of the org in general and I never got a chance to play them last year.” As for the 2025 season, things like expectations or winning it all haven't even crossed his mind. “I like to try and live in the present, and right now all I'm focused on is what I've got to do today.” “Maybe when I come back to Berlin in like two months for the season…but for now, I'm playing, I'm practicing, I'm trying to work on myself, get better as a player, as a person, and hopefully this event will help [me] do that.” benjyfishy and the rest of Heretics will play their first match of the offseason on Nov. 21 in approximately eight hours against FOKUS in the Red Bull Home Ground main event .

title: Moist X Shopify to debut new roster
cleaned_content: Moist x Shopify has announced their return to Valorant with a fully refreshed lineup. They have signed Brendan " BcJ " Jensen , Amarri " Pa1nt " Peak , Adam " Spaz " Laamoumi , and Jake " Paincakes " Hass , with Brock " brawk " Somerhalder being their only returning player. Erik " vapen " Sutton and Franklin " FIN " Ascencio have also been signed as the head and assistant coach respectively. Moist X Shopify has been a prominent force in North American challengers. After being signed midway through 2023, they quickly ascended to a top team in the league. However, come playoffs, they would be eliminated in third place by the two eventual Ascension finalists, missing the tournament by just one game. In 2024, MXS were strong contenders for Ascension, once again proving themselves as a top team throughout the year. For a second time though, they could not maintain their success into playoffs, and once again were eliminated in third place, missing Ascension by the exact same margin two years in a row. After elimination, the roster was scattered to the winds, leaving brawk as the sole returning member. In his third year under the Moist banner, he will be joined by a wealth of fellow tier two prospects. BcJ is the most experienced among them, having attended Champions with XSET in 2022, as well as reaching Ascension finals with M80 . Spaz and Paincakes were both a part of playoff caliber teams in North America's 2024 Challengers league, while Pa1nt was given a brief taste of VCT as a stand-in for MIBR . MXS will debut their new roster in Stage 3 of the North American Challengers league on November 22. Moist x Shopify are now: Brendan " BcJ " Jensen Amarri " Pa1nt " Peak Adam " Spaz " Laamoumi Jake " Paincakes " Hass Brock " brawk " Somerhalder " Connor Larkin " (Manager) Erik " vapen " Sutton (Head coach) Franklin " FIN " Ascencio (Assistant coach)

title: Patch 9.10 brings new changes to Valorant
cleaned_content: Valorant's latest patch introduces many changes. From a new armor variant, to agent changes, to gun changes, here's what Riot brings to the table. The full patch notes have been reproduced below with edits, and can also be read here . ALL PLATFORMS NEW ARMOR Regen Shield We want to expand the strategic and tactical possibilities within the VALORANT competitive sandbox by introducing a new defensive option.Regen Shield has been added to the shop. Cost: 650 Credits Damage Absorption: 25 HP Regeneration Pool: 50 HP Absorbs 100% of incoming damage taken before damage to health occurs. After a brief delay, the shield regenerates by draining any remaining points left in the Regeneration Pool. AGENT UPDATES Cypher Cypher has been a dominant force with his map-wide information gathering and powerful kill setups. Because Cypher's map-wide info is intended to be his unique strength, we want to target the efficacy of his kill potential. We're adjusting the Trap Wire to increase the counterplay time window after hitting it, so that there is more of a balance between a well-crafted setup and enemies deliberately trying to break trap wires. Additionally, this will help team compositions who don't have as much utility to deal with unbreakable traps. Cypher's ultimate has been extra powerful after adding the second reveal and the removal of time restriction on enemy corpses in patch 5.10, so we're bumping up the cost to put it more in-line with other comparable ultimates. Trap Wire: Now has a .5 second windup before the full wallhack reveal applies and fades in. Trap wire now has updated minimap icon treatment to better display what the trap wire is connected to. Neural Theft: Ult Cost 6 >>> 7 Sage Sage has been feeling weak with relatively low pick rate in high-level play. We want to continue to hone in her ability to stall and slow down attackers when pushing into areas her team controls. With the added dash speed reduction on Slowing Orb, well-timed, proactive casts of her Slowing Orb should feel rewarding and make slows a more meaningful debuff against duelists with dashes. Healing Orb: Self Heal 30HP >>> 50HP Heal time matched to ally heal at around 5 seconds Slowing Orb: Now will additionally reduce the dash speed of enemies caught inside the slowing zone by 50% similar to the Concuss changes in the Gameplay Systems Updates later in the patch notes. Resurrection: Ult Cost 8 >>> 7 Deadlock Deadlock's ultimate will now always kill the target when the timer expires and they are not freed from the nanowire cocoon. Previously, captured targets only died if they reached the end location before the timer expired. Deadlock's visuals for health on the Annihilation Cocoon and Barrier Mesh have been updated to make their health states more clear. Omen Omen has been a mainstay controller in high-level play for a long time. He particularly shines in his ability to create ambiguity throughout a round with the low cooldowns on his smokes. However, Omen's ability to place one-way smokes inside level geometry provides significant defensive power with low counterplay. We'll be keeping an eye out here for how these changes affect the overall controller ecosystem. Dark Cover: Dark Cover will now always fall to level geometry where players can stand similar to other spherical smokes like Brimstone's Sky Smoke, Clove's Ruse, etc. This should prevent Omen from placing one-way smokes on small ornamental pieces of geometry, like the fuse boxes in the main of Split B and only allow him to place smokes where players can stand. Clove Ruse: Ally vs enemy clarity around Ruse casts for both alive and dead casts of smokes have been improved. Enemy smokes updated to appear more red than ally smokes Not Dead Yet: Time to get a kill: 12s >>> 10s This change had been made accidentally in Patch 8.11 when fixing another bug, but the ultimate has been performing well at this tuning. Phoenix Following up from our updates to Duelist in 8.11, we're taking an opportunity to let Phoenix shine brighter as the bold and confident duelist he is. His updates encourage him to get back to the fight quickly, break into sites with his Curve Ball and reward him for succeeding on entry. Phoenix now applies a Heal over time to himself whenever he touches his flames which persists even if he leaves the fire. This allows him to dip into his flames and then continue to press the offense. Curve Ball: Changed to the signature ability slot Grants a free charge on round start 2 kill reset to generate an additional charge Hot Hands: Changed to a non-signature ability Cost 200 credits Blaze: We want to support Phoenix's hybrid “jack of all trades” utility value by allowing him to cast Blaze from safety for his teammates similar to other vision-blocking utility. Initial projectile goes through walls, allowing Blaze to function similarly to Harbor's High Tide. Jett Drift (Passive) Balance-impacting bug fix: Jett can no longer float while suppressed or detained. WEAPONS UPDATES We're making some tuning adjustments to weapons. As VALORANT has grown and evolved, you all have learned how to take advantage of different methods of swinging and peeking. Because of the way bullet tagging in VALORANT works (slowing down when shots land on you), shot players are often tagged and then slowed down into the walking state and as a result their weapons become quickly more accurate. We want to maintain this intuitive relationship between player movement speed and accuracy, so we're opting to increase all moving state accuracy penalties (AKA “movement error”) and encourage intentionality in movement when shooting. The Sheriff and the Frenzy already have different movement error inaccuracies compared to the other pistols, which are valuable to maintain for the sake of their identities. SMGs are unaffected, as we believe that their mobile accuracy is a core part of how the weapons are unique within the arsenal. The Ghost having more bullets than the Frenzy didn't make intuitive sense given their unique strength and weakness profiles amongst the pistols. Pistols All Pistols (except the shorty) Moving while crouching Inaccuracy: .1 >>> .5 Classic Right Click Running Inaccuracy: 1.3 >>> 1.5 Right Click Burst Jumping Inaccuracy: 2.1 >>> 2.25 Walking Inaccuracy: 0.84 >>> 1.1 Run Inaccuracy: 2 >>> 2.3 Frenzy Bullet Count Increased 13 >>> 15 Ghost Walking Inaccuracy: 0.84 >>> 1.1 Run Inaccuracy: 2 >>> 2.3 Bullet Count Reduced 15 >>> 13 Rifles All Rifles Walk Inaccuracy: 2 >>> 3 Run Inaccuracy: 5 >> 6 Machine Guns All Machine Guns Walk Inaccuracy: 2.4 >>> 3 Run Inaccuracy: 6 >>> 6.5 Phantom There have been fewer Phantom purchases over time with new maps being released and higher proficiency in shooting. The Phantom and Vandal's current differences are intended to keep their identities unique while still being relatively competitive with each other. These changes are intended to make the Phantom feel better to use primarily and reduce frustrating instances of headshots doing less damage than expected at different distances. These breakpoints will remove some instances of 140 headshots and all instances of 124 in 1 headshots (excluding wall penetration). Damage fall-off changed: Previously: 39 damage per bullet (0 - 15m) 35 damage per bullet (15 - 30m) 31 damage per bullet (30m+) Now: 39 damage per bullet (0 - 20m) 35 damage per bullet (20m+) MAP UPDATES Sunset We updated global lighting for the entire map. Players should see an improvement in lighting quality and general visibility in previously darker portions of the map. GAMEPLAY SYSTEMS UPDATES The changes to the gameplay systems in this patch are to better support VALORANT's tactical gameplay. The combat report is intended to share in-game information easily. We're always paying attention to how these systems are playing out, including ways that those systems can be used to create advantages that are counter to their intended use cases. Combat Report While the combat report should be a tool to provide gameplay context for what your impact was within a round of VALORANT, it has the occasional downside of leaking information to you that you otherwise would have had no way of knowing. This happens most often with utility, such as Breach's Flashpoint or Skye's Guiding Light: You use your utility and get killed, but inadvertently also discover you blinded players you never saw or engaged with. With these kinds of cases in mind, we're making a change to the Combat Report: Your utility usage statistics now appear once the round has resolved rather than immediately upon death. In its place, you will see an animated hourglass. Once the round ends, utility usage statistics will become available and persist through pre-round of the next round. Concusses Well-placed concusses should be just as consequential for our movement-oriented Duelists as other agents. We also think this strengthens defensive teleports compared to dashes as more flexible repositioning options to compensate for their weakness in entry capabilities. Concusses now slow enemy dashes by 50% This affects Jett's Tailwind and Neon's Slide. Overheal UI Visual Update We've updated the way we show overheal shields in the bottom HUD to improve legibility. This affects how we show bonus HP after using Reyna's Devour and Clove's Pick-Me-Up. Smoke Visual Update Visual cues have been added to the inside of the smoke to let you know when they are about to disappear to better support decision making. These cues match up with the ones that exist on the outside of the smoke. The following Agents' smokes have been affected: Astra Brimstone Omen Clove BUG FIXES Agents Killjoy Fixed a bug with Alarm Bot where it did not play the proper reactivation ceremony and would instantly reactivate when Killjoy reentered its range. Clove Fixed a bug where Meddle was hitting through level geometry. Maps Fixed an issue where ambient audio elements were not playing pre-round for Pearl, Breeze, and Sunset. PC PREMIER UPDATES Added a visual divider on Invite Division standings that shows the cutoff for demotion at the end of Stage E9A3. Teams below the divider after standings finalize will be demoted at the start of the next Stage. Added a message that notifies you if your team has qualified for playoffs. The first time you return to the Premier hub after your team has met the qualification requirements, you'll see the message. Added a Contender Eligibility expiration date on the Premier tab of the Career page. Contender Eligibility for 2024 expires at the end of Stage E9A3. To be Contender Eligible in 2025, you and your team must perform a qualifying action in Stage E9A3 or at any point in 2025. Qualifying actions include: Play a Weekly or Playoff match on a team in Contender or Invite Division. Reach Immortal 3 or higher peak rank in Competitive. Play in a Playoff match in Elite 5. CLIENT UPDATES Added QR Code Login feature for Riot Client using Riot Mobile App If you log in to VALORANT through the Riot Client, you can now scan a QR Code and log in through the Riot Mobile App. No more typing in your Riot ID and password - open Riot Mobile, scan the code, and you're in. Learn more about Riot Mobile here . BUG FIXES Premier Fixed an issue where games in a best of 3 match were all listed as finals in Premier match history. Games are now correctly listed as Game 1, Game 2, or Game 3. Console BUG FIXES Agents Fixed an issue where sensitivity is severely reduced when using Jett and Raze ultimate abilities until engaging Focus.

title: TSM rebuilds ahead of Split 3
cleaned_content: TSM has announced their rebuilt roster ahead of Split 3 of NA Challengers 2024. Tyler " sym " Porter returns as a starter alongside former QoR members Travis " tdawgg " Regan and Damion " XXiF " Cook . After fighting their way through the Open Qualifiers of NA Challengers, tdawwg and XXiF managed to secure a spot alongside the many other seasoned talents of North America. Under QoR, the duo took on Group A of Split 1 and managed to advance to the Mid Season Cup , where they finished among the top eight. Unfortunately, the team could not replicate their previous results in Split 2 and consequently finished dead last in Group A, just barely avoiding Relegation by one placement. From there, tdawwg and XXiF would eventually part ways with the organization in search of new opportunities. After missing out on 2023's Americas: Ascension by falling to its eventual winners, sym departed Moist Moguls and attempted to fight his way through the 2024 Challengers Open Qualifiers with Lemonade Stand . Unfortunately, his time with the team did not generate much success in the moment, but his skills landed him a spot on TSM, who were intent on making a deep run throughout Challengers. Despite never being in contention of making 2024's Americas: Ascension , TSM waited patiently with their heads down and bided their time throughout Challengers. The squad advanced to the next stage of Split 2's with a 3-3 record in Groups, and began preparing for the qualification playoffs. After initially falling to M80 , TSM faced an early finish to their year in the lower bracket. However, intent on booking tickets to Brazil, the team struck down SaD Esports and Blinn before upsetting Oxygen Esports and Moist x Shopify to secure North America's second seed at Ascension. Unfortunately, TSM's story seemed to end with that final achievement. The team picked up a single win on Mexico's stage against Galorys before bombing out of playoffs with a 1-4 record. Shortly after, the organization released sym, Kevin " POISED " Ngo , Alex " aproto " Protopapas , as well as Head Coach Daniel " Faded " Hwang and began preparing for Split 3. Now, TSM seem hungry for more than just an appearance at Ascension and aim to showcase their new roster ahead of the 2025 VCT. TSM is now: Johann " seven " Hernandez Anthony " gMd " Guimond Tyler " sym " Porter Travis " tdawgg " Regan Damion " XXiF " Cook

title: Shopify Rebellion sweeps MIBR GC to lift back-to-back Game Changers Championships
cleaned_content: Capping off a dominant Game Changers 2024 Championship that did not see them drop a single map, Shopify Rebellion Gold defeated MIBR GC 3-0 to claim their second-straight GCC trophy. The best-of-five series played itself out on three maps on Pearl, Sunset, and Haven. Shopify Rebellion picked Pearl and Haven, while MIBR picked Sunset and Abyss. Having entered this match from the upper bracket, Shopify Rebellion had the double map ban, and chose to avoid Split and Bind. Shopify Rebellion won Pearl 13-7, Sunset 13-7, and Haven 13-11 while Abyss and Ascent, MIBR's second pick and the decider, were unnecessary. Almost a year to the day after acquiring the Version1 roster, Shopify Rebellion has won their second international championship with the same core. Beginning on the attack side of Pearl, MIBR had the opportunity to set the tempo on not just the map, but the series. Duelist florescent threw the first punch of the series though, racking up seven kills in the first two rounds by way of her Sheriff and her Outlaw to collect ultimate points early. Three shots, four kills for florescent. Shopify Rebellion's double-Initiator team composition offered them plenty of information on the large two-site map, offering an entertaining clash with the double-Controller composition of MIBR. On a map as large as Pearl which requires so much time to rotate, SR carried the advantage heading into the second half. Moments of heroics from alexis pushed them to map point, and SR wrapped things up two rounds later. A huge 3K for SR alexis to cap off a retake and reach map point. Shifting to Sunset, Shopify Rebellion rode their momentum from Pearl. Now beginning on the attack side, the key to the map appeared to be doing what they were good at. florescent ended the map with a 24-kill performance. Ten of those kills were first-bloods for the entry frag. After switching sides and losing the pistol, anti-eco, and bonus rounds, MIBR threatened to snowball their way into a comeback. They cut a six-round halftime lead in half and carried five rifles into the next round, but walked their way into a SR-shaped trap. Four shots, three kills this time for florescent. The rest of Sunset was smooth sailing for Shopify Rebellion. They never trailed in the map after dropping the first two rounds of the map, and built on their 9-3 halftime lead to go up 2-0. The third map of the series, Haven, was a map that MIBR was yet to play at GCC, while Shopify Rebellion has played it twice before. After winning the pistol and anti-eco rounds with relative ease, MIBR dropped their bonus round, but bounced back to claim a 3-1 lead. With momentum building, SR seemed to have a clear read on their opponents and put a stop to that run, claiming a round thanks to an impressive show of mechanics from Sentinel player Noia . MIBR play their ways into a Noia ace. Down five rounds to three with their opponents carrying a healthy economy into the next round, MIBR forced SR head coach effys to call a timeout to regroup his team. Whatever was said in the timeout appeared to have worked, as Shopify won two of the next four rounds to grab five in the defense half of a generally attack-sided map. After ending the first halves of the first two maps with 9-3 leads, SR had ground to make up on Haven, facing a 7-5 deficit once the teams switched sides. Victories in the pistol and anti-eco rounds quickly returned the map to a deadlock, and while they did drop the bonus, they entered it with a flourishing economy. After razor-thin margins between the teams kept them tied or within two rounds of each other for the rest of the second half, they continued to build a strong economy. A hero buy Vandal from MIBR duelist srN was not enough to stop the bleeding in the 22nd round, and SR found series point. While MIBR clawed one back, it was goodnight from Berlin soon after. A florescent 4K to end GCC 24. Storybook ending? Shopify Rebellion lifts not just their second-straight Game Changers Championship trophy, but their second straight in dominant fashion. In last year's competition, they did so without dropping just three maps. They outdid themselves in this year's competition, not dropping a single map and capping another unbeaten GCC campaign. Superstar duelist florescent dropped 74 kills and an ACS of 317, both server-highs while MIBR duelist srN had a team-high 44. Florescent won the GCC MVP award unanimously, earning 100 percent of the votes in the process. “I'm happy, it looks nice,” florescent said after receiving the bracelet awarded for earning the accolade. “I thought I'd just play ranked for the rest of my life, so this is pretty nice,” she said. Shortly after, she spoke to the mic, drawing “oohs” from the Berlin crowd. “I just want to play against the best of the best always cause it's the most fun,” she said, teasing the possibility of playing outside of Game Changers in the near future. When asked what her dream in professional Valorant was, she responded: “I don't know, probably just like, go to Champs and go to a bunch of events and meet a bunch of cool people.” “I'm honestly incredibly proud,” effys said after the match. “Not just now but the entire past few months, I just think everybody's just gone on they've played between like eight and 12 hours and not complained at all. So yeah, right now I'm proud. Win or lose I would have been proud regardless.”

title: Titan Esports Club's LockM retires
cleaned_content: Titan Esports Club has announced that player Xing " LockM " Fuling (邢福凌) has retired from Valorant. "After full and friendly negotiation and communication between the two parties, LockM (Xing Fuling) officially retires today," the TEC statement said. LockM began his professional Valorant career in 2022 with Weibo Gaming , and found himself on Griffin E-Sports , JiJieHao , and Night Wings Gaming before landing on TEC's roster ahead of the 2024 season. He has been an Initiator player for most of his career, but has also played the Controller role on dual-Controller team compositions. With LockM in 2024, TEC fell far short of any lofty expectations. A promising start at China Kickoff saw them fall short of the playoffs by being eliminated in the play-ins, but they never returned to that form. Through China Stage 1 and Stage 2 they totaled just three victories, and nine maps. Mid-season changes saw the team part ways with players shameless and QiuYe and shifted assistant coach York to a player role, though he would never take the stage. Since the end of the season, they have parted ways with York, and signed Haodong as a player and AfteR as their coach. The pair joined from Champions -winning EDward Gaming , where Haodong played a behind-the-scenes role in coaching after his benching, while After was in an inactive role since June. In the 2024 OFF//SEASON, TEC has participated in the WALL-E Cup , achieving a last-placed 7th-8th place finish, and the FGC Invitational , where they finished 7th-8th in a field of 10. Titan Esports moves forward with a six-man roster, and founding member B1ack will remain as their sixth man. Titan Esports Club 's roster for the 2025 season is now: Wei " AC " Jiacong (韦家聪) Guo " Haodong " Haodong (郭浩东) Han " Abo " Bohao (韩博皓) Piao " kawaii " Min (朴民) Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) Li " B1ack " Songtai (李松泰) Li " Gazero " Zhe (李哲) (Manager) Liu " 3water " Miao (刘淼) (Head coach) Lo " AfteR " Wen-Hsin (罗文信) (Coach)

title: LOUD signs dgzin and v1nny
cleaned_content: LOUD has completed their roster for the 2025 season, signing Douglas " dgzin " Silva and Vínicius " v1nny " Gonçalves . dgzin joins after spending the 2024 season with Brazilian Challengers side Hero Base . The Duelist, who throughout his four-year career has mostly played Jett, joins his first tier 1 team since a one-and-a-half season-long stint with FURIA in 2022-23. He's also played for UNIÃO , Gamelanders Blue , Stars Horizon , and B4 Esports since making his debut in 2021. v1nny, who is expected to be the team's in-game leader, also joins from the Brazilian Challengers circuit. He most recently played for RED Canids , and was a flex player for them, filling the Sentinel, Initiator, and Controller roles. His primary role, however, is the Initiator role. He's played the most games in his career on Skye and Sova. He previously played for TropiCaos , Gamelanders Blue, Stars Horizon and B4 Esports. He reunites with dgzin after the pair were teammates on three different teams before while playing for Gamelanders Blue, Stars Horizon and B4 Esports. LOUD player pANcada was also teammates with v1nny on TERROR.NET in 2020. LOUD were tasked with reconstructing their roster after longtime players saadhak and Less left for EMEA teams following the 2024 season. In 2024, LOUD were runners-up at Americas Kickoff , earning them a spot at Masters Madrid . At Masters, they achieved a fourth-placed finish, falling to Paper Rex in the lower semifinal. However, Madrid was the team's last international event of the season, as they qualified for just one knockout stage through both Stages in the Americas league, and failed to get far enough to qualify. With their five-man roster assembled, LOUD is now: Douglas " dgzin " Silva Vínicius " v1nny " Gonçalves Bryan " pANcada " Luna Arthur " tuyz " Andrade Cauan " cauanzin " Pereira Jordan " stkJ " Nunes (Assistant coach)

title: MIBR sweeps G2 Gozen to reach the grand final
cleaned_content: With a 3-0 scoreline, MIBR GC has defeated G2 Gozen , eliminating the former champions from contention and advancing to the Game Changers 2024 Championship grand final . MIBR will next face off against defending champions Shopify Rebellion, seeking Brazil's first-ever title at the premier Game Changers event. The series was a rematch of an earlier game, where G2 Gozen defeated MIBR 2-1 on their way through the upper bracket. G2 is no stranger to Brazilian lineups, however, as they defeated Team Liquid Brazil in the 2023 upper bracket but lost 2-0 in the lower final. In the map veto, G2 Gozen banned first, taking away their permaban and one of MIBR's better maps , Ascent. MIBR, meanwhile, opted to ban Split, a map which they lost 13-8 to G2 earlier this event. This veto left Abyss, which MIBR has played once since its release, and Sunset, which G2 has not lost in the last five months, as Gozen's picks. MIBR chose Bind, in which they've only lost once in the last two months and defeated G2 13-8, and Haven, where they boast a better record but have not played since August. Pearl remained as the decider map, only the second time MIBR has played the map in 2024 and the first for G2 this season. Abyss kicked off the lower final. The international débutantes quickly shut down the attack's pistol round, but Gozen was quick to respond, winning the eco and anti-eco to recover from the pistol loss. MIBR recovered on the bonus round, taking the lead 4-3 and forcing out their opponent's timeout. G2 won their second thrifty to tie the score, and mimi punished a hesitant defense the next round, leading to a pause from the Brazilian squad ahead of round 10. The timeout helped MIBR adapt, as they tied the score and sent the map to halftime at 6-6. srN forces G2 to save with their attacking Jett Operator The pendulum continued swinging in the second half, as Gozen broke the tie in the pistol round with a Vania clutch. MIBR regained the lead after testing the defense, slowly whittling down the opposition to set the score 9-8. G2 was quick to adapt, recognizing a fake in time to counter MIBR's game plan. An ult-heavy round 19 pushed MIBR into the double digits, and they took advantage of the eco round to extend their lead. MIBR kept applying pressure, switching sites and alternating pace to avoid round losses, closing out the map 13-9. Bind , MIBR's map pick, started off well for the South American lineup. Their reads and early picks helped deny any plan from the attack and put MIBR up 4-0. It wasn't until G2's tactical timeout that they were able to get on the scoreboard, but their two round wins were not enough to break through their defense. srN was instrumental in the half, but sayuri's performance made the difference. Statistically, the in-game leader went to halftime with a 2.11 rating, 17-4 kill-death ratio, and a clutch under her belt. MIBR makes it look easy. The second half was more favorable for the former champions, thanks in part to their unusual defensive trap plays. Gozen was able to take four rounds in a row before an MIBR timeout was called. Despite their recent success, a misplayed round from G2 led to MIBR's first offensive round win and Gozen's own timeout to prevent match point. The round came down to the wire, with sayuri denying a 1v4 clutch from her Danish counterpart. rezq and amy were crucial the next few rounds, their multikills supported by mimi 's Fault Lines. On the other side, srN and sayuri did everything to keep their team in the game, and a pause was enough to push Bind over the line, ending MIBR's map 13-10 and leaving the Brazilian representatives at series point. MIBR continued their momentum for Sunset , taking advantage of their attacking half to take a pacey approach. sayuri confirmed the bonus round in her team's favor with a 3K, forcing G2 to play their second eco round early in the half. A timeout put Gozen on the board, but MIBR remained unfazed. Petra did her best to keep her team in the game, but melissa and jubs closed out their clutches to further extend their lead. srN continued their dominance for the last round of the half, completely taking over impossible duels to grant her team the site and an 11th round win. srN finds a quick 4K In the end, Mel and srN sealed the final two rounds, ending G2 Gozen's run with a 13-1 win and qualifying to the grand final in their first international appearance. In-game leader sayuri and srN were by far the standout players, statistically. srN led the server with a dominant 70 eliminations and 22 first kills, while sayuri scored the highest rating of the server at 1.51, ended +22 in kills vs. deaths, and won four clutches. “I'm proud of my whole team,” jubs said after the series. “We are making history.” The victory means that Brazil will play against North America for the GCC title for the second year in a row, with MIBR equalling Team Liquid Brazil's 2023 achievement. In a similar vein, G2 Gozen, the inaugural Game Changers champions, has been eliminated in third place for the second year in a row, this time on home soil. The organization will need another year if they wish to reclaim the trophy they first won back in 2022. jubs was confident about their next match. “We're pretty comfortable with this streak of energy,” she said. “It's going to be a very good game for us.”

title: MIBR GC defeats Xipto 2-1 to reach lower final
cleaned_content: In a back-and-forth affair, MIBR GC defeated Xipto Esports GC 2-1 to reach the lower final, sending the Pacific champions home with a fourth-placed finish. After surviving elimination the day before, the two regional champions met, fighting for the chance to play in the lower final. The three-map series was played out on Bind, Split, and Sunset with Bind being MIBR's map pick, Split being Xipto's map pick and Sunset being the decider. MIBR won Bind 13-4, Xipto won Split 13-6, and MIBR won Sunset 13-5. MIBR made Bind, their map pick, look easy. Their attack half was well-coordinated and dominant, building an 11-1 lead heading into halftime. Three different MIBR players were fragging in double digits, with duelist srN again leading the way. Playing on Raze, she ended the map with a server-leading 19 kills. As the sides changed, the tides seemed to turn, too. Xipto converted their attacking pistol, anti-eco, and bonus rounds with great teamplay, setting themselves up with a good economy both in the bank and with their ultimate abilities. The momentum swing died, however, on the anti-eco following that bonus. srN makes this Sheriff 3K look easy. The following round exemplified MIBR's continued dominance, playing into their team organization and composition's strengths, pulling off a 4v5 retake. Through Bind, MIBR had allowed just seven rounds across the past three maps. Split, the map that Xipto most recently had defeated FlyQuest RED on, started as almost a mirror of Bind, except it was a different team on top. Xipto jumped out to an 8-1 lead, forcing MIBR head coach Biscoit1n to burn both of his timeouts in just the first half. The high-speed Xipto attack was highlighted by its double-duelist composition. With enerii on Neon and Alexy on Raze, they had little to no trouble taking space on their attacking half. The double-headed Xipto monster of enerii and Alexy. Carrying a 9-3 lead into halftime, Xipto won four of the next seven rounds, turning around a muted map one performance to force a third map, looking for back-to-back comeback victories. The day before, they defeated KRÜ BLAZE after losing the first map 13-6. While srN didn't enjoy her usual dominance on Split, she got back into her groove on Sunset. That momentum was heralded by an ace, assisted by teammate Jelly . By the time the round was over, srN was halfway to her next Raze ult already. The map started back and forth with the first four rounds split evenly, but quietly and quickly ballooned into an 8-4 halftime deficit. Sunset, the map that MIBR defeated ZETA DIVISION GC 13-3 just the day before, continued to be a dominant one for the Brazilian team. A late 4K for Initiator player sayuri helped MIBR to reach match point, and they'd seal the series two rounds later, winning 13-5. “I always try to keep calm,” sayuri said after the match. “I see I'm not killing anyone? It's okay! I'm giving the support at least, and the calls at least.” While srN didn't have the dominant 29-kill performance that she did against ZETA on Sunset, she had a leaderboard-topping 20 kills, including a server-leading six first-bloods. Across all three maps, she also had 53 total kills and 279 ACS, which led the server, while Xipto's Alexy had 44 kills to lead her team. With elimination, Xipto finishes GCC 24 in fourth place for the second year in a row, matching the result that they had as Team SMG GC in GCC 23 . Meanwhile, MIBR continues their campaign and has earned themselves a rematch with G2 Gozen in the best-of-five lower final. G2 Gozen knocked MIBR down into the lower bracket when they met in the upper semifinal, and are coming off of a 2-0 loss to Shopify Rebellion Gold .

title: Shopify Rebellion overcomes G2 Gozen 2-0, advances to grand final
cleaned_content: Shopify Rebellion Gold has defeated G2 Gozen 2-0 in the upper final of the Game Changers Championship 2024 . Shopify now advances to the grand final , while G2 has been sent down to the lower final and will face the winner of Xipto Esports GC versus MIBR GC to determine who will challenge Shopify for the crown. The two-map series played out on Abyss and Haven, Abyss being G2's pick and Haven being Shopify's pick. Shopify won Abyss 17-15 and Haven 14-12. This matchup of juggernauts was a rematch of the upper final of last year's Game Changers Championship , where Shopify won 2-1. However, the tale of this matchup extends even further back to 2022, where G2 defeated meL and alexis when they were part of Cloud9 White . “Last year we finally got them,” meL said in the pre-match teaser . “This one's to settle the score.” The series kicked off on G2's map pick of Abyss. While Shopify was last seen playing Vyse on the map in North America, this time they opted to mirror G2's more standard composition featuring Jett and KAY/O. Shopify opened up an early 6-1 lead off of the back of unstoppable site hits, but a chaotic Sheriff thrifty win in round 8 and an outrageous no-scope Operator shot from rezq in round 9 brought G2 back into the game, narrowing the gap to a 7-5 lead in favor of Shopify at the half. Crisp Sheriff shots give G2 a way back in (with some help from the environment). The second half began with another Shopify pistol win as the North American squad extended their lead to 10-6. Once again, G2 fought back; a 1v3 from rezq in round 17 kept them in the map and a tense 1v1 from Vania in round 24 brought it to overtime. Overtime was a string of constant attack round wins for both sides, but Shopify finally took the long-awaited defense round in the end to win Abyss 17-15. florescent topped the scoreboard with 33 kills, 10 of which were first kills, a 1.37 rating, and 189 ADR, while meL trailed close behind with 25 kills and a rating of 1.21. The next map, Haven, featured another standard mirror matchup as both teams went for Neon-Breach compositions. G2 carried the first pistol to a 4-1 start on their defense, featuring a sharp amy ace in round 5 to avoid a potential thrifty. Shopify answered back with a hard-fought B postplant in round 6 with G2, carrying the momentum to equalize at 4-4. The first half ended at 6-6 after a continued back-and-forth battle. amy stands tall on the C site and takes down Shopify on her own. The two teams stayed neck-and-neck for the rest of the match. Every attempt at breaking away by either team was met with a swift answer; G2 winning the second pistol was countered by Shopify's early buy round wins to keep score tied at 8-8. G2 won a thrifty in round 18 with a 1v2 clutch from amy, but Shopify immediately won a thrifty of their own thanks to a 4K from Noia . It seemed that G2 had finally found stable footing in round 22 when rezq aced with Neon's Overdrive ultimate to take her team up to 12-10. However, Shopify rallied with strong site holds to secure yet another overtime. This time, Shopify ended overtime quickly, demonstrating clean, coordinated plays to take Haven 14-12 and the series 2-0. Experience and teamplay bring Shopify over the line. Statistically, both Cypher players dominated the server. amy ended the map with an impressive 1.47 rating, 29 kills, and 186 ADR, while Noia followed with a 1.35 rating, 25 kills, and 157 ADR. This victory sets Shopify up for an opportunity at winning back-to-back Game Changers championships as they reach the grand final without dropping a map. “I think we just try our best to have fun,” sarahcat said regarding her team in the post-match interview. “The more fun you have, the easier it is to win, the less nervous you are.” Shopify Rebellion will return in the grand final on Nov. 17 with a double map ban advantage. G2 Gozen will next play in the lower final on Nov. 16.

title: Team Vitality welcomes Faded, maLek to coaching staff
cleaned_content: Team Vitality has signed Daniel " Faded " Hwang as their head coach and Damien " maLek " Marcel as the team's strategic manager, pending approval from Riot. Faded spent the 2024 season with American Challengers side TSM , who finished sixth in Americas Ascension . His time with the team was highlighted by upsets over Moist x Shopify and Oxygen Esports , two favorites to reach Ascension from the North American region. Before TSM, Faded was a head coach for BackOutsideBoys and an analyst for FaZe Clan . maLek, a former Counter-Strike: Global Offensive player and then coach, takes up his first position in professional Valorant. The 2024 season was an up-and-down one for Team Vitality. It started with them narrowly missing out on qualification to both of the first two Masters events, being eliminated at the play-ins of EMEA kickoff and finishing fourth in the group stages of a five-way tie in EMEA Stage 1 . Midseason changes were made to the coaching staff, which resulted in the team experiencing an uptick in form in Stage 2 that saw them drop just one match in league play. They finished second in the knockouts, falling in the grand final to FNATIC and qualifying for Champions Seoul . At Champions, they were eliminated in the group stages by eventual-third placed LEVIATÁN . The signings of Faded and maLek round out what's been a busy offseason for the Bees. The team signed big-name international players in FNATIC 's Derke and LOUD 's Less while parting ways with runneR and longtime player ceNder . Following that, a revamp of their coaching staff, ended with them parting ways with longtime head coach salah just a few weeks ago. Team Vitality 's roster is now: Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso Andy " Bangovic " Zajimovic (Manager) Robert " Mulgan95 " Mulgan (Manager) Daniel " Faded " Hwang (Head coach) Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach) Damien " maLek " Marcel (Staff)

title: Xipto lock in top-four finish with 2-1 win over KRÜ
cleaned_content: In a meeting between regional powerhouses, Xipto Esports GC eliminated KRÜ BLAZE , securing a top-four finish in GCC Berlin in the process. The three-map series was played out on Haven and Abyss, with Haven being KRÜ's map pick, Abyss being Xipto's, and Pearl being the decider. KRÜ won Haven 13-6, Xipto won Abyss 13-10, and Xipto won Pearl 13-9. On Haven, KRÜ's defense half was highlighted by early-round aggression which rewarded them with map control. A lobby, C long, and mid were dominated by the Chilean team for much of the first half. Early aggression was always going to be key in a Neon-versus-Neon matchup, and KRÜ's balance of eagerness to fight and patience gave them an 8-4 advantage as they shifted to attack. KRÜ thrived in A Lobby and A Long. The aggression on defense translated well to attack. KRÜ dropped just two rounds in the second half, cruising to a 13-6 win. KRÜ Duelist dods , who currently has the highest total kills at GCC 24, ended the map with 17 kills, while Sentinel player romi ended with a server-high 20. Xipto took to Abyss with an attack-sided team composition. With no Sentinel and opting for a double Controller look, they boasted a lineup of agents that had plenty of post-plant utility. Post-plant play made the attack half a smooth one for Xipto. Astra's Gravity Well, Brimstone's Incendiary and Orbital Strike, KAY/O's FRAG/ment, and Sova's Shock Bolt and Hunter's Fury gave Xipto not just a luxury of options in the post-plant but also plenty of damage-dealing utility to earn them space. The impact of dods, whose best work has come on Neon in this competition, was minimized on Abyss. She had a server-low rating of 0.76, playing on Jett. Back on Neon, Pearl was an opportunity for her to bounce back. Xipto again fielded a zero-Sentinel composition, featuring a double Controller, double Duelist look with Alexy on Jett. If there was any indication that Pearl was going to be a back-and-forth affair, look no further than how it started. The two sides traded the first three rounds, with the fourth being more topsy-turvy than the three that preceded it. A Xipto round! Or... A KRÜ round?! No team won more than three rounds in a row in the second half. That was until Xipto snowballed momentum towards the end of the map, clinching four straight, making their 8-4 halftime advantage all the more valuable. Kamiyu continued her red-hot form into Xipto's attack half. Xipto Initiator player Kamiyu , playing on Fade, had quite possibly her best map of GCC 24, ending with a game-high 29 kills as part of a server-leading 59-kill performance. Following a short-lived run in the lower bracket that saw them eliminate GIANTX GC , KRÜ bow out of the GCC in the 5th-6th position for the second year in a row after being eliminated by the current Xipto core of Team SMG GC last year. After suffering their first defeat in 21 matches across regional, continental and international play, Xipto bounced back and survived. They secured a top-four finish and will play MIBR GC in the lower semifinal. This is their second-straight top-four finish after achieving a fourth-place finish as Team SMG GC in 2023.

title: MIBR GC dominates, eliminates ZETA
cleaned_content: On a day that they could seemingly do no wrong, MIBR GC bounced back and eliminated ZETA DIVISION GC , giving up just three rounds across the 2-0 victory and setting history. Thursday's two-map series was played out on Ascent and Sunset, with Ascent being ZETA's map pick and Sunset being MIBR's. MIBR dominated Ascent 13-0 and clinched Sunset 13-3. ZETA's first full buy round appeared to be an opportunity for them to strike. Two early picks gave them the entirety of the A site with no fallen members. However, a wonderfully orchestrated retake saw MIBR win the bonus and begin to snowball. Jelly 's 3K on MIBR's 3v5 retake was the map's HyperX Reflex Moment. MIBR could do no wrong on Ascent. All the while, it appeared as though the ZETA players couldn't find their footing. Several ZETA attack rounds seemed unlosable that they'd dropped. There were also several that saw them let the clock dwindle too low, resulting in them — on a defense-sided map — playing into the MIBR defense's hands. sayuri 's 3K got MIBR one step closer to 13-0. The round, which was ZETA's fifth full buy round of the game, was followed by MIBR converting on the sixth, and then clinching the pistol round to open the second half and close the map. It's the first 13-0 map victory in the history of GCC. sayuri , playing on Omen, went 14-3 on the map, while Duelist srN 's operator was online for most of the map thanks to the team's flourishing economy. After losing their map pick in sweeping fashion, ZETA had to make up lost ground on the second map, Sunset. They'd clinch their first round of the match, but not before dropping four rounds to MIBR. ZETA's first round of the match came in round 5 of map two. It appeared as though MIBR looked just as good — if not better — on Sunset. Duelist srN, playing on Raze, spearheaded the MIBR attack. They'd end the map with a 512 ACS, the highest in a GCC match ever. MIBR Duelist srN could not put a foot wrong down against ZETA. Their 512 ACS on Sunset was the highest in a GCC match ever. They picked up 25 kills in just the first half of Sunset, and ended the two-map series with server-highs of 394 ACS and 43 kills. “We have a lot of things to show,” srN said after the match. “The other matches we are going to play? Be prepared.” Following a lower bracket run that saw them send two teams home after being sent down in the first round, ZETA Division GC is eliminated, finishing 5th-6th. The finish is the furthest that a Japanese team has made it in a GCC event. With the win, MIBR confirms a top-four finish at this year's GCC and awaits the winner of Xipto Esports GC and KRÜ BLAZE .

title: Shopify confirms top three after defeating Xipto Esports 2-0
cleaned_content: After defeating Xipto Esports GC 2-0 , the defending champion, Shopify Rebellion Gold , has made the top three in the 2024 Game Changers Championship . They will next play against G2 Gozen in the upper bracket final for a spot in the grand final , a repeat of 2023 in which Shopify came out on top . Xipto remains in the tournament, and will next play against KRÜ BLAZE in the lower bracket . Despite both teams reaching the top four in GCC 2023 (with the Xipto core representing Team SMG at the time), this series is the first time the teams have met. As higher seeded teams, the teams only have one Berlin game under their belt, but still had expectations regarding the matchup. “I'm most excited to play against Alexy,” alexis commented on her opponents ahead of the matchup. On the Xipto side, enerii felt recovered after she fell ill upon her arrival at Berlin. “I feel good today. I think I'm at 100% today,” she said before the series. Xipto opted for a double-Duelist, Sentinel-less comp in their map pick . The South East Asian lineup took the pistol and anti-eco round, but Shopify caused enough damage to take the next three rounds. enerii 's Neon led her team to back-to-back retake wins with three separate triple kills, leading to a timeout from the opposing coach, effys . The defending champions recovered, but another 3K from enerii kept the score close, sending the map into halftime with a 6-6. The second pistol came down to the wire, a 1v1 between Kamiyu and meL that went Xipto's way. Their gun advantage was more than enough to take the anti-eco. florescent found a 4K, which led to a pause from Xipto. alexis and Noia held against Xipto's attempts the next two rounds, taking the lead for their team with a 9-8. Another two points for Shopify forced Xipto to request a timeout with coach Colbat , but it was not enough to stop florescent's Operator collateral or counter Noia's A stronghold, which helped end the map 13-8. Shopify's player advantage and Lockdown ends the map “They go in as a tight unit, it's what I expected,” SR coach effys said after Pearl. Xipto took the opening pistol round on Sunset . Their offense was able to confirm the anti-eco, but Shopify won the next three rounds to take the lead and force out Xipto's timeout. The pause helped the South East Asian squad equalize, only for Shopify to break the tie after a set play and anti-eco win. Xipto recovered, with a clutch from Tara setting them up to win the last four rounds of the half. sarahcat gets maximum value from Sova to secure the plant for their team Now on defense, Xipto won their fourth pistol round of the series. florescent helped deny the anti-eco, and Shopify continued taking rounds, equalizing at 8-8 and taking the lead a round later. Xipto closed the gap the following round after a shirazi clutch, setting off a back-and-forth in which both teams won one round each and took the following anti-eco. Shopify returned to B site for their final rounds, setting up a B main post-plant with their utility. Alexy did her best to deny Shopify the series, but their oppressive tactic and slight economic advantage was just enough to end the map 13-11 in the North American squad's favor and closing the series 2-0. The win sets Shopify up for a repeat of the 2023 upper final, in which Shopify Rebellion defeated G2 Gozen on their way to the trophy. The defending champions' core duo, alexis and meL, has now reached the top four at GCC for a third year in a row, having finished in fourth in 2022 and winning the 2023 version of the event. Similarly, Shopify Rebellion as an organization has been in the top three in all previous events, making the 2022 grand final with a different roster. Xipto Esports, on the other hand, will need to defeat KRÜ BLAZE in order to match their record as a core, having reached the top four in the Game Changers 2023 Championship as Team SMG.

title: G2 Gozen returns to upper bracket final with 2-1 over MIBR GC
cleaned_content: G2 Gozen have defeated MIBR GC 2-1 in the Game Changers 2024 Championship upper semifinal . Gozen is now in the upper bracket final , where they will face off against either Shopify Rebellion Gold or Xipto Esports GC for a place in the grand final . MIBR, meanwhile, remain in the tournament, where they will play against ZETA DIVISION GC in the lower bracket. With MIBR making their international debut, the series is the first time both teams have played against each other. G2 Gozen has history with a different Brazilian team, however, as they have a 2-1 series record in their favor against Team Liquid Brazil . The loss came in the GCC 2023 lower final , where Gozen was eliminated from the tournament and left unable to defend their title. MIBR defeated Liquid twice on their qualifying run, taking Brazil's sole slot in this year's Championship. The match began on Bind , with G2 barely taking the opening pistol round. MIBR was able to win a couple of rounds thanks to their economic advantage from previous rounds, but a thrifty win from G2 led to a timeout from the Brazilian squad. This started a back-and-forth between the teams, as MIBR adapted with utility-heavy strongholds and G2 responded in kind with patient site takes. Petra gets an ace as she tries to keep her team in the game The first half ended 6-6, but MIBR kept their pace going into the second pistol, taking the lead for the first time in the series. Their success continued, as MIBR was able to string together a handful of rounds, forcing their opponent's second pause of the map. The timeout helped G2 get back on the scoreboard, capped off by a Petra ace. In the end, MIBR overwhelmed B site to win their last two rounds, ending their map 13-8. “We were having issues on defense, we were very passive,” Vania said after the match regarding G2's Bind. Moving on to Gozen's map pick, Split , the 2022 champions won their second opening round of the series with a solid retake on the A site. MIBR's continued aggression helped them take the bonus round, but G2 was able to stifle their pushes the next rounds. An amy spawn crunch preceded MIBR's first tactical pause of the map, but the Brazilian team's low funds and a triple kill from Petra continued extending G2's lead. It took heavy aggression from MIBR for them to return get back on board, led by srN 's Raze to an additional three round wins for an 8-4 half. amy anticipates MIBR's aggressive post-plant Despite losing the pistol round, MIBR was able to secure their eco round with a Classic deathball stack. They continued scoring rounds, thanks in part to individual heroics, but G2 remained in the lead throughout the half. In the end, Gozen was able to identify their opponent's weak A setup, and they were able to exploit MIBR's alternating retake and early ramp hold to seal their map 13-8. Sunset extended G2's lead in pistol wins, but the anti-eco was once again countered by an MIBR set play. Both teams won one round each, but early mid holds from Petra led to a timeout for their opponents. Her heroics continued, however, as she won a 1v2 clutch to further extend the score gap. Seemingly inspired by her teammate, Vania stepped up to bat, setting a retake up for success with a triple kill and winning the next in a clutch of her own. The duo closed out the last round of the half with 2 kills each on a B hold, sending the decider into halftime with a 10-2 score. Vania extends G2's lead with a 1v3 MIBR was able to win the second pistol of the decider map, taking the anti-eco with a Mel 3K, but G2 was set on ending the series in their favor. A methodical push gave the former champions their 11th round, and mimi took her team to match point with a 1v2 win. MIBR's second timeout came and went, as rezq 's Neon disrespected MIBR's B setup with the help of her team's utility, ending the map 13-4 and closing out the series 2-1. “We just continued playing our own game, the way we practiced,” Vania said after the series. “When [Petra] won that was the most exciting clutch,” she added. The victory marks G2 Gozen's return to a Game Changers Championship upper final, the first and only team to make the event's podium via the upper bracket three different times. They will next play against the winner of Shopify Rebellion vs Xipto Esports for a place in the grand final. MIBR GC will need to win two more series if they wish to continue Brazil's streak of top three finishes, first established by Team Liquid Brazil in 2022 and upheld in 2023 with Liquid's grand final appearance.

title: 2Game Esports completes roster with gobera
cleaned_content: In preparation of its debut season in VCT, Americas Ascension champions 2Game Esports have signed Vitor " gobera " Gobo to complete their roster. While gobera will be the sixth person on the team's roster, he will look to replace the activity of spike , who cannot play due to VCT's rules of only allowing players above the age of 18 to compete. gobera joins 2G after spending the 2024 season with Brazilian Challengers team Legacy . The organization disbanded shortly after its phase 2 elimination in the Brazilian VCL's Split 2 campaign. He made his Valorant debut in 2021, previously playing for Brazilian organizations such as DIRETORIA , The Union , and XIT . The role of spike, who played as the team's duelist or the initiator depending on the team's composition and the map it played on, is expected to be the role that gobera fills. He played as mainly as Legacy's Duelist this past season and has shown an ability to play all Duelist agents, but has done most of his work on Jett and Raze. spike turns 18 in June, giving 2Game an aspect of flexibility to shuffle their roster around if needed. 2Game Esports 's roster is now: Vitor " gobera " Gobo Brenno " Zap " Roberto Luis-Henrique " pryze " Viveiros Luiz " lz " Reche Rodrigo " spike " Lombardi Caio " silentzz " Morita Anderson " faithz0r " Yabusaki (Head coach) Luiz " Yushi " Felipe Coelho (Coach)

title: KRÜ BLAZE sweeps GIANTX GC in lower bracket
cleaned_content: KRÜ BLAZE swept GIANTX GC 2-0 to eliminate another EMEA team in the Game Changers 2024 Championship. Despite losing to an EMEA team in the upper bracket, KRÜ fought back to win two convincing maps to stay alive in Berlin. The series started with KRÜ BLAZE picking Bind, with GX picking the defense side first. The first pistol went in favor of GIANTX GC thanks to a great nade from Smurfette . Their unique Bind composition of Harbor, Sage, and Viper introduced two different wall smokes and a potential Sage wall for opponents to break through, but KRÜ fought to get the spike down quickly to secure round wins. The map was even at the half, but KRÜ won their defense side pistol round and biazik helped secure a bonus round win to extend their lead to 10-6. biazik gets two Outlaw headshots to secure a bonus round win against GIANTX GC. KRÜ BLAZE almost ran away with the map, but the utility from GX made their post-plants tough to stop. Miyori clutched a round to complete a mini-comeback, and GX tied the map at 10-10 and 12-12 to take it to overtime. miyori clutches a 1v3 to help keep Bind close. When overtime began, that was when dods and her Neon stepped up to quickly end the hopes of a scrappy win for GX, as KRÜ won Bind 14-12 to take the series lead. Split was next, with GIANTX GC using another unexpected composition change to try and surprise KRÜ, this time with Miyori moving to Raze. KRÜ got the first-half pistol win, but GX took a good eco round and used it to win four rounds in a row. KRÜ bounced back, mainly thanks to an ace from conir . conir gets an ace against GIANTX GC. KRÜ adapted to play a more aggressive defense, entering the half up 7-5 and securing the second-half pistol round to keep the pressure on GX. Just like on Bind, GX started to win rounds to hint at a comeback, but KRÜ stepped up and ended the map 13-9 to eliminate GX from the Game Changers 2024 Championship and keep their run alive. The MVP of this series was dods, who was the catalyst on Bind's overtime for their first map win and afterward got 27 kills on Split to close the series out. They led the series with 44 kills, 13 first kills, and 176 damage per round to keep KRÜ in the running for the 2024 title.

title: ZETA fights through lowers with sweep over Team Falcons Vega
cleaned_content: ZETA DIVISION GC has defeated Team Falcons Vega 2-0 in the lower bracket of the Game Changers 2024 Championship, continuing their lower bracket run in Berlin. ZETA looked to have built confidence after their win over FlyQuest RED , with their defense proving tough to beat in this win over Falcons. Where ZETA had to prove their worth in the Championship tournament against FlyQuest RED, now the pressure was on Team Falcons Vega to rebound after getting swept into the lower bracket by Shopify Rebellion Gold , with no more second changes in the double-elimination format. The series began with ZETA choosing Ascent for map one, starting on the attack side. After winning the pistol round, ZETA struggled to get more round wins and entered the half down 8-4. Team Falcons Vega had that lead thanks to a 15-kill half from madv . ZETA's top performer from the first half was Moco , and their Spectre 4K on their defensive bonus round helped steamroll a perfect second half to win Ascent 13-8. SereNa was key to their defensive round wins, and worked alongside Moco to make their defense easy. Team Falcon Vega's pick of Haven was next, with the team needing to improve after a 13-4 map loss in their upper bracket series against Shopify. ZETA started quickly with another pistol round win, with suzu and Moco combining for a clean site retake on defense. Their Breach-focused retakes were proving tough for Falcons to manage, with aco landing key shots to help win rounds along with their utility. aco helps ZETA retake A site on Haven. Then, suzu and ZETA decided to disrupt their opponent's plans by pushing aggressively after a timeout. The Sova, Breach, and Neon ults forced Falcons to play it safe, and suzu got four kills with her ult to secure the round. suzu rushes into Falcons' spawn to get four kills. Falcons managed to win the final two rounds of their attack half to swap sides only down 8-4, just as ZETA did on the previous map. Falcons got their defensive pistol round, to keep the map within reach, but then both teams traded round wins, which only favored the team ahead in the scoreline. ZETA closed the map out 13-7 and swept Falcons Vega to eliminate them from the tournament and continue their lower bracket run. The MVP for this series was SereNa , locking down sites on both Killjoy and Cypher and ending the series with a series-leading 38 kills and a 1.26 match rating. ZETA had a lockdown defense, winning 14 of their 17 defensive rounds across both maps, and SereNa was crucial in that Sentinel position.

title: GiantX stay alive with 2-0 win over ALG
cleaned_content: GIANTX GC have found their first win in the lower bracket of the Game Changers Championship against Ambitious Legend Gaming GC 2-0. In their respective opening games, GiantX lost to MIBR GC while ALG went down to Team Falcons Vega , setting up today's game. For ALG, XiMiLu was subbing in place of 1hp due to health issues. Compared to GiantX's storied experience and considerable prior LAN experience, ALG had only played three maps in the China playoffs before making it to Berlin. Ness and Smurfette in particular were happ Haven was chosen by ALG and saw them open off with a pistol win. Once both teams got their full-buys, the map saw a consistent tug of war culminating in a 6-6 half. This trend continued in the second half with ALG taking a small lead at 10-9 but consecutive 3Ks from Miyori and ness saw GiantX gain the momentum to win the map 13-4. While only Yusin went positive on ALG's side, four of GiantX's players managed the same feat. GiantX's retakes were clean. Map two saw GiantX opt for one of their best maps and their experience on Ascent was clear to see, with a 11-1 first half. The combined efforts of Miyori and Joliinaa saw a six round win streak, and the only round that ALG won was thanks to XiMiLu taking down Miyori in a 1v1. The decision to let GiantX start on defense on Ascent was also a key factor in the map being so dominant for the European squad. That one round was all ALG would get and a 13-1 victory for GiantX saw ALG eliminated from the event. GiantX had found ten first kills across the map, compared to the four from ALG to boot. Smurfette pops off with a crucial 3K. For GiantX, both Joliinaa and Miyori had standout performances on both maps, with the former having a +20 kill differential on the Omen. While all of GiantX went positive in terms of K/D, the opposite was true for ALG. Overall, GiantX were able to consistently funnel their opponents into fights where they had advantages, and capitalized to find a win, especially on Ascent. GiantX will face off against KRÜ BLAZE next to keep their tournament hopes alive.

title: ZETA eliminate Flyquest Red with a 2-1 win
cleaned_content: ZETA DIVISION GC has taken down FlyQuest RED 2-1 in the lower bracket of Game Changers 2024 Championship. While ZETA had lost to KRÜ BLAZE , Flyquest had fallen to the Pacific first seed Xipto Esports GC . For Flyquest, L4ce was playing in place of sonder , as the latter was not feeling well. While Flyquest had fought hard against Xipto Esports, with map three heading into OT before their loss, ZETA was seeking redemption after a 2-0 loss, and suzu especially wanted to be sure they didn't leave Berlin without a single win. The series commenced on Haven, chosen by ZETA where Flyquest got off to a blistering 7-1 start. Evv and Starbound between them had 25 kills in the first half alone. ZETA recovered with three rounds to end the half 8-4 in Flyquest's favor, but with Flyquest winning the second pistol and the upcoming buy round, they locked in their victory 13-6. Flyquest's post-plants looked clean on map 1. Map two was Sunset, and while the first few rounds saw Flyquest lead 4-2, ZETA's suzu decided to take matters into her own hands and with her consistent paintshell kills, ZETA countered with five rounds of their own, and the half ended 7-5 in ZETA's favor. After the sideswap, suzu continued her rampage, finding 20 kills in just the second half — more than anyone else on Flyquest had in the whole game. ZETA took the win 13-10 to push the series to map 3. Suzu the killing machine. The momentum of the previous map seemed to carry over for ZETA and suzu both on Ascent, with the Pacific representatives finding a blistering 6-1 start. Moco and suzu between them were able to dominate the first half, with the former finding two consecutive 3Ks in crucial rounds to ensure ZETA's dominance. Moco's two consecutive 3Ks paved the way for ZETA's win. Despite two more rounds being found by Flyquest in the half, the 9-3 scoreline saw ZETA division with a massive lead. Despite Flyquest trying to stay in the running with a pistol win, ZETA would not be denied, and closed it out 13-5 to eliminate Flyquest and find their first win in Berlin. Suzu was the MVP for ZETA with a +20 kill differential, 11 first kills, and an average ACS of 300 through the series. ZETA will face Team Falcons Vega in their upcoming lower bracket game, while Flyquest are out of the GCC.

title: Karmine Corp completes roster rebuild, sign four
cleaned_content: As part of their roster revamp ahead of the 2025 season, Karmine Corp has announced the signings of Dmitry " SUYGETSU " Ilyushin , Efe " Elite " Teber , Hazem " Avez " Khaled , and legendary in-game leader Matias " saadhak " Delipetro . Karmine Corp's roster realignment began in September, when they parted ways with tomaszy , sh1n , and MAGNUM . sh1n has since joined DVM Esport , while the other two players remain on Karmine Corp's inactive roster. American import N4RRATE moved to Sentinels, clearing the way for the team to bring in another import. Saadhak joins a team that, for the better part of the 2024 season, had been on the outside looking in within the EMEA region. He holds a reputation as one of the world's best in-game leaders, and is looking to bring Karmine Corp towards its first international VCT trophy in the organization's history. The Argentinian was with LOUD since the organization's inaugural 2022 season, and had a successful time with them. With the Brazilian outfit, he lifted trophies at 2023 Americas League and Champions Istanbul , while also achieving several podium finishes. While he is most well-known for his play on more traditional IGL agents such as KAY/O, Cypher or Killjoy, he expanded his agent pool in 2024, picking up Neon following the duelist's mid-season buffs. Suygetsu arrives holding a vast amount of experience, having played for FunPlus Phoenix prior to the organization's relocation to the Chinese region. With FPX, he lifted Masters Copenhagen , and was then signed by Natus Vincere along with the rest of the team. Avez joins after two seasons with NASR Esports . While he was a duelist player for much of his career, he played different roles towards the end of his time with NASR, picking up Viper, Sova, and Fade among others. Elite joins after spending the last two seasons with Turkish organizations. He played for BBL Esports this past season, and Papara SuperMassive in 2023. He was BBL's Sentinel player, most often on Killjoy and Cypher. To begin the 2024 season, Karmine Corp lifted EMEA Kickoff , upsetting FNATIC before defeating Team Heretics in the grand final to claim the region's top seed at Masters Madrid . At Madrid, they opened with a win over FunPlus Phoenix , but went on to lose to eventual winners Sentinels and third-placed Paper Rex , being eliminated in the Swiss Stage. Following elimination at Masters Madrid, Karmine Corp failed to reach the international stage again in 2024, going home early in the playoffs of both EMEA Stage 1 and Stage 2 . At the end of the season, they were short of qualifying for Champions Seoul through championship points, falling three points behind FUT Esports . Still, 2024 was a more successful season for the France-based organization than 2023. They won just four matches in 2023, failing to qualify for any international events in the process. The team's roster was announced just moments before it took the stage at the KCX4: Forever Rivals showmatch event, where they take on KOI . Karmine Corp is now: Matias " saadhak " Delipetro Hazem " Avez " Khaled Efe " Elite " Teber Dmitry " SUYGETSU " Ilyushin Martin " marteen " Pátek Andrey " ENGH " Sholokhov (Head coach) Ahmed " ZE1SH " El Sheikh (Coach) Sergey " fistie " Vasilev (Coach)

title: Shopify Rebellion bests Team Falcons Vega in 2-0 fashion
cleaned_content: Shopify Rebellion Gold has defeated Team Falcons Vega 2-0 in the upper quarterfinals of the Game Changers Championship 2024 . Shopify now advances to face off against Xipto Esports GC , while Team Falcons has been sent down to the lower bracket and will face the winner of FlyQuest RED versus ZETA DIVISION GC in an elimination match. Falcons came into the match looking to carry forward their momentum from yesterday, where they defeated Ambitious Legend Gaming GC in a 2-0 stomp. On the other side, Shopify sought a strong start to their 2024 run as the reigning 2023 champions and winners of Game Changers North America Series 3 . This was also the first-ever matchup between Mary and florescent , the two champion duelists of GC. The match began on Falcon's map pick of Haven. They brought out the Neon Iso composition they used yesterday, while Shopify opted for a more standard Neon Breach. Shopify dominated the first half, snowballing a 1v3 pistol clutch from Noia into a 7-0 start. Clean shots from Noia secure her team their first round of the tournament. Falcons managed to break the opponent's momentum in round 8 off the back of a Sheriff thrifty, where madv clutched out a 1v1 versus meL . They strung together a 7-3 scoreline, but Shopify brushed it aside and won out the map 13-4 thanks to a second pistol win. Noia and florescent controlled the server; the former put up 17 kills and a rating of 1.72 while the latter picked up 18 kills and a rating of 1.64. The next map was Ascent, Shopify's pick. Falcons chose to challenge Shopify's Yoru Deadlock composition with a surprise Yoru Iso pick. Shopify appeared unfazed with an early 6-1 lead on their attack, consistently taking sites through coordinated splits and setting up ironclad postplants using alexis ' Deadlock utility. An Odin 3K from eva in round 8 finally secured Falcons their second round. However, Shopify continued to pick up round wins through individual power; Noia ended a 10-person duel in A main with a 1v2 clutch in round 10 and alexis aced in round 11 to win a 3v5 for her team, culminating in a 10-2 half for Shopify. The veteran support mows down Falcons by herself. Shopify took the second pistol round, moving up to a 4-0 pistol record for the series and a 12-2 lead after converting the anti-eco. Falcons began to mount a comeback with five rounds in a row, but after taking a timeout, Shopify successfully burned down the clock in the final round to take Ascent 13-7. While eva put up an impressive performance, leading her team with a 1.48 rating and 261 ACS, it was florescent once again leading the server with a standout 27 kills, 386 ACS, and 254 ADR. The star duelist ended the series with 354 ACS, 227 ADR, and 10 first kills across both maps. “I think they're a good team for sure, but I think we're just better, to be honest,” alexis spoke of the game in the post-match interview. Shopify Rebellion will return to play against Xipto Esports in the upper semifinals on Nov. 13 for a coveted spot in the upper final. Team Falcons Vega have been sent down to the lower bracket and will play for their tournament lives in the lower round 2 on Nov. 11.

title: G2 Gozen mounts comeback to defeat KRÜ Blaze
cleaned_content: G2 Gozen defeated KRÜ BLAZE in a nailbiter three-map series to set up a match with MIBR GC . G2 Gozen came into the tournament as the top team from EMEA after winning Game Changers EMEA Stage 3 . G2 are led by veterans mimi and Petra who won the 2022 Game Changers Championship over Shopify Rebellion GC .
