KRÜ Blaze have once again returned to the Game Changers Championship after beating out Akave Esports GC at the GC Latin America: Regional Final . Despite having attended every iteration of the event they had picked up just a single win over Chao Hui EDward Gaming before their win over ZETA DIVISION GC yesterday. The series opened on KRÜ's pick, Haven, with both teams opting to run Neon Breach comps. After narrowly winning KRÜ's bonus G2 picked up five of the next six rounds before back-to-back KRÜ rounds forced a timeout from G2 coach Leader . Strong entrying from dods provided seemingly infinite space for KRÜ to work with as they edged out the lead 7-5 going into halftime. An excellent retake from KRÜ secured their second pistol to take a 9-5 lead. G2 managed to come back slightly by winning two straight gun grounds before KRÜ took a low buy win thanks to high impact from biazik 's Sova and dods' Bucky. KRÜ looked dominant for the rest of the map as they cruised to a 13-7 map win to take a 1-0 lead in the series. dods' Neon took control of the first map with 360 ACS and 214 ADR. 82 ACS ahead of the runner-up, biazik. dods destroyed G2 on Neon. KRÜ picked up their third pistol to kick off Sunset, G2's pick. KRÜ looked much more contained compared to Haven as dods was unable to run freely throughout the map. G2 went up 7-2 before KRÜ could respond with strong early-round gameplans to keep the game close at 7-5. G2 picked up their first pistol of the series thanks to a 1v3 from IGL mimi that put the Europeans in prime position to take the map at 9-5 up. Although the set plays from KRÜ continued to find value a 1v3 from Vania to secure a thrifty locked in the map for G2 at 13-9. Petra dominated on the second map with 26 kills, 204 ADR, and an ace in the ninth round. G2 succeeded in neutralizing dods' Neon with the Brazilian receiving the lowest rating for their team with a 0.62 on Sunset. G2 were much more composed on Sunset. The third map, Abyss, had yet to be played by KRÜ Blaze in 2024 while G2 had a 75% win rate on the new map. Both teams were off the Neon and chose to play a mirror matchup of the standard double initiator “Ascent comp”. KRÜ sped to a 5-1 lead off the back of repeated B executes before a timeout was called by G2. The constant B pressure created by KRÜ was near unbeatable for G2 as the LATAM team picked up an 8-4 first half. KRÜ went B in 90% of rounds following the pistol and G2 were unable to find any answers for it. Another pistol round for KRÜ ended the series pistol record at 5-1 although this time around G2 managed to pick up the following eco after a 1v2 ace from Vania. Back-and-forth rounds followed before a heroic 4K from rezq gave G2 the opportunity to start a streak. Six rounds in a row secured the series win for G2 2-1 with a 13-11 on Abyss. rezq's attack Operator was pivotal for G2's comeback as the slower pace caught off the aggressive positions KRÜ tried to force. The Turkish duelist topped the server with 24 kills and 285 ACS. Heroics saved G2 on Abyss. G2 Gozen will play MIBR GC on Wednesday, November 13 for a spot in the upper bracket final. KRÜ Blaze will face off in an elimination match against the winner of GIANTX GC vs ALG GC on Monday, November 11.

title: MIBR GC brushes aside GIANTX GC 2-0
cleaned_content: MIBR GC defeated GIANTX GC 2-0 in their opening match in the Game Changers Championship 2024 . MIBR moved on to face the winner of G2 Gozen vs KRU Blaze while GX were relegated to the lower bracket. GIANTX qualified for the event as the second seed from EMEA via circuit points after a second-place finish at Game Changers EMEA Series 3 . Despite faltering against NASR Ignite in the first round of playoffs , GX collected a four-win streak en route to the finals where they lost to G2 Gozen . MIBR GC qualified as Brazil's sole representative after beating out GC Championship 2023 finalists Team Liquid Brazil 3-1 in the Game Changers Brazil Series 3 finals . 17-year-old duelist srN was the MVP for MIBR during their Series 3 run with a 1.41 rating and 309 ACS. The series opened on GX's pick, Pearl, with MIBR opting to run an off-meta solo Skye initiator combined with Astra and Viper. GX ran the much more standard double initiator scan KAY/O comp that has been seen frequently at off-season events such as the SEN City Classic . MIBR dominated the first half with Jelly 's Skye picking up 17 kills in the first half to spearhead the Brazilian offense. The spacing from MIBR provided trades that overwhelmed the opposition and forced a 9-3 score at halftime. Jelly's Skye was often the difference maker for MIBR on Pearl. A second pistol for MIBR put them up 11-3 before GX commenced an attempt at a comeback. The Europeans strung together five rounds before MIBR adjusted into a heavy retake setup to close out the map 13-10. Moving onto MIBR's pick, Sunset, GX managed to pick up their first pistol of the series. A 1v1 clutch from melissa saved the bonus for MIBR and allowed them to pick up momentum for the rest of the half. MIBR cruised to another 9-3 half as the individuals outclassed their opponents across the board. A 1v2 from Joliinaa to pick up GX's second pistol was immediately cancelled out by an MIBR thrifty in the second round to secure the map 13-4 and the series 2-0. srN excelled on Sunset. MIBR GC moved on to face the winner of G2 Gozen vs KRU Blaze. GIANTX GC have been relegated to the lower bracket and will play ALG GC in an elimination series.

title: Xipto takes down FlyQuest 2-1
cleaned_content: Xipto Esports GC has taken down FlyQuest RED 2-1 in their opening Game Changers 2024 Championship match. Xipto will next play against the winner of Team Falcons Vega vs. Shopify Rebellion GC . Flyquest, meanwhile, descends to the lower bracket. This is Flyquest's first year at the GCC, although some of their players had made it to the previous year's iteration under the Evil Geniuses GC banner. It was Xipto's core who, under Team SMG GC then, accidentally locked in four duelists and still ended up defeating the EG roster quite convincingly. The series commenced on Xipto‘s pick, Pearl, where both teams opted for a double duelist composition. Despite winning both pistols, Flyquest only found one more round on attack to be down 9-3. The second pistol round was all they found in the second half, with Xipto taking the win 13-4. Enerii doesn't need more than a classic. While dodonut fragged throughout the game, the rest of Flyquest looked quieter compared to the team-wide performance coming in from the Pacific representative, especially Tara who found several crucial multi-kills throughout the map. Map two, Sunset, saw both teams go neck and neck. Both teams won four buy rounds in a row to tie things up at 6-6. However, after round 14, Flyquest won seven rounds in a row to push the series to a map three with a 13-8 win. Two 4Ks from dodonut as well as an ACS of 378 helped them comfortably win it. Dodonut's Neon dominated the second half. Split once again saw a tug of war with Flyquest winning the pistol but Xipto picked up their pace with a four round streak once they had a full buy. Flyquest ended the half 6-6 and pushed their lead to 9-3 with three round wins, winning five of the six pistols today. However, Xipto ramped up big time on their defense side with both Tara and shirazi ensuring Flyquest struggled to enter sites. Xipto rode the momentum wave to series point at 12-10, but Flyquest were able to push it to overtime. Xipto however had their opponent's number by then, getting to match point first twice and eventually winning 15-13 to advance in the upper bracket. Alexy and Kamiyu make a 3v5 round look easy. Xipto looked strong as a team, with both Alexy and Enerii having 200+ ACS and enerii consistently finding first kills. However, Flyquest seemed to have a slower start and despite dodonut's standout performance, appeared less decisive compared to their opponents. Xipto maintains their flawless record of zero series losses this year. “We go see, go kill,” remarked Alexy in the post-match interview when asked about their strategy.

title: Falcons Vega breezes past ALG GC with 2-0 win
cleaned_content: The EMEA third seed, Team Falcons Vega , has defeated Ambitious Legend Gaming GC 2-0 in their opening Game Changers 2024 Championship match . Falcons will next play against Shopify Rebellion Gold , while ALG remains in the lower bracket in hopes of continuing their run. The expanded tournament means both teams are able to make their international debut, but they each have experienced players in the Game Changers circuit. Team Falcons feature the first GCC winner, Mary , one of eight players in 2024 to return to the premier GC tournament with a title under their name. Ambitious Legend, meanwhile, boasts the long-standing Thai duo of Muffyn and JinNy , who have been together since 2021 and represented South East Asia in the 2022 Game Changers Championship . Additionally, Yusin returns to the international stage, as she played for Chao Hui EDward Gaming in 2023. The series kicked off on Haven , Falcon were completely dominant throughout the first half. Their Neon-Iso spearhead was one of the key factors to their 8-4 opening, as the duo ended the attack with six first eliminations and 11 kills each. lexa and Toki 's map control was equally important, an oppressive style full of fakes and late rotations forcing out ALG's two timeouts by round 8. ALG was able to string together a pair of rounds after their second pause, but lexa and Toki continued their oppressive play on round 11, preventing the score gap from getting too close and helping their first half end 8-4. Toki net the first ace of the tournament in her international debut Muffyn gave her team hope coming into the second half, as her Jett led the charge to take the second round and anti-eco rounds. This set the score 8-6, the closest ALG got to equalizing, but Toki and madv turned things back in their favor in the bonus round. Toki won a 1v1 to take the next point, and Falcons did not drop a round afterwards. Together, the duo earned a combined 19 eliminations in the last seven rounds of the map, and finished the defense with a 1.81 and 2.37 rating, respectively. In the end, the pair helped Falcons steal ALG's map pick 13-6, putting them on a comfortable track to a series win. “I love the confidence, the excitement,” madv said regarding the Iso after the series. Falcons immediately showed why they had selected Split as their map for the series. They debuted a double-sentinel composition with Yoru as the duelist, catching ALG's more traditional Raze-Skye based composition off-guard. The sentinel-heavy lineup proved too much for the China representatives, as ALG was unable to take a single round in their offensive half, a dominant 12-0 paving the way to Falcons Vega's first international win. “Deadlock and Cypher are strong together on Split, I think the difference was Yoru,” madv commented on their new composition following the series. “This was my first game on Deadlock,” she added. Falcons Vega's shut down saw them end the first half with a combined 11-3 in first eliminations to first deaths, and, in terms of rating, the MENA squad's lowest-rated player matched their counterpart's highest-rated player. Toki's support-focused playstyle meant she ended the half with a 0.68 rating, but her 10 assists helped her teammates get a total of 53 eliminations in 12 rounds with a KAST averaging 98% and score ratings ranging from 1.58 to 1.98. Once again, Muffyn stepped up in an attempt to turn the tables, with two triple-kills giving her team two rounds and some breathing. madv had different plans, as she earned a round 3 Annihilation and found a 3K of her own to end the map 13-2. “I still feel like it's a dream,” madv said following their win. Looking forward to their next series, she added, “If we play the same as today, the same confidence, playing as a team, I think we can do anything.” The victory, beyond being Falcons Vega's international debut and first victory in the global stage, represents a similar milestone for the MENA region as a whole. While Mary had previously been a part of the inaugural GCC champions, Falcons Vega's participation and win also marks multiple firsts for a Middle Eastern team, as their previous best performance had been during T2 capstone events such as the VRL Finals in 2022 or Ascension earlier this year. Team Falcons Vega looks to continue their run against last year's Game Changers Champions, Shopify Rebellion. Ambitious Legend Gaming remains in the tournament, but will need to stay alive in the lower bracket, with their opponents still to be determined.

title: KRÜ BLAZE opens GCC 2024 with 2-0 win over ZETA GC
cleaned_content: KRÜ BLAZE has defeated ZETA DIVISION GC 2-0 in the inaugural Game Changers 2024 Championship match . KRÜ will next play against G2 Gozen , the 2022 Game Changers Champions and 2023 bronze medalists. ZETA, meanwhile, descends to the lower bracket , awaiting the rest of the opening matches for their opponents. This series marks ZETA's first appearance at a Game Changers Championship, as the team fell apart in the 2022 qualifiers and lost 3-1 to Chao Hui EDward Gaming in the 2023 East Asia qualifier final. KRÜ Blaze, on the other hand, has played in all three iterations of the Game Changers Championship, but has been unable to make it far in the tournament. The match began on Bind , where ZETA DIVISION GC was able to take an early lead. UR sealed the pistol round by stalling the defuse, and ZETA eventually forced out the opponent's timeout by 4-2. Unfortunately for the Japanese lineup, the tactical pause and a 4K from dods was more than enough to reverse momentum, as KRÜ went on to take the lead and end the first half 7-5. micaela turns the round and wins the pistol ZETA looked posed to take their second pistol round of the series, but micaela had different plans. Left alone with romi , she held strong against ZETA's three-player stack camping a dropped spike, and was able to win the round for her team after rotating. micaela continued extending her team's lead, taking a 1v1 against ZETA's suzu . The economic damage was enough to keep the score close, but KRÜ remained unfazed as they ended their map pick 13-9 Map 2, Ascent , began in similar fashion to Bind. Moco and SereNa helped close out the first few rounds with a triple kill each, setting their team on track to win five early rounds. Down 5-2, a conir 4K kicked off her team's comeback, taking the lead and ending the first half 7-5. Moving on to the second half, ZETA was able to tie after winning their third pistol round. It was not enough, however, as conir and romi continued their contributions in the second half and eventually pushed their team back into a comfortable position. The pair got a combined 21 eliminations in their attack half, with conir earning a 1.71 rating thanks to back-to-back-to-back multikills and a 1v1 win in round 21. The veteran duo ended the series the following round by shutting down ZETA's retake, winning Ascent 13-9 and taking their initial series 2-0. The victory marks KRÜ BLAZE's first-ever opening match win at Game Changers Championship, setting them up for a series against the 2022 GCC winners, G2 Gozen. ZETA DIVISION, meanwhile, will wait for their next opponent in the lower bracket.

title: Game Changers 2024 Championship viewer's guide
cleaned_content: After an exciting year throughout the VCT, the pinnacle of Game Changers competition has returned for yet another LAN event. The Game Changers Championship returns to Berlin, Germany for its third appearance since 2022. The competition will run from Nov. 8 to Nov. 17 and – for the first time since its inception – will feature not eight, but 10 total teams from around the globe. Each team fought their way to Berlin through qualifiers, main events, or circuit point accumulation. Both former GCC winners, G2 Gozen and Shopify Rebellion Gold , are among the teams vying for the trophy. Format The standard double-elimination bracket will continue to be utilized throughout the event, this time with two extra upper rounds to allocate for the extra teams. Each matchup will be Bo3 save for the lower and grand finals, which will both feature Bo5 matches. In an interesting turn of events, teams from the same region have been seeded on the same side of the bracket, which was avoided last year to ensure diverse matchups. The following teams will make appearances on Berlin's stage this year: Shopify Rebellion Gold (NA #1) FlyQuest RED (NA #2) G2 Gozen (EMEA #1) GIANTX GC (EMEA #2) Team Falcons Vega (EMEA #3) MIBR GC (Brazil) KRÜ BLAZE (LATAM) Xipto Esports GC (PAC #1) ZETA DIVISION GC (PAC #2) Ambitious Legend Gaming GC (China) Prize Pool This year, the GCC prize pool remains the same as the prior two events at a whopping $500,000 USD. Despite being spread out a bit thinner, the winning team will still take home $180,000 USD. 1st: $180,000 2nd: $100,000 3rd: $70,000 4th: $50,000 5th-6th: $25,000 7th-8th: $15,000 9th-10th: $10,000 Schedule Friday, November 8 7:00 AM EST | 2:00 PM CEST | 9:00 PM KST (Thursday) - Upper Round 1: KRÜ BLAZE vs. ZETA DIVISION GC 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - Upper Round 1: Ambitious Legend Gaming GC vs. Team Falcons Vega 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - Upper Quarterfinals: FlyQuest Red vs. Xipto Esports Saturday, November 9 7:00 AM EST | 2:00 PM CEST | 9:00 PM KST (Friday) - Upper Quarterfinals: GIANTX GC vs. MIBR GC 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - Upper Quarterfinals: G2 Gozen vs. KRÜ BLAZE 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - Upper Quarterfinals: Shopify Rebellion vs. Team Falcons Vega Sunday, November 10 (Lower Round 1) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - FlyQuest Red vs. ZETA DIVISION GC 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - GIANTX GC vs. Ambitious Legend Gaming GC Monday, November 11 (Lower Round 2) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - KRÜ BLAZE vs. GIANTX GC 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - Team Falcons Vega vs. ZETA DIVISION GC Wednesday, November 13 (Upper Semifinals) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - G2 Gozen vs. MIBR GC 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - Shopify Rebellion vs. Xipto Esports Thursday, November 14 (Lower Round 3) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - Xipto Esports vs. KRÜ BLAZE 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - MIBR GC vs. ZETA DIVISION GC Friday, November 15 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - Upper Final: G2 Gozen vs. Shopify Rebellion 1:00 PM EST | 8:00 PM CEST | 3:00 AM KST - Lower Round 4: Xipto Esports vs. MIBR GC Saturday, November 16 (Lower Final) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - G2 Gozen vs. MIBR GC Sunday, November 17 (Grand Final) 10:00 AM EST | 5:00 PM CEST | 12:00 AM KST - Shopify Rebellion vs. MIBR GC Broadcast Broadcast drops are back, and this time, Riot have added additional options for viewers to obtain rewards. Viewers can obtain drops by connecting their Valorant accounts with their Twitch or YouTube accounts and watching official streams. The “Main Character” title is obtainable by watching any match throughout the window of Nov. 8 - Nov. 16. The “Game Changers 2024” player card can be obtained by watching the grand finals on Nov. 17. Four exclusive titles are also available by watching official on-site watchparties. By tuning in anytime between Nov. 15 - Nov. 17, viewers can earn the following titles as well as the “Main Character” title: “Ribbit” - Kydae “I am Her” - Helydia “13-0 Club” - Mixwell “Queen” - Sliggy Streams Riot will stream the entire event on their Twitch and YouTube channels. Viewers can also watch different streams in different languages. twitch.tv/valorant VCT YouTube Coverage VLR.gg will cover all of Game Changers 2024 Championship: Berlin in our event hub , which includes a live ticker and stats to comb over. Pick'ems are available and open on the site until the beginning of the first match on Friday.

title: KOI announces 2025 roster
cleaned_content: KOI has revealed their new roster for the 2025 VCT season. They have added Xavier " flyuh " Carlson , Dom " soulcas " Sulcas , and Dawid " Filu " Czarnecki in addition to returning members Bogdan " sheydos " Naumov and Grzegorz " grubinho " Ryczko . They have also confirmed Harry " Gorilla " Mepham , previously of Team Vitality , to be their head coach. KOI has struggled to be competitive in VCT EMEA. They have placed in the bottom two teams in both 2023 and 2024 regular seasons, and have yet to qualify to any playoff stages, much less an international tournament. Their lack of success has led to a player and personnel shakeup ahead of 2025. Having removing three of their players, including their in-game leader , as well as their coaching staff , sheydos and grubinho are the only familiar faces from 2024. KOI's new in-game leader, flyuh, comes not from EMEA, but North America. For the past two years, flyuh has played for Moist x Shopify in Challengers NA, leading them to be a top team in the league. However, in both years, they have fallen just short of reaching Ascension, placing third in each of the playoffs. Joining KOI, he will make his debut on the VCT tier one stage. soulcas is one of the most storied players in EMEA, being a founding member of Team Liquid . He accomplished a lot with Liquid, winning EMEA in 2023 and being a perennial international attendee. After his time with Liquid ended in 2023, he joined the tier two scene with Apeks in 2024. Along with a number of VCT veterans, soulcas helped redeem Apeks from their 2023 Ascension loss and earned the organization a spot in the EMEA league. However, along with kaajak , he would leave the team to explore options with other teams, landing him a spot on KOI. Filu has been toiling about in the EMEA tier two scene since 2020. Despite his history in the scene, he has never been able to break into the upper echelons of competition. Most recently, he was the duelist for the DSYRE team that dominated the Italian VCL. After easily qualifying to Ascension , they would go an even 2-2 in their group. Unfortunately, this would not be enough to make it out of their group. Filu will get his first shot at VCT with KOI. This new roster will make their debut at the KCX4: Forever Rivals tournament. KOI is now: Xavier " flyuh " Carlson Grzegorz " grubinho " Ryczko Bogdan " sheydos " Naumov Dawid " Filu " Czarnecki Dom " soulcas " Sulcas Kevin " Noizeeh " Jaskiewicz (Manager) Harry " Gorilla " Mepham (Head coach) Laike " temoc " Lewis (Assistant coach) Tyler " Bambino " Jay (Assistant coach)

title: KOI parts ways with BARBARR
cleaned_content: KOI has parted ways with head coach André " BARBARR " Möller . In the same announcement, they also officially bid farewell to Patryk " starxo " Kopczynski , who has been an unrestricted free agent since early September . “It's been quite a rollercoaster with two fusions in the same number of years,” BARBARR added . “All the love to KOI and the supporters, wishing you nothing but the best.” BARBARR originally joined KOI at the beginning of the partnership era in 2023. Prior to KOI, he served as the head coach for Guild Esports , who most notably finished in top-eight at Masters Copenhagen . KOI spent the 2023 EMEA League season towards the bottom of the standings, ending in ninth place with a 2-7 record. In the Last Chance Qualifier , they came just one placement away from qualification to Champions 2023, but were ultimately denied in the lower final by Natus Vincere . Despite changing three players, the 2024 season yielded similar results; KOI went 3-7 in the regular season and finished last in the region. Since then, they have parted with starxo, Tobias " ShadoW " Flodström , and Kamil " kamo " Frąckowiak in yet another roster rebuild. KOI has not yet announced BARBARR's replacement, although Harry " Gorilla " Mepham , previous head coach for Team Vitality , has reportedly been linked with the team. KOI is now: Bogdan " sheydos " Naumov Grzegorz " grubinho " Ryczko Tyler " Bambino " Jay (Analyst)

title: KRU reveals roster
cleaned_content: KRÜ Esports has announced their roster for the 2025 VCT season. They retain Fabian " Shyy " Usnayo , Marco " Melser " Eliot Machuca Amaro , and Angelo " keznit " Mori from their 2024 roster while adding Roberto " Mazino " Rivas and Benjamín " adverso " Poblete . Mazino was a founding member of the original KRÜ roster when they entered the scene in 2021. They were a dominant force in the Latin American scene, representing the region at every international event in 2021 and 2022. This included KRÜ's historic run at Champions 2021 , where they pulled off shocking upsets over Sentinels and FNATIC , and nearly took down the Masters Berlin winning Gambit Esports . After 2022, Mazino departed KRÜ to join their regional rivals in LEVIATÁN . With Leviatán, Mazino won Stage 2 of the Americas league and placed third at Champions in 2024. Despite their successful year, Mazino was let go from the organization, leaving him to return to KRÜ. Adverso is also a former Leviatán member, being a part of the Australs team that they signed in 2022. He helped bring Leviatán to the international stage for the first time, as they finally overcame KRÜ to qualify for Masters Copenhagen and Champions . After the year, however, Adverso was released from the organization. He joined All Knights to play in the Latin American Challenger league. After missing reaching Ascension by one game in 2023, All Knights qualified to the tournament in 2024, where they would place third. Shyy, Melser, and Keznit return to KRÜ after an up and down 2024 season. A five game win streak in Stage 1 was followed by seven straight losses. Although it seemed like the team was crumbling, they found their footing when it mattered most, as they squeaked out a win against 100 Thieves to qualify for Champions, maintaining their four year streak of attendance. At Champions, they would only find one win against Bilibili Gaming before they were eliminated in the group stage by FNATIC . KRÜ Esports are now: Marco " Melser " Eliot Machuca Amaro Angelo " keznit " Mori Fabian " Shyy " Usnayo Benjamín " adverso " Poblete Roberto " Mazino " Rivas Jorge " Atom " Siero (Head coach) Alan " ddx " Salvati (Assistant coach) Tomás " Nyogen " Castiglione (Staff)

title: vanity departs Valorant
cleaned_content: Former Cloud9 player Anthony " vanity " Malaspina has announced that he is stepping away from Valorant. The former in-game leader revealed that he was "not finding any enjoyment in playing ranked with the environment it's developed into." He also shared that he would entertain the possibility of competing again "if I feel that I'm able to get to a level I'm confident in." vanity made his debut in 2021 with American Challengers team Version1 , and joined Cloud9 for the first time ahead of the 2022 season. Most well-known for his play on Controller agents like Omen, Astra, and Viper, vanity had two stints with Cloud9, the second of which took place this past season. With them this past year, he achieved a 5th-6th placed finish in Americas Stage 2 . In his first go-around with the organization, which lasted from August 2021 to March 2023, he led the team to be the only North American team to reach the Champions 2021 playoffs, where they were eliminated in the quarterfinals. vanity was announced as a restricted free agent to begin the offseason, but parted ways with the organization soon after. "Thank you to everyone who has supported me, my teammates and every organization I've been under you guys made it possible for me to pursue something I've dreamed of my entire life and I hope to keep your support," he said.

title: Team Vitality bids farewell to ceNder
cleaned_content: UPDATE: This article has been updated to include Sayf's recent clarification regarding ceNder's decision to take a break from competitive play. Team Vitality has parted ways with in-game leader Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis after almost four years with the organization. Vitality now has five active players ready for the 2025 season. Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel further clarified that ceNder was not released by the organization, but rather has chosen to take a break from competitive play. "He is one of the most fantastic, selfless teammates I have ever played with and I hope he returns to VCT soon," Sayf added. ceNder joined as part of Vitality's original roster back in February 2021. Primarily playing Sentinel agents, his achievements with the team include winning VRL France in 2022 and placing second in the VRL 2022 Finals . The 2024 season presented ceNder with a new challenge: step into the role of in-game leader and main Controller following the retirement of Santeri " BONECOLD " Sassi . The European squad found middling results in the first half of the year, being eliminated in the Kickoff play-ins and narrowly failing to qualify for the Stage 1 playoffs after finishing at the bottom of a five-way 3-3 tie in Group Alpha. Coming into Stage 2 , the team decided to bench head coach Salah " salah " Barakat and promote former assistant coach Harry " Gorilla " Mepham in his place. Renewed, ceNder and the rest of Vitality rallied to a 6-4 regular season record. In the playoffs, they made a run to finish second in EMEA and secure the organization's first international qualification to Champions 2024 . Vitality later exited in the group stage of Seoul with a 1-2 record after falling to LEVIATÁN . Team Vitality is now: Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: DRX calls up Athan
cleaned_content: DRX has officially signed Na " Athan " Ha-jun (나하준) as the final piece of their 2025 roster after recently fielding him as a stand-in at the TEN Invitational . This signing represents yet another promotion from the DRX Academy team that Flashback and BeYN were previously a part of. Before joining DRX Prospects in July, Athan primarily played a variety of Duelist and Initiator agents for teams in the Challengers League Korea qualifiers, such as TEAM INDIGO and KIDZONE . 2024 was the start of a new era for DRX; they bid farewell to longstanding members Zest and Rb and brought Foxy9 and Flashback up to the active roster, choosing to bank on upcoming talent. The team ultimately failed to qualify for both Masters Madrid and Masters Shanghai by just one placement, finishing top-four in Kickoff and fourth in the Stage 1 playoffs . These were the only times that DRX had missed an international event since 2021. Stage 2 saw more changes for DRX as they parted ways with stax and brought back Flashback, who had been temporarily inactive and filled in for by BeYN throughout Stage 1. Revitalized, DRX went on to place second in the Stage 2 playoffs to qualify for Champions 2024 , where they placed top-six on their home turf in Seoul. Once again, DRX has chosen to invest in new talent. Athan is the third rookie to join the Korean squad for 2025 along with Song " HYUNMIN " Hyun-min (송현민) and No " free1ng " Ha-jun (노하준) . Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) is the only original member remaining on the roster following the departure of BuZz to T1. Athan and the rest of DRX will next return for the Radiant Asia Invitational , which begins on Nov. 20. DRX is now: Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) Na " Athan " Ha-jun (나하준) No " free1ng " Ha-jun (노하준) Song " HYUNMIN " Hyun-min (송현민) Pyeon " termi " Seon-ho (편선호) (Head coach) Kim " glow " Min-soo (김민수) (Coach) Kwon " Argency " Soon-woo (권순우) (Coach)

title: kaajak joins FNATIC
cleaned_content: FNATIC has completed their roster with the signing of Ascension winning duelist Kajetan " kaajak " Haremski . He joins the roster in place of Derke , Fnatic's previously duelist of three years. After falling short of winning Ascension in 2023, Apeks ' roster went through a complete rebuild in 2024. As a part of this rebuild, they brought in kaajak as their duelist player. Although he was a newcomer to higher levels of competition, he was a standout in the Polaris league. Throughout the year, Apeks only lost one series in their league, and easily qualified once more to Ascension. In Ascension, kaajak only proved himself further, dominating the competition and dragging his team across the finish line in numerous maps. Apeks managed to redeem themselves of last year's loss as they took down PCIFIC Esports in the grand final to ascend to VCT EMEA. However, with his exceptional performance throughout the year, kaajak became a highly sought after player, and Apeks were unable to retain him for 2025. They young gun lifts his first trophy in Valorant. kaajak's buyer, Fnatic, was looking for a roster shakeup after they had grown stagnant in 2024 and were unable to replicate their previous success. They had missed their first international event since 2021 when they failed to qualify for Masters Madrid . While they rebounded to make it to Masters Shanghai , two straight losses would eliminate them immediately. The addition of hiro would breathe some new life into the roster, but they would ultimately fall in the top six of Champions . FNATIC are now: Jake " Boaster " Howlett Kajetan " kaajak " Haremski Timofey " Chronicle " Khromov Emir " Alfajer " Ali Beder Ștefan " Sayonara " Mîtcu (Stand-in) Leo " Leo " Jannesson Colin " CoJo " Johnson (Manager) Chris " Elmapuddy " Tebbit (Head coach) Milan " Milan " de Meij (Assistant coach)

title: Bilibili Gaming signs rushia
cleaned_content: Bilibili Gaming has signed Wang " rushia " Xiaojie (王晓杰) , expanding their active roster to six players. rushia, a former Controller player for Bilibili Gaming's academy, joins with no experience at the top level of competitive Valorant. His signing is Bilibili's first offseason activity since parting ways with Flex1n and yosemite . rushia is expected to fill the void left by them. He joins a Bilibili team that, in 2024, went through an up-and-down season. To start the year, they failed to reach Masters Madrid following an exit in the play-ins stage of China Kickoff . A disappointing China Stage 1 saw them finish 7th-8th and miss out on Masters Shanghai . Changes were made heading into Stage 2 , which saw BLG make playoffs and qualify for Champions Seoul . Their Champions campaign was short-lived though, as they would crash out of the group stage with two straight defeats. Not much is known about rushia or how Bilibili will approach matches with their six-man roster, but the curtain will rise soon. They will kick off their OFF//SEASON with an appearance at FGC Invitational 2024 , where they will compete in a double-elimination tournament with ten Chinese VCT teams. Bilibili Gaming 's roster is now: Yang " B3ar " Zhanxiong (杨瞻雄) Wang " whzy " Haozhe (王昊哲) Lu " Levius " Yinzhong (卢胤中) Wang " rushia " Xiaojie (王晓杰) Marcus " nephh " Tan Liu " Knight " Yuxiang (刘宇翔) Hu " Robot " Leiyu (扈雷雨) (Manager) Lee " bail " Sung-jae (이성재) (Head coach) Wang " Jexen " Lin Xiao (王林骁) (Coach)

title: Global Esports announces full roster for 2025
cleaned_content: Global Esports has announced the signings of Savva " Kr1stal " Fedorov , Kelly " kellyS " Sedillo , UdoTan , Federico " Papi " Evangelista , and Mark " yokam " Musni to their roster. They have also already signed Preston " Juv3nile " Dornon as their head coach. In the announcement, they also teased the potential signings of a sixth man and an assistant coach. Kr1stal joins after being crowned champions of Ascension China with Xi Lai Gaming . Kr1stal, who is of Russian nationality, parted ways with XLG days after the event due to the team only being allowed one import player in VCT. He joins Global Esports after being Xi Lai's in-game leader, and is expected to continue in that role. He mainly plays the Initiator role, with Sova being his most played agent throughout his Ascension campaign. kellyS joins after spending around a full season with Filipino side Oasis Gaming . He was their in-game leader last season, meaning Global could turn to him or Kr1stal to guide the team in that regard. He also mainly played the Initiator role in 2024, but has also played Raze often. Before joining Oasis, he was well-known for his time on Rex Regum Qeon . Papi was NAOS 's controller player this past season, and had been with the Phillipines-based team since 2022. His 2024 season came to an end at Pacific Ascension , where NAOS fell to eventual fourth-placed RIDDLE ORDER . UdoTan joins after spending the 2024 season with Chinese Challengers side Rare Atom . He played mainly as the team's Initiator, but also took on the Duelist role on occasion. In the three-map Ascension China grand final, he was opposite of the stage to his now-teammate Kr1stal. Before Rare Atom, he played for Four Angry Men , Gwangju Shadow , TALON , and GoNGo Prince . He made his debut in 2020. PatrickWho joins as one of the lesser-known names on the roster. He made his professional Valorant debut in 2024 and played on two different Filipino VCL teams before landing on Carti World . He joined Velocity Gaming in the offseason, but joins Global Esports after a buyout was agreed. Global Esports' rebuild comes after a disappointing 2024 season which saw them finish 9th at the end of Pacific Stage 2 and fail to qualify for any playoff stages. They won just four games in the entire season, and parted ways with their entire roster at the start of the offseason. Global Esports 's roster is now: Mark " yokam " Musni Go " UdoTan " Kyung-won (고경원) Savva " Kr1stal " Fedorov Kelly " kellyS " Sedillo Federico " Papi " Evangelista Bhavin " HellrangeR " Kotwani (Manager) Vatsal " Vatsal " Uniyal (Manager) Preston " Juv3nile " Dornon (Head coach) Hose " taeri " Son (손호세) (Staff)

title: FunPlus Phoenix signs yosemite, York as assistant coach
cleaned_content: FunPlus Phoenix has rounded out their roster with Wang " yosemite " Lei (王磊) for the 2025 season. He will replace Liang " Lysoar " Youhao (梁优好) , who recently parted ways with the team and joined Wolves Esports . The team has also picked up Yao " York " Kun (姚堃) as an assistant coach. Previously, yosemite had been with Bilibili Gaming since April 2023. A second-place finish in the Champions China Qualifier netted the team's first international appearance at Champions 2023 , where they notably upset NRG twice to qualify for playoffs and finish in the top eight. BLG faced greater difficulties in 2024, missing out on qualification to both Masters Madrid and Masters Shanghai after falling to Trace Esports in the Kickoff play-ins and ending Stage 1 with a 2-4 record. They found recovery in Stage 2 , ending the regular season with a 5-5 record and qualifying to Champions 2024 via circuit points, where they were eliminated in the group stage in 0-2 fashion. York previously served as an assistant coach for Titan Esports Club . He transitioned to a player role coming into Stage 2, but did not play in any official matches. TEC ended the regular season at the bottom of the regional standings with a 3-7 overall record. FPX's first international qualification was to Champions 2023. However, it was at Masters Shanghai where the team made a splash by taking their first international win against FUT Esports on home soil. Despite exiting in the Swiss stage, they stirred excitement by battling to close map threes against eventual grand finalists Gen.G and Team Heretics. Their next and most recent international showing was a weaker 0-2 group stage exit at Champions 2024, where they fell to Sentinels. yosemite and the rest of FPX will return on Nov. 1 in the FGC Invitational 2024 versus Wolves Esports . FunPlus Phoenix is now: Zhang " BerLIN " Bolin (張柏霖) Kale " Autumn " Dunne Qu " Life " Donghao (瞿东豪) Zhang " AAAAY " Yang (张杨) Wang " yosemite " Lei (王磊) Deng " NaThanD " Senqiao (邓森侨) (Head coach) Yao " York " Kun (姚堃) (Assistant coach)

title: Team Vitality parts ways with head coach salah
cleaned_content: Team Vitality has parted ways with longtime head coach Salah " salah " Barakat , ending a nearly two-year-long stint at the organization. "It was a crazy two years, I got to travel the world doing my dream job," salah said . "There were amazing moments I'll always cherish and rough moments I'll learn from. Thank you to everyone who helped me along the way." He is well-traveled, having held coaching positions all across the world before landing with Team Vitality. He started in 2020 as a coach with bonk , then had stops with FaZe Clan , Fire Flux Vatangame , Tundra Esports , Akrew , and OG LDN UTD . His two seasons with Team Vitality was his longest tenure with any team he has coached. salah had been Team Vitality's head coach since VCT began franchising in the 2023 season. In their first season under his guidance, the team was eliminated in the quarterfinals of LOCK//IN São Paulo , and finished 5th-6th in the 2023 EMEA League , eliminated in the playoffs by eventual winners Team Liquid . The 2024 season began with the team narrowly missing out on the playoffs of EMEA Kickoff , falling at the play-in stage. In Stage 1 , they were one of five teams to finish with a 3-3 record, but finished last in their group and missed out on playoffs. Ahead of Stage 2 , coaching changes were made. The organization benched salah and parted ways with coach Strong , promoting former assistant Gorilla to head coach. Vitality then won three of their four remaining league matches, qualifying for playoffs and eventually Champions Seoul with a second-place finish. They posted a 9th-12th finish at Champions, eliminating TALON but falling to the eventual third-placed LEVIATÁN in the group stage. Since the end of their season, Team Vitality has parted ways with Gorilla, assistant coaches PAL and temoc , and Initiator player runneR . They have since signed players with championship experience, picking up Less , who won a world championship with LOUD , and Derke , who with FNATIC became one of the first players to ever lift two majors. Team Vitality 's roster is now: Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso Andy " Bangovic " Zajimovic (Manager) Robert " Mulgan95 " Mulgan (Manager) Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: blaZek1ng announces retirement
cleaned_content: After a four-year-long career, former Global Esports player Gary " blaZek1ng " Dastin has retired from e-sports. blaZek1ng made the switch to Valorant after a short Counter-Strike: Global Offensive career, making his debut for BOOM Esports in 2020. He played for the Indonesian team for three seasons, helping them stay towards the top of the Indonesian Challengers circuit and eventually reaching Champions 2022 . In 2023, BOOM Esports lifted the Indonesian Challengers League , earning entry into Pacific Ascension . At Ascension, they fell in the semifinals to eventual champions BLEED . After the 2023 season, blaZek1ng joined Global Esports, who was coming off of an eighth-place finish in the 2023 Pacific League . In 2024, Global Esports fielded another diverse roster, boasting players from five different home countries. Similarly to the prior year, the season ended in disappointment, as they would win just three matches across both splits and fail to qualify for the playoffs of any event they competed in. Towards the end of this past season with GE, he was the team's go-to Sentinel player, filling the Killjoy and Cypher roles, but had been known to play Viper, Omen, and Sova as well. blaZek1ng announced that he was an unrestricted free agent weeks into the offseason, but less than a month later has now retired. Before the start of the offseason, Global Esports announced its entire roster were restricted free agents. Their roster is now a clean slate. Global Esports ' roster is now: Hose " taeri " Son (손호세) (Manager) Preston " Juv3nile " Dornon (Head coach) Vatsal " Vatsal " Uniyal (Staff)

title: TYLOO's AAK retires
cleaned_content: TYLOO announced that Shi " AAK " Yekai (施叶凯) has retired. "Today we officially announce that AAK will retire and leave the VCT professional stage," the organization said. "We wish him all the best in his new journey." While he had an undefined role for stretches of the season while playing Viper or Cypher, he was mainly the team's Duelist this past season, playing Jett or Raze. Before joining Tyloo in August of 2023, AAK played for Royal Never Give Up , Tales of Eastern , and Weibo Gaming . The 2024 season saw Tyloo finish 7th-8th in China Stage 1 and eighth in Stage 2 . They failed to reach the knockout stages of either stage, and finished the year with just four wins out of 12 matches. The organization is still yet to reach an international event. AAK's retirement is the organization's first roster shuffling since parting ways with Scales , who joined before Split 2. He had been benched since the team's loss to All Gamers to begin Stage 2. AAK has not participated in Tyloo's OFF//SEASON competitions, as head coach Sunshine started in his place during the team's WALL-E Cup run. Tyloo will continue their offseason at the FGC Invitational 2024 , where ten Chinese VCT teams will compete in a double-elimination tournament. TYLOO 's roster is now: Ding " Ninebody " Yi (丁毅) Xiang " coldfish " Pengzhi (向鹏志) Zhang " zjc " Juncheng (张峻程) Yang " Eren " Zhengwei (杨曾威) Yang " fc4t " Jiawei (杨家玮) (Manager) Huang " Sunshine " Jinjie (黄进杰) (Head coach) Aleksey " slk " Lynksov (Coach)

title: TSM parts ways with aproto, poised, sym, and Faded
cleaned_content: TSM parted ways with players Alex " aproto " Protopapas , Kevin " POISED " Ngo , Tyler " sym " Porter , and coach Daniel " Faded " Hwang . sym, aproto, and Faded joined TSM as part of a six-man roster pickup in 2024, when TSM acquired the roster of BackOutsideBoys . The roster was assembled ahead of the 2024 season, months after an offseason announcement from the organization that they would temporarily cease Valorant operations. Prior to TSM, aproto was well-traveled in the North American Challengers circuit, playing for Moist Moguls and BreakThru . He also played for Ghostbusters , and Ghost Gaming , and made his Valorant debut in 2020 with Luminosity . He was mainly the team's Sentinel player this season, on Cypher and Killjoy often but also playing Viper on occasion. “Wouldn't trade the experiences and time I had with this team for the world,” aproto said . “Love them all like brothers. Will give an update on what my future holds and how I'm feeling soon.” TSM teammate sym was also on Moist Moguls and BreakThru with aproto, and also played for several Challengers teams, including Nearest Airport , Serenity , and the TSM Academy . He also made his debut in 2020. He was the team's Duelist player, with his go-tos being Jett, Raze and Neon. POISED, the team's Initiator player, played for FaZe Clan , Rise , Noble , and Dignitas since making his debut in 2020. He mainly played Breach, Sova, and Skye, but has been known to play Omen or Viper when TSM used double Controller team compositions. Before TSM and BackOutsideBoys, Faded was an analyst for FaZe Clan. Many members of the organization were together at different stops before joining TSM in 2024, a year that ended with them falling short of Ascension once again. While they held expectations as a team in the middle of the pack, an upset over favorites Oxygen Esports and a win over Moist x Shopify gave them a spot at Americas Ascension . They were eliminated in the group stages at Ascension, finishing sixth. TSM 's roster is now: Johann " seven " Hernandez Anthony " gMd " Guimond

title: JDG welcomes EGO as head coach
cleaned_content: JDG Esports signed former All Gamers head coach Yang " EGO " Haozun (杨皓尊) . He is the third person to make the switch from AG to JDG this offseason, joining assistant coach hypnotizing and in-game leader sword9 . The coaching duo of EGO and hypnotizing replaces last season's pair of Anaks and Billyo , who have been unattached since leaving JDG to start the offseason. The 2024 season was EGO's first and only with All Gamers. With them, he achieved a 5th-6th place finish in China Stage 1 and Stage 2 , reaching the playoffs of both splits but falling short of qualifying for an international event. Before joining AG, he spent a season with Chinese Challengers side Attacking Soul Esports as a coach. He helped guide the team to China Ascension in 2023, but fell to eventual champions Dragon Ranger Gaming in the lower final, finishing third. EGO joins a JDG team that, like All Gamers, failed to qualify for any international events in 2024. After finishing 11th in Stage 1, they made a handful of changes and improved to a 5th-6th finish in Stage 2. The first look at an EGO-led JDG Esports team will be at the FGC Invitational 2024 , where ten Chinese VCT teams will compete in a double-elimination tournament. JDG Esports ' roster is now: Chen " YHchen " Yuhan (陳昱瀚) Park " stew " Young-chan (박영찬) Lifan " Viva " Ran (冉立凡) Yong " jkuro " Haochong (杨浩聪) Liu " Z1yan " Zihan (刘紫涵) Li " sword9 " Wei (李卫) Jiang " Jayce " Yudong (蒋昱栋) (Manager) Yang " EGO " Haozun (杨皓尊) (Head coach) Xie " hypnotizing " Haozhi (谢昊志) (Assistant coach)

title: Xi Lai Gaming signs YOU
cleaned_content: Xi Lai Gaming has signed former ZY Gaming and Trace Esports player Yip " YOU " Man Ho . The roster move is XLG's first addition of the offseason. Since lifting Ascension China , they parted ways with then-IGL Kr1stal and coach Fayde . Kr1stal played mainly as an initiating in-game leader for XLG, and the signing of YOU seems to address that need. YOU mainly plays the Initiator role, with Fade and Sova being his go-to agents. YOU made his professional debut in 2020 with Hong Kong side Only One Word . He has also previously played for Totoro Gaming and Weibo Gaming . Since the end of the 2024 VCT season, YOU has competed for Xi Lai Gaming in the WALL-E Cup , where the team competed against other Chinese VCT teams and finished third. They are also set to compete at the FGC Invitational , where they will test themselves against a field of ten Chinese VCT teams. Xi Lai Gaming 's roster is now: Arthur " Rarga " Churyumov Deng " happywei " Minwei (邓闵维) Fei " Satoshi " Zhixian (费郅贤) Chen " MrCANI " Tingxun (陈廷训) Zhuo " MarT1n " Zhengjie (卓政杰) Yip " YOU " Man Ho Aleksandr " hvoya " Eremin (Head coach)

title: BOOM Esports picks up dos9
cleaned_content: BOOM Esports has signed Zhumagali " dos9 " Dastan for VCT 2025. He will replace Sha " ZesBeeW " Mohtar , who parted ways with the team earlier this month. dos9 most recently played for Revenant Esports in Challengers League South Asia . After placing top-four in Split 1 , Revenant rallied to win Split 2 in undefeated fashion and qualify for Pacific Ascension . Individually, dos9 led the league (excluding the Premier play-ins) with an impressive 1.41 rating, 1.66 K:D ratio, and 0.97 KPR, all while playing seven different agents. Revenant went on to finish top-eight in Ascension after being eliminated by Disguised . BOOM's journey to qualify for Ascension was more turbulent. Following an early loss to Alter Ego in the upper semifinals of Challengers League Indonesia , they fought through the lower bracket and exacted revenge against Alter Ego 3-2 in the grand final. An even more thrilling grand final awaited the Indonesian squad at Ascension. On their home turf in Jakarta, BOOM battled Sin Prisa Gaming to the very end, eventually losing the series in a heartbreaking 17-15 map 5. It seemed that BOOM would return to Challengers after failing to ascend. However, on Oct. 4, Riot announced the removal of BLEED from the VCT Pacific League and the promotion of BOOM in their stead. dos9 and the rest of BOOM will return to play in VCT Pacific 2025, where the length of their stay will be contingent on their performance. BOOM Esports is now: Zhumagali " dos9 " Dastan Fikri " Famouz " Zaki Hamdani Hildegard " Shiro " Arnaldo Sheldon " NcSlasher " Andersen Chandra Rizkie " BerserX " Adla Kusuma Harry " 6fingers " Tjahjadi Putra (Assistant coach) Fidel " Fidelwow " Saputra (Analyst)

title: Evil Geniuses parts ways with Apoth
cleaned_content: Evil Geniuses is parting ways with longtime player Vincent " Apoth " Le . Before joining Evil Geniuses, Apoth played for North American Challengers teams Renegades and VIRTUOSO , with those tenures coming before franchising. He made his professional Valorant debut in 2020. Apoth spent three seasons with the organization but was not a starter for his entire tenure. In 2022 with Apoth as a starter, Evil Geniuses competed in North America Challengers . In Stage 1, they were eliminated in the group stage, and in Stage 2 , they finished 5th-6th, failing to qualify for a single international event. In the 2022 season, Apoth played as EG's Controller player, not shying away from any agent but most often playing Omen or Viper. As VCT entered a new era of franchising in 2023 EG's roster swelled to, at one point, ten players. That season, the team achieved a third-place finish in the Americas League , qualifying to Masters Tokyo , where they finished second to European powerhouses FNATIC . Then, at Champions Los Angeles , they became the first North American team to lift an international trophy in Valorant's history. Shortly after Champions, EG released their entire reserve roster, which included Apoth. However, their paths would cross again soon when they signed him as their fifth player for the 2024 season. With a nearly new-look team taking to the stage after three of their starters were poached away, role changes were inevitable for EG and Apoth. He almost exclusively played the Sentinel role as Killjoy or Cypher, while occasionally playing Controller as part of a double Controller team composition. The 2024 season saw EG fail to qualify not just for any international events, but any playoffs within the Americas region, too. Apoth's departure is Evil Geniuses' first roster move since star duelist jawgemo departed and joined fellow North American team G2 Esports . Evil Geniuses ' roster is now: Nicholas " NaturE " Garrison Derrek " Derrek " Ha Phat " supamen " Le Christine " potter " Chi (Head coach) Mike " pho " Panza (Assistant coach)

title: BBL Esports completes 2025 roster
cleaned_content: UPDATE: This article, which was originally published on October 22, has been updated as of October 25 to reflect the signings of PROFEK, sociablEE, chiwa, and PAL. With these signings, BBL has announced their full 2025 roster. BBL Esports has signed Elias " Jamppi " Olkkonen as their in-game leader for VCT EMEA 2025, pending Riot approval. As of October 25, they have also announced the signings of Dawid " PROFEK " Święć , Volkan " sociablEE " Yonal , and Egor " chiwa " Stepanyuk . Gregor " PAL " Morton has also been added as an assistant coach. "I am so happy to get this opportunity and represent BBL for next year," Jamppi commented . "To be part of this is an absolute honor." Jamppi hails from Team Liquid after having been with the team all the way since February 2021. His accomplishments with the team include a top-four finish at Champions 2021 , a top-eight placement at Champions 2022 , and a first-place triumph in the 2023 EMEA League . However, Liquid struggled in 2024 as it was the first year in the organization's history that they failed to qualify for an international event. PROFEK recently played with GoNext Esports in Challengers League East . Excluding the league's Promotion Cup, in which his team did not participate, the controller player distinguished himself with a best-in-league 1.28 rating and 1.47 K:D ratio over the course of Split 2. GoNext claimed first place in the split to qualify for EMEA Ascension , where they exited in the group stage with a 2-2 record. sociablEE has been a mainstay in the Turkish Valorant scene since 2021. He last competed with Fire Flux Vatangame in Challengers League Türkiye throughout 2024 as a flex. The team notably won Split 1 and later placed fifth in the Split 2 playoffs, missing out on Ascension. Individually, sociablEE ended Split 2 with a strong 1.17 rating and 1.20 K:D ratio. Much like PROFEK, chiwa spent the 2024 season as a top player in Challengers League East. He served as the sentinel for Acend and placed third with the team in Split 2 after falling 2-3 to Diamant Esports in the lower final, ultimately failing to qualify for Ascension. He recorded the third-highest rating in the league during the split at 1.14. PAL most recently served a brief stint as an assistant coach for Team Vitality throughout their run at Champions 2024 . Before that, he coached various Challengers teams in EMEA, including FOKUS , WYLDE , and Fire Flux Vatangame . BBL spent the 2024 season in a middling position in the standings, finishing seventh overall. In both stages, the Turkish squad came just one placement shy of qualification to the EMEA playoffs after a five-way 3-3 tiebreaker in Stage 1 and a three-way 4-6 tiebreaker in Stage 2 . Since then, BBL has parted with the entirety of their 2024 roster and picked up Burak " LewN " Alkan from Galatasaray Esports in Challengers League Türkiye . These arrivals to BBL mark the organization's first-ever signings of non-Turkish players and indicate a new international direction for the squad. This will also be Jamppi's first time serving in a formal in-game leader position. The new BBL roster will next compete in the EMEA LCQ of Red Bull Home Ground , which starts on Oct. 26. For VCT 2025, BBL Esports is: Elias " Jamppi " Olkkonen Burak " LewN " Alkan Dawid " PROFEK " Święć Volkan " sociablEE " Yonal Egor " chiwa " Stepanyuk Salih " marqnue " Onaran (Head coach) Gregor " PAL " Morton (Assistant coach)

title: A retrospective on Apeks' journey through Ascension
cleaned_content: Apeks was one of just three teams worldwide that made it back to an Ascension finals in 2024 after losing in the finals the year prior. When they returned to try again, they earned a spot in VCT EMEA off the back of experienced talent and a star duelist, none of whom played for Apeks in that prior year's final. Heading into the 2024 season, Apeks lost their core of Enzo , keiko , and Mistic to Team Liquid, while ShadoW and MAGNUM joined other tier one rosters in EMEA. Even Itopata , their former coach, moved on to make big changes to their future VCT team. That left coaches DANNYTO and Desmo to head the rebuild of Apeks, aiming to continue competing for Ascension. “To win Ascension, you essentially have to be a good VCT team and an Ascension-winning team,” Desmo said. “Some of the best Ascension teams are VCT-quality, but only one team from each region makes it. We built this roster with the intent to compete in VCT, and I was confident with what we built. I feel like Apeks as a team is stronger than its parts, which is why we can compete with anyone.” Desmo was one of the two coaches who stuck around from 2023 to 2024, with roles ranging from analyst to assistant coach. He wasn't key to building the 2023 roster, as he was more of a pickup specifically for their Ascension tournament run in 2023. However, in 2024, he was crucial to their strategy and the building of Apeks. That included picking up former tier one players soulcas , hype , MOLSI , and AvovA . The team then rounded it out with their future tournament MVP kaajak , who joined Apeks after grinding through tier three in Poland. “We always knew about his potential, but the core question was: could he perform when it mattered?” Desmo said about kajaak. “He developed consistency from his routine to his performance in-game, and it boosted his confidence. Everyone on the team knew he could be an amazing player.” A team photo of Apeks in 2024. (Image via Apeks) Kaajak ended the Ascension EMEA 2024 tournament leading many stats , including a 274.2 ACS, 1.36 K/D, 175.1 ADR, and 0.25 FKPR. He led his team in match rating for every series aside from the grand finals against PCIFIC Esports . Even in a five-map series where kaajak was more understated in his performance, he stood up on the final map of Ascent and finished with a 21/12/6 Yoru masterclass. Moving from tier three to tier two looked to be easy for kaajak as he helped his team reach tier one in his first season, but it was tougher than it looked from a distance. A newfound focus on mental health, with assistance from the coaching staff, helped form kaajak from a potential star to the team's catalyst. “I was feeling pressure until I started working with my mental coach, and he helped me take the focus off of myself and more on the collective team,” kaajak said. “My expectations for myself are high, so I had to learn that even though I have a bad day, it wasn't only me playing the game. The first tournament, Superdome, was stressful, but I got better as the year went on.” Apeks finished in fourth place at Superdome 2023 , but only improved as 2024 began. While Split 1 was strong, Split 2 was a step up for kaajak statistically, heading into Ascension in form. It was a big change to go from playing online to on stage, and it showed in their first group stage match against GoNext Esports . While the team looked strong early on, they lost and learned some valuable lessons that helped them later down the line. “The thing we learned as a team was that we needed to manage our energy, no matter how long the series,” MOLSI said. “When we won our first map against GoNext, we were shouting like crazy, but we couldn't keep that energy for map two. We cannot waste everything emotionally on one map and then fall off later in the series. If you need that hype for an insane round that's fine, but we needed to save that energy.” MOLSI himself knew the importance of this moment, as a player who had played on tier one rosters like Team Vitality and OG LDN UTD . He wasn't too familiar with best-of-fives, but he had to take the reins while relying on some of the other experienced members of his team. “I don't think I played a ton of best-of-fives, but AvovA and soulcas have and it showed in those finals. AvovA especially was keeping the mood up and hyping us up. For me, it was a bit harder, because it was a fierce tournament where I had to put all of my focus into strong calling. Polaris was online, but on stage, that player experience led us to be calm.” With that tight 3-2 win over the young PCIFIC Espor, Apeks secured their spot in VCT EMEA for 2025. There were plenty of explanations for how they managed to reach back-to-back grand finals with entirely different rosters, but Desmo and MOLSI both knew exactly why this team made it so far: the family-like care they developed for each other. “Apeks is a team with good chemistry above all else, where everyone has a good sense of humor,” MOLSI said. “Personally, I wanted everyone to feel that we listened to them. At some point, as the IGL, I needed to use that IGL experience to make sure that everyone felt comfortable in their roles. We had everything we needed, from bootcamps to coaching, and we built to have that familial connection.”

title: Apeks parts ways with kaajak, soulcas, and Desmo
cleaned_content: Apeks has parted ways with players Kajetan " kaajak " Haremski , Dom " soulcas " Sulcas , and assistant coach Casper " Desmo " Rasmussen . The roster moves come just over a month after the team lifted EMEA Ascension , granting them entry into VCT as EMEA's 12th team for the 2025 season. kaajak, who with Apeks displayed the ability to perform on several different Duelist agents, leaves after just one full season with the team. In the run-up to the Ascension grand final, he had a breakout 45-kill game in the team's 2-0 upper final sweep of CGN Esports . He made his professional debut in 2021, and before joining Apeks, was already well-established in Europe's second-tier of Valorant. He had a brief tenure with Zero Tenacity , and also played for Incognito . soulcas, like the rest of his Apeks teammates, joined the team at the end of the 2023 season, months after the team fell in the grand final of EMEA Ascension 2023 to Gentle Mates . He has a wide agent pool, playing Initiators like KAY/O and Sova, filling the Sentinel role as Deadlock, and also playing as Astra when the team took on a double-Controller composition. Before joining Apeks, soulcas played for Team Liquid for three seasons, and was the last remaining original member of the fish123 that Liquid acquired. Desmo has been a Valorant coach since 2021, previously on volvo peek , Alliance , bonk , and Alliance Coven . He joined Apeks in 2023, and was soon promoted to the team's strategic coach position following Itopata 's departure to LEVIATÁN . "Winning Ascension 2024 with these guys will forever be one of my fondest memories of my esports career, Desmo said via Apeks' press release. "I cannot wait to see how the team turns out and I'm really excited to watch them in EMEA next VCT Season." As they look to build their roster ahead of their maiden season in the VCT, Apeks 's roster is now: Tautvydas " hype " Paldavicius Michał " MOLSI " Łącki Auni " AvovA " Chahade Sabína " Leonieahh " Jankovič (Manager) Danail " DANNYTO " Sofroniev (Head coach)

title: FNATIC adds Sayonara for the offseason
cleaned_content: FNATIC has welcomed Ștefan " Sayonara " Mîtcu to the team for the rest of the current VCT offseason. He will specifically play with the team for their upcoming offseason events, as he is 16 years old and thus ineligible to play in the 2025 season. He will take the place of Leo " Leo " Jannesson at both Red Bull Home Ground in November and Riot Games ONE in December, as Leo remains inactive since June of this year due to health reasons. FNATIC stated in their announcement that Leo is preparing to return to the main roster for VCT 2025. Sayonara is best known for his time with KPI Gaming in Challengers League Spain , where he played both duelist and initiator. Individually, the young star topped the league in Split 2 in almost every category with a 1.36 rating, 1.52 K:D ratio, 80% KAST, and 0.93 KPR. After winning Split 1 , KPI finished third in Split 2 and attempted to fight their way into EMEA Ascension through the play-ins, but fell at the final hurdle to eventual third-place finishers CGN Esports . FNATIC spent their 2024 season continuing to lead EMEA regionally but struggling to maintain their international form after winning both LOCK//IN and Masters Tokyo in 2023. Their best result this year was a top-six finish at Champions in Seoul. Since then, they have bid farewell to Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev , who recently joined Team Vitality after over three years with FNATIC. Sayonara and the rest of FNATIC will return to defend the team's Red Bull Home Ground title when the main event begins on Nov. 22. FNATIC is currently: Jake " Boaster " Howlett Timofey " Chronicle " Khromov Emir " Alfajer " Ali Beder Ștefan " Sayonara " Mîtcu Leo " Leo " Jannesson (Sub) Chris " Elmapuddy " Tebbit (Head coach) Milan " Milan " de Meij (Assistant coach)

title: Foxy9 joins Gen.G
cleaned_content: Gen.G has signed former DRX player Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) . Foxy9 made his debut in 2021 in the second tier of Valorant, playing in South Korea and Japan with World Game Star , Feel So Good , and REIGNITE . He made the jump to VCT towards the end of the 2022 season, signing with Korean giants DRX. Earlier this month, DRX announced that he and teammate BeYN were restricted free agents. In 2023, his first season with DRX, he competed for the team's fifth starting spot with veteran Zest , who was with the team since its Vision Strikers days. He was benched two games into the team's Masters Tokyo campaign, and would not see the stage at Champions Los Angeles . Foxy9 stayed on DRX for 2024, a tumultuous season for the team that saw them shuffle their roster and depart with longtime player stax . He was most known for playing the Duelist role heading into the year, but took on the Sentinel role, playing Killjoy and Cypher more. As the season progressed, his agent pool expanded to include Initiators such as Breach, KAY/O, and Gekko. With mid-year roster turnover and a changing meta, DRX did not qualify for an international event until Champions Seoul , where they finished 5th-6th. Foxy9 joins a Gen.G team that had a dominant 2024 season which ended in a disappointing group stage elimination at Champions. They held onto core pieces t3xture , Karon , and Munchkin while signing Korean tier-two player yoman . Gen.G are set to compete at the TEN Valorant Asia Invitational and then the Gwangju Esports Series Asia 2024 in the offseason before the end of the calendar year. With their sights set on defending their Pacific crown, the new-look Gen.G roster is now: Byeon " Munchkin " Sang-beom (변상범) Kim " t3xture " Na-ra (김나라) Chae " yoman " Young-moon (채영문) Kim " Karon " Won-tae (김원태) Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) Kang " solo " Geun-chul (강근철) (Head coach) Kim " HSK " Hae-seong (김해성) (Staff)

title: Gen.G signs yoman
cleaned_content: Gen.G has signed former Nongshim RedForce player Chae " yoman " Young-moon (채영문) . The Korean Initiator is most known for his play on Sova, Fade, and Skye. He's likely to replace the role that Lakia , the team's main Initiator last season, played on Gen.G. Since making his professional debut in 2023, he's played for three different teams within Valorant's pro scene, but Gen.G will be his first foray into VCT. With NongShim RedForce in 2024, yoman competed in the Korean VCL circuit, falling in a five-map grand final to eventual Pacific Ascension champions Sin Prisa Gaming . In 2023 with Rare Atom , yoman helped the team finish second in China Evolution Series Act 3: Heritability , but lost in the grand final to EDward Gaming . He also played for Korean Challengers team Gwangju Shadow previously. yoman's previous experience as an in-game leader provides Gen.G significant flexibility. Gen.G, who reached five grand finals and lifted three trophies this past season, ended 2024 on a sour note, bowing out in the group stages of Champions Seoul . Since then, they have made a handful of roster moves, first securing the re-signings of t3xture and Karon , while also extending the contract of coach HSK . The organization parted ways with and then re-signed in-game leader Munchkin , but has let Meteor and Lakia leave. Gen.G 's roster is now: Byeon " Munchkin " Sang-beom (변상범) Kim " t3xture " Na-ra (김나라) Chae " yoman " Young-moon (채영문) Kim " Karon " Won-tae (김원태) Kang " solo " Geun-chul (강근철) (Head coach) Kim " HSK " Hae-seong (김해성) (Staff)

title: Gentle Mates parts with five players and full coaching staff
cleaned_content: Gentle Mates has parted ways with almost the entirety of their 2024 roster, including Wailers " Wailers " Locart , Jonathan " TakaS " Paupard , Nathan " nataNk " Bocqueho , Beyazit " beyAz " Körpe , and Logan " logaN " Corti . They have also bid farewell to previous head coach Kévin " Ex6TenZ " Droolans , who was benched in June, head coach Kevin " madc " Ducourtioux , and assistant coach Florentin " Derly " Derly . The only player remaining on the roster is Thomas " Kada " Johner , who joined from DVM Esport in place of logaN after the end of EMEA Stage 1 . This spells the end for the SBG lineup that competed in Challengers League France before becoming Gentle Mates in April 2023. The French squad won both regional splits in 2023 to qualify for EMEA Ascension . They went on to win the event, defeating Apeks 3-0 in the grand final and earning a place in VCT EMEA for two guaranteed years. Gentle Mates opened VCT EMEA 2024 with a 0-2 exit in Kickoff . After missing out on the Stage 1 playoffs by one placement, they ended the regular season at tenth place in the league with a 3-7 record. The French organization must qualify for Champions Paris and perform better than Apeks in the 2025 season in order to retain their spot in VCT EMEA for 2026. If they fail to do so but finish in the top eight domestically, they will be given the opportunity to defend their slot in Ascension. Down to just one member, Gentle Mates is currently: Thomas " Kada " Johner

title: Juv3nile joins Global Esports as head coach
cleaned_content: Global Esports has picked up Preston " Juv3nile " Dornon as their head coach for the 2025 season. Juv3nile most recently served LEVIATÁN as an assistant coach. His addition in June of 2024 came as part of a larger coaching shift for the team, as they had just parted ways with former head coach Alex " goked " Kie and promoted previous assistant coach Dimitar " Itopata " Staev in his stead following an early exit in the Swiss stage of Masters Shanghai . Leviatán proceeded to find successes throughout the rest of the year, winning Americas Stage 2 and going on an impressive run to place third at Champions 2024 . Global Esports entered the 2024 season with an completely different roster compared to 2023. They promoted previous substitute Abhirup " Lightningfast " Choudhury , brought in Niko " Polvi " Polvinen from EMEA, and rounded out the roster with the likes of Gary " blaZek1ng " Dastin , Benedict " Benkai " Tan , and Russel " Russ " Mendes as the in-game leader. While the team managed to pick up a win against BLEED during Kickoff , they were quickly dispatched by ZETA DIVISION and exited in the group stage of the event. The rest of the season continued similarly; the team ultimately ended the regular season with a 3-7 record, failing to qualify for the playoffs of either stage and finishing ninth in the league. Since then, Global Esports once again parted ways with their entire roster in favor of another rebuild. Juv3nile is the first of many pieces to be added to the squad for the coming year. Global Esports is currently: Preston " Juv3nile " Dornon (Head coach) Hose " taeri " Son (손호세) (Manager) Vatsal " Vatsal " Uniyal (Staff)

title: Team Vitality welcomes Derke
cleaned_content: Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev has officially signed with Team Vitality for the 2025 season, pending Riot approval. Derke had previously been with FNATIC throughout all of his tier-one career, dating all the way back to April 2021. One of the most decorated and consistent players in the game, the Finnish duelist's accomplishments include placing second at Masters Reykjavik 2021 , winning LOCK//IN and Masters Tokyo back-to-back in 2023, qualifying for almost every VCT international event, and being a top performer at nearly every event he has attended. While still an international mainstay in 2024, FNATIC is considered by many to have underperformed the sky-high expectations set for them following their 2023 dominance; their worst international result of 2023 was a fourth place finish at Champions 2023 , while their best international result of 2024 was a top-six placement at Champions 2024 . Despite this decline, Derke still produced the highest ACS and KPR in Seoul at 257.4 and 0.92 respectively. Vitality, on the other hand, achieved their first international qualification this past year, earning a spot at Champions 2024 via an impressive run through the EMEA Stage 2 playoffs . They were defeated only by FNATIC in the upper final and the grand final to place second in the region. Vitality later exited Seoul in the group stage after being eliminated by LEVIATÁN in the group C decider. The French organization has since parted ways with Emil " runneR " Trajkovski and much of their coaching staff, and added Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso as a non-resident player. The introduction of Derke represents the second world champion to join Vitality and the creation of a new EMEA superteam with talent rivaling top teams from around the world. Team Vitality is now: Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso Nikita " Derke " Sirmitev Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: FUT Esports finalizes roster with xeus
cleaned_content: FUT Esports has completed their 2025 roster with the signing of Doğan " xeus " Gözgen . He will likely take the place of cNed , who is the only previous player who has not been announced to return. xeus has been on the come-up in the Turkish challengers league, most recently playing with HOWL Esports . In the Split 1 regular season, HOWL was a top two team, matching the league favorite Fire Flux Vatangame with a 7-2 record. In the playoffs, however, they fell short and only placed fourth. During Split 2 , they once again were a top two team in the regular season. When the favorites fell early in the first round of playoffs, the door was left open for HOWL to take the Ascension slot. Unfortunately for them, the newcomer PCIFIC Esports from premier would shut the door on HOWL's season, defeating them in the grand finals . Despite the loss, xeus was a standout for them all season, ending split two as the second-highest rated player in the league. FUT has been a stable force in the EMEA league. As a top team in the league, they have represented EMEA at four of the last five international events. With the addition of cNed and yetujey this year, they reached their highest placement yet, placing in the top six at Masters Shanghai . However, they had a disappointing winless exit at Champions . FUT is debuting their new star duelist in the Turkey Qualifier of the Red Bull Home Ground. They have already won their first match with him against Papara SuperMassive . FUT Esports is now: Furkan " MrFaliN " Yeğen Doğan " xeus " Gözgen Eray " yetujey " Budak Ata " AtaKaptan " Tan Mehmet " cNed " Yağız İpek Doğukan " qRaxs " Balaban Berke " Mol " Mol (Manager) Eray " Gais " Sarikaya (Head coach) Alp " sw4y " Özkuvancı (Assistant coach)

title: Titan Esports Club signs Haodong and AfteR
cleaned_content: Titan Esports Club has announced the signings of Guo " Haodong " Haodong (郭浩东) and Lo " AfteR " Wen-Hsin (罗文信) . The pair join after previously spending their entire Valorant careers with EDward Gaming . Titan also parted ways with assistant coach Yao " York " Kun (姚堃) , who joined TEC in 2024. Before joining, York spent time with Shenzhen NTER and EDward Gaming as a player. AfteR, a former head coach of Chinese giants EDG since 2020, assumed an inactive role within EDG in June of this year after disappointing results to begin China Stage 2 . Haodong has been on EDG's roster since the 2021 season, and has spent a portion of that time as the team's in-game leader. Earlier this year, he was replaced by S1Mon one game into Stage 2. With EDG in 2024, the pair helped the organization lift trophies at China Kickoff , and China Stage 1 as a player, and after transitioning to coaching, helped the team lift trophies at Stage 2 and Champions Seoul . It is believed that Haodong will return as a player for Titan. He boasts experience as the former in-game leader for EDG. Following a 5th-6th place finish at China Evolution Series Act 3: Heritability to end their 2023 season, they started their 2024 VCT season by picking up seasoned Korean veteran Rb , a founding member of DRX. Titan had a tough 2024 VCT season. After being eliminated in the play-ins of China Kickoff, they went 2-3 in Stage 1, missing out on playoffs. They wrapped up Stage 2 with just one win and an overall 3-7 record that made them the last-placed team in VCT China. Titan Esports club is now: Wei " AC " Jiacong (韦家聪) Guo " Haodong " Haodong (郭浩东) Xing " LockM " Fuling (邢福凌) Han " Abo " Bohao (韩博皓) Piao " kawaii " Min (朴民) Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) Li " B1ack " Songtai (李松泰) Liu " 3water " Miao (刘淼) (Head coach) Lo " AfteR " Wen-Hsin (罗文信) (Coach)

title: Sentinels picks up Gunter as assistant coach
