cleaned_content: Sentinels has signed Luke " GUNTER " Clives as their assistant coach for the VCT 2025 season. “The final piece of the puzzle,” the team declared in the announcement . Gunter spent the 2023 and 2024 seasons serving as the assistant coach for M80 in Challengers League North America . In both years, M80 claimed first prize in North America before ultimately finishing second in Americas Ascension , falling to The Guard (now G2 Esports) in their first attempt and to 2Game Esports in their second. Gunter reunites with head coach Adam " kaplan " Kaplan and in-game leader Mohamed " johnqt " Amine Ouarid , both of whom he worked with previously as part of Ghost Gaming in 2021. He continued to work alongside johnqt past that point on the Ghostbusters team that later became the core of M80. This signing comes after Sentinels parted ways with previous assistant coach Drew " DrewSpark " Spark-Whitworth earlier in the offseason. 2024 saw Sentinels open the year triumphantly with an international trophy win at Masters Madrid . The team's performance declined somewhat in the middle of the year as they missed out on the Americas Stage 1 playoffs and scraped into Champions 2024 as the region's fourth seed via circuit points. However, they rallied in Seoul and found a top-four finish to end what was ultimately a highly successful year. The team has since added Marshall " N4RRATE " Massey and Sean " bang " Bezerra following the retirements of Tyson " TenZ " Ngo and Gustavo " Sacy " Rossi . Sentinels is now: Mohamed " johnqt " Amine Ouarid Marshall " N4RRATE " Massey Sean " bang " Bezerra Jordan " Zellsis " Montemurro Zachary " zekken " Patrone Yassin " Reduxx " Aboulalazm Adam " kaplan " Kaplan (Head coach) Luke " GUNTER " Clives (Assistant coach)

title: BBL Esports partners with PCIFIC Espor for 2025
cleaned_content: BBL Esports has announced that PCIFIC Esports will represent the tier-one organization in Challengers League Türkiye 2025 as their affiliate partner under the name BBL PCIFIC . The team's Valorant Operations Manager da1mon confirmed that BBL PCIFIC will represent BBL at the Turkey Qualifier for Red Bull Home Ground, while the main VCT roster will compete in the event's EMEA LCQ . Additionally, Ali " Crewen " Eren Sargin has been added to the PCIFIC roster following the recent departure of Emir " Celasun " Celasun . PCIFIC most recently finished second in EMEA Ascension after being defeated 3-2 by Apeks in the grand final. With three players under the age of eighteen, PCIFIC took Challengers League Türkiye by storm, earning promotion into the league from Premier in May and ultimately winning the Split 2 playoffs in undefeated fashion to qualify for Ascension. Crewen comes into the team from HOWL Esports , the team that finished second behind PCIFIC in Split 2. He will replace Celasun as the team's sentinel player. PCIFIC, now as BBL PCIFIC, will return in the Red Bull Home Ground Turkey Qualifier tomorrow on Oct. 19 versus CONFIGSTARZ . BBL's main VCT roster will presumably be revealed by Oct. 26, which marks the beginning of the Red Bull Home Ground EMEA LCQ. BBL PCIFIC is currently: Berkcan " ComeBack " Şentürk Eren " Rosé " Erzan Utku " Loita " Kart Yusuf " Lar0k " Kaan Kanber Ali " Crewen " Eren Sargin Mert " KEY " Çelebi (Coach) Arda " Haul " Özgül (Analyst)

title: FURIA parts ways with xand and Koy
cleaned_content: FURIA has parted ways with coach Pedro " Koy " Pulig and player Alexandre " xand " Zizi , ending his second stint with the organization. xand, who also played for FURIA in the 2021 season, departs after joining in the middle of the 2024 season. He joined ahead of the team began their Americas Stage 2 campaign, which followed a winless run of seven matches through Americas Kickoff and Stage 1 . In that span, FURIA only won two maps overall, and they brought back xand in hopes of rescuing some victories. With FURIA in 2024, xand mainly played the Initiator role while also being the team's go-to Sage player on Icebox. Before FURIA, xand competed for KRÜ Esports , 00Nation , and Ninjas In Pyjamas . In their first match, FURIA defeated Stage 1 champions 100 Thieves . They went on to win three of their last five matches, including a win over LOUD , the first time a Brazilian team had defeated them. Despite the uptick in form, it was too little too late. FURIA finished the season ranked tenth in the Americas League, a far cry from their 5th-6th place finish last season. Koy joined FURIA in the offseason before the 2024 season, boasting prior coaching experience with Keyd Stars , RED Canids , and Black Dragons . FURIA 's roster is now: Leonardo " mwzera " Serrati Ilan " havoc " Eloy Khalil " Khalil " Schmidt Lucas " lukzera " Soares (Assistant coach)

title: Less joins Team Vitality
cleaned_content: Team Vitality has signed Felipe " Less " Basso to play in VCT EMEA for the 2025 season, pending Riot approval. Less departs LOUD after three years with the organization. The Brazilian superstar joined the original LOUD roster at the beginning of 2022. They opened the year with an undefeated run through Brazil Stage 1: Challengers 1 and placed second at Masters Reykjavik , only being defeated by OpTic Gaming . The squad returned to the international stage at Masters Copenhagen but were eliminated in the group stage by OpTic. In a definitive moment for what remains one of the most storied rivalries in Valorant history, Less along with the rest of LOUD exacted revenge against OpTic in the grand final of Champions 2022 to take home Brazil's first ever international trophy. Forever a world champion. (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) 2023 saw Gustavo " Sacy " Rossi and Bryan " pANcada " Luna part ways with the team; their roles were subsequently filled by Cauan " cauanzin " Pereira and Arthur " tuyz " Andrade . Despite the changes, LOUD carved an impressive path to a second place finish on their home turf at LOCK//IN . They exited Masters Tokyo with an 0-2 record before recovering to a third place finish at Champions 2023 . Coming into the 2024 season, LOUD underwent yet another change as Erick " aspas " Santos left the team. While LOUD began the year with a strong fourth place result at Masters Madrid , they struggled during the regular season and failed to qualify to an international event for the first time in the team's history, missing out on both Masters Shanghai and Champions 2024. Vitality attained their first international qualification last year, punching their ticket to Champions 2024 with a second-place finish in EMEA Stage 2 in part thanks to extraordinary performances from Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel and Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko , who were both top rated players in the split. The European squad later went out 1-2 in the group stage of Seoul. Less' addition to Vitality represents the French organization's first import from outside of EMEA and the potential development of a team with the star power to contend on the global stage ahead of Champions Paris in September 2025. Team Vitality is currently: Felipe " Less " de Loyola Basso Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: ZETA Division unveils full roster
cleaned_content: ZETA DIVISION has announced the signings of Yuto " Xdll " Mizomori , Shota " SyouTa " Aoki , Hikaru " CLZ " Mizutani , and coach Ivan " Johnta " Shevtsov from Japanese Challengers team FENNEL . In addition, they have brought back their previous coach Motoyama " XQQ " Hibiki as an assistant. The player trio had been with FENNEL for at least the past two seasons, and CLZ's tenure of three years was the longest among players on the roster. FENNEL had a successful 2024 campaign but fell short of securing Japan's lone qualifying spot into Pacific Ascension . In the grand final of Challengers League Japan Split 2 , they lost to RIDDLE ORDER in a five-map match that lasted over seven hours due to technical difficulties. SyouTa finished with a server-high 95 kills, while Xdll's 203 ACS was the second-highest. CLZ's 1.09 rating was a team-high in the match as well. All three players had some aspect of versatility in their agent pool in 2024. While both CLZ and Xdll are most often playing the Intiator role, they have both shown an effective ability to use Sage. The same can be said for SyouTa, who throughout the FENNEL's VCL Japan campaign played the Controller and Sentinel roles, but shined brightest as a Duelist. The signings seem to be ZETA's plan to rebuild their roster, which has depleted in recent months. In 2024, ZETA Division failed to qualify for any international events, also missing out on the playoffs of Pacific Stage 1 and Stage 2 after a 7th place finish at Kickoff . They finished Stage 2 ranked 8th in the Pacific region. The season came after a 2023 campaign that saw the Japanese side qualify for its second consecutive Champions event. Just under two months after the conclusion of his 2024 season, longtime player and Japanese icon Laz announced his retirement from competitive Valorant, announcing his intentions to join the organization's content division. Weeks later, yuran and hiroronn announced that they would be allowed to explore their options as restricted free agents, reducing the size of ZETA's active roster to just two. The signings now completes the ZETA Division roster, which now rounds out to: Yuma " Dep " Hashimoto Shota " SugarZ3ro " Watanabe Hikaru " CLZ " Mizutani Shota " SyouTa " Aoki Yuto " Xdll " Mizomori Ivan " Johnta " Shevtsov (Head coach) Motoyama " XQQ " Hibiki (Assistant coach) Carlos " Carlao " Mohn (Assistant coach) " nokaze37 " (Analyst) " gya9 " (Analyst)

title: Team Liquid announces kamo, LohaN, yaotziN
cleaned_content: Team Liquid CEO Victor Goossens has confirmed the addition of Kamil " kamo " Frąckowiak to Liquid's roster for the 2025 season. He has also confirmed their new coaching staff, which consists of head coach Ivo " LohaN " Albino and assistant coach Daniel " yaotziN. " Roczniak . This announcement comes hours after KOI 's announcement that kamo had parted ways with the team after playing with the organization throughout the 2024 season. In his announcement , Goossens addressed previous controversies surrounding kamo's career: “With effort and sincerity, the opportunity for rehabilitation can be earned. We have learned a lot about kamo during our meetings and trial period, and we believe he deserves that opportunity. He has apologized for his past (which you can read in the articles linked above ) and has taken meaningful steps to address his behavior in private, and we will support that growth — without minimizing the seriousness of his past behavior.” "I am very grateful for how Team Liquid contemplated the situation," kamo added . "I will still do my best to work on myself as an individual and continue growing because personal development is a lifelong journey." kamo most recently served as KOI's duelist throughout the 2024 season. During that time, KOI failed to qualify for the regional playoffs in either stage and ultimately ended the season at the bottom of the standings with a 3-7 record. Individually, kamo topped the league in ACS and ADR in Stage 2 with an impressive 249.6 and 161.3 respectively. LohaN joins the team as head coach after spending the past season coaching Joblife in Challengers League France . Joblife claimed first prize in France to qualify for EMEA Ascension , where they were narrowly eliminated in the group stage with a 2-2 record. LohaN previously coached kamo in 2022 as part of GTZ Esports in Challengers League Portugal . yaotziN. spent the 2024 season coaching SK Gaming in Challengers League DACH . SK Gaming ended the regular season with a 4-5 record and barely missed out on advancing to the regional playoffs. Team Liquid built their 2024 roster around the former Apeks core of keiko , Enzo , and Mistic . For the first time in the organization's history, they failed to qualify for any international events over the course of the year, placing eighth in VCT EMEA with a 4-6 regular season record. Since then, the team has retained keiko and nAts and parted ways with Jamppi , Enzo, Mistic, and former head coach eMIL . Team Liquid is currently: Ayaz " nAts " Akhmetshin Georgio " keiko " Sanassy Kamil " kamo " Frąckowiak Nico " Harmii " Harms (Sub) Ivo " LohaN " Albino (Head coach) Daniel " yaotziN. " Roczniak (Assistant coach) Jake " Bacon9 " Lloyd (Analyst)

title: DFM announce full 2025 roster
cleaned_content: DetonatioN FocusMe has announced its full roster for the 2025 season, which includes a total of six players with four new signings. The new signings are Koki " Art " Kagami , Yu " Akame " Gwang-hui (유광희) , Kim " Jinboong " Jin-won (김진원) , and Koki " gyen " Nakamura . The roster, which fuses players from Korea and Japan, also has SSeeS and Meiy from last year's team. Art spent the 2024 season coaching for Sengoku Gaming , and most recently played for Japanese VCL side Jadeite . He is mainly a Controller player, but also played the Initiator role on occasion for Jadeite. Prior to them, he played for Sengoku as well. Akame joins after nearly a year with REJECT , who compete in the Japanese Challengers circuit. He also spent time on Jadeite, where he was teammates with Art. The Korean was REJECT's in-game leader last season, and played a wide range of roles including Controller, Sentinel, and Duelist. Jinboong also joins from a second-tier Japanese side. He was on Sengoku Gaming last season, and joins following a third-placed finish at Challengers Japan Split 2 . He mainly played the Sentinel role for Sengoku last season, while also occasionally playing Viper. He's well-traveled, having played previously for SLT Seongnam , Rio Company , and FENNEL since making his professional debut in 2020. The fourth newcomer to DFM's roster is not as well-known as the other three. gyen joins as a newcomer, slated to make 2025 his rookie VCT season. DFM's 2024 season hit below expectations. One year after finishing dead last in the 2023 Pacific League , they finished second from last place in Pacific Stage 2 – just one spot above now-removed BLEED . They won just two matches in the 2024 season, failing to qualify for any international events in the process. DetonatioN FocusMe look to top last year's performance, with their new roster shaping out to be: Ibuki " Meiy " Seki Koki " Art " Kagami Kim " Jinboong " Jin-won (김진원) Yu " Akame " Gwang-hui (유광희) Koki " gyen " Nakamura Tomonori " SSeeS " Okimura Hirotaka " Melofovia " Okazaki (Coach) Tsubasa " NorthernLights " Ando (Coach)

title: JDG Esports signs sword9 and hypnotizing
cleaned_content: JDG Esports has signed assistant coach hypnotizing and in-game leader Li " sword9 " Wei (李卫) . The pair join after spending the 2024 season with All Gamers . hypnotizing looks to fill the void left by the departures of the former coaching staff of Anaks and Billyo . He joins after spending most of the 2024 season with All Gamers, who finished China Stage 2 placed 5th-6th, falling short of qualification for Champions Seoul . sword9 was All Gamers's in-game leader last season and is expected to continue in that role with JDG. He played the initiator role most often for AG, frequenting Sova and Gekko towards the end of the season for them. His 2024 season came after he had an assistant coaching role with EDward Gaming . He also played for KONE eSports Club , Qing Jiu Club , Qing Jiu Club , and DingFeng Gaming . In 2024, JDG acquired the roster of Rare Atom , who fell in the grand final of Ascension China 2023 to Dragon Ranger Gaming . In 2024, they reached the knockout stages of an event just once, securing a 5th-6th place finish in China Stage 2 . JDG Esports is now: Chen " YHchen " Yuhan (陳昱瀚) Park " stew " Young-chan (박영찬) Lifan " Viva " Ran (冉立凡) Yong " jkuro " Haochong (杨浩聪) Liu " Z1yan " Zihan (刘紫涵) Li " sword9 " Wei (李卫) Jiang " Jayce " Yudong (蒋昱栋) (Manager) Xie " hypnotizing " Haozhi (谢昊志) (Assistant coach)

title: Wolves Esports signs Lysoar and Fayde
cleaned_content: Wolves Esports has announced former Xi Lai Gaming coach Fayde as their head coach and the signing of former FunPlus Phoenix standout Liang " Lysoar " Youhao (梁优好) . Lysoar joins after a 2024 campaign with FPX that saw them qualify for all three international events. Domestically, FPX were the second-best team in their region. They finished as runners-up at Kickoff , China Stage 1 , and Stage 2 to eventual Champions -lifting EDward Gaming . Lysoar played the Controller and Sentinel roles for FPX most often. He made his professional Valorant debut with FPX in 2023, and leaves for Wolves after two seasons. Fayde's announcement comes a few weeks after he announced that he resigned from his coaching position with Xi Lai Gaming. In 2024 with XLG, Fayde played a part in helping the team to lift Ascension China , defeating a Rare Atom team that they failed to beat twice before in the competition. A few days after lifting Ascension, he announced that he resigned from his coaching position with XLG. Before 2024, Fayde was with Ninjas In Pyjamas and JiJieHao . Fayde will be a head coach for the first time since his days with Hong Kong VCL team Griffin E-Sports . The well-traveled coach also spent time with Team Secret , BOOM Esports , and Team SMG . He replaces head coach jungleDSL and assistant coach chaPPie , who were released a few days earlier. The moves in the coaching booth are the organization's first since parting ways with in-game leader pl1xx in August. Korean coach CheongGak also returned to his home country, signing with T1 . Wolves began their 2024 season with a 2-0 win over eventual Champions participants Bilibili Gaming at China Kickoff , but would lose six of their next eight matches, failing to qualify for the playoffs of Kickoff and China Stage 1 . A better Stage 2 showing for the team saw them win half of their matches and look to contend for a spot at playoffs, but they finished one game behind the top six and saw their season end in July. In the short life of Wolves Esports' time in VCT, they have yet to qualify for the knockout rounds of any competition they've been in. Wolves Esports is now: Pong " SiuFatBB " Gaa Hei (庞加曦) Chang " V1yA " Rui-min (张睿珉) Huang " Yuicaw " Yung-chieh (黃湧傑) Liu " Spring " Jiunting (刘俊霆) Zhong " balua " Haojun (钟皓钧) Liang " Lysoar " Youhao (梁优好) " Simple " (Manager) Chong " Fayde " Hoc Wah (Head coach)

title: Gen.G re-signs Munchkin
cleaned_content: Gen.G has announced that they've re-signed in-game leader Byeon " Munchkin " Sang-beom (변상범) , keeping three core players of last season's team together. "I'm back. Let's make 2025 the year of GENG," Munchkin said . Munchkin, who was voted as the Pacific region's in-game leader of the year with 74.2% of votes, had his best season of Valorant since making his debut in 2020. He most frequently played Viper or KAY/O for the team in 2024. Munchkin was also named the Pacific Stage 2 Finals MVP . He started his career with Cloud9 Korea , but first reached the international stage with Japanese side Crazy Raccoon in the 2021 season, when he reached Masters Reykjavik , Masters Berlin , and Champions 2021 . He joined T1 the following season, and reached Masters Tokyo and Champions 2023 with them. Munchkin joined Gen.G ahead of the 2024 season, part of a four-man signing class that joined them with Meteor , who has since joined T1. The team hit above expectations this season, qualifying for five grand finals and lifting three trophies, including Pacific Kickoff , Masters Shanghai and Pacific Stage 2 . They bowed out in the group stages of Champions 2024 , falling to Sentinels in the 'Group of Death'. Gen.G originally announced they would be parting ways with Munchkin, Meteor, and Lakia departing the team. All five the organization's players' contracts were due at the end of 2024, with t3xture and Karon announced to have signed new deals to stay with them early on in the offseason. The return of their IGL leaves two open spots on the Gen.G roster now, which is: Byeon " Munchkin " Sang-beom (변상범) Kim " t3xture " Na-ra (김나라) Kim " Karon " Won-tae (김원태) Kang " solo " Geun-chul (강근철) (Head coach) Kim " HSK " Hae-seong (김해성) (Staff)

title: T1 adds BuZz
cleaned_content: T1 has announced the signing of Yu " BuZz " Byeong-cheol (유병철) , adding one of Korean Valorant's most recognizable names as part of their domestic rebuild. BuZz has been at the center of Korean Valorant since its professional scene was first established. He joined Vision Strikers in 2021, and played a part in proving to the international stage that Korean Valorant teams were a force to be reckoned with. In 2022 when DRX acquired Vision Strikers, he joined along with MaKo , Zest , Rb , and stax , the former of which will now be a teammate of BuZz's on T1. MaKo is the only remaining Vision Strikers player still on the DRX roster. In joining T1, BuZz will be separated with DRX coach termi for the first time since joining Vision Strikers. BuZz started his professional Valorant career in 2020 with Cloud9 Korea . When the team was disbanded, he joined BearClaw Gaming when they set their sights on a Korean roster. He then joined MUYAHO , who were later acquired by Rio Company . BuZz signed with Vision Strikers in 2021, entering the spotlight of Korean Valorant. In his first season with the team, he competed at Masters Berlin and Champions 2021 . After Vision Strikers was acquired by DRX the following season, BuZz reached Masters Reykjavik and Masters Copenhagen , and then finished third at Champions 2022 . BuZz has reached the last three Champions events as part of DRX's roster, and T1 will be looking to return with him in their squad. The Duelist, most known for his Jett, joins a T1 squad that, in 2024, hit below expectations. With a roster built around a handful of international names, T1 reached Masters Shanghai thanks to a third-placed Pacific Stage 1 finish, but they finished the season as the seventh-best team in the region. T1 is now: Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) Kim " Meteor " Tae-oh (김태오) Go " Sylvan " Young-sup (고영섭) Lee " carpe " Jae-hyeok (이재혁) Yu " BuZz " Byeong-cheol (유병철) Ham " iZu " Woo-ju (함우주) Kevin " xccurate " Susanto Shin " Norman " Jun-ho (Manager) Yoon " Autumn " Eu-teum (윤으뜸) (Head coach) Lee " CheongGak " Il-ho (이일호) (Coach) Seol " Indigo " Do-hoon (설도훈) (Coach)

title: Chet suspended through Masters Bangkok
cleaned_content: Former NRG Head Coach Chet " Chet " Singh has been suspended from professional play until the end of Masters Bangkok on March 3, 2025, for violating the Riot Games Global Esports Code of Conduct. According to Riot's competitive ruling , Chet breached provision 3.21, Confidential Information, by "broadcasting VoDs whose access was contingent on current status as head coach of a VCT team. His access to the content was unauthorized, and its distribution on July 31, 2024, constituted a breach of proprietary information. He did not secure permission from Riot Games, NRG, and the other teams involved prior to broadcasting publicly inaccessible VoDs and communications to his personal channels." Following section 4.10, Team Sanctions and the Role of Team Leadership, a suspension was imposed, weighing the severity and circumstances of the case. Following the ruling's release, Chet announced that he would focus on content creation until the suspension was lifted in early March.

title: BBL Esports bids farewell to QutionerX, Brave, reazy, and Elite
cleaned_content: UPDATE: This article has been updated to include the departures of reazy as of October 15 and Elite as of October 16. BBL Esports has announced the respective departures of Doğukan " QutionerX " Dural and Eren " Brave " Kasırga from the team following the expiry of both of their contracts. As of October 16, Kaan " reazy " Ürpek and Efe " Elite " Teber have also departed the team under similar circumstances. QutionerX joined BBL almost three years ago in December 2021 as the team's duelist and was the longest-standing member left on the roster. In 2022, they won the Turkey Stage 1 Closed Qualifier to claim their place in EMEA Challengers , where they would narrowly miss out on regional playoffs and later face immediate elimination in the Last Chance Qualifier . Brave joined BBL prior to the 2023 season and played controller throughout his tenure. The first year of the partnership era proved difficult for the Turkish squad; they finished with a 3-6 regular season record in the EMEA League and once again settled just below the playoffs qualification line. They were subsequently eliminated in LCQ by Karmine Corp. reazy and Elite came into the team for 2024 to respectively fulfill the initiator and sentinel roles. The 2024 season told a similar story to BBL's previous seasons; in both stages, BBL would come just one placement away from advancing to the EMEA playoffs. In Stage 1 , they lost out in a five-way 3-3 tiebreaker in Group Alpha, and in Stage 2 , they lost out in a three-way 4-6 tiebreaker in the overall standings. BBL ended their season in seventh place in VCT EMEA. In September, Melih " pAura " Karaduran parted ways with the team as a restricted free agent. Combined with these departures, BBL has officially separated with their entire 2024 roster. BBL Esports is currently: Burak " LewN " Alkan Salih " marqnue " Onaran (Head coach)

title: T1 picks up Meteor
cleaned_content: T1 has signed former Masters Shanghai winner Kim " Meteor " Tae-oh (김태오) . Meteor joins after a successful season with Gen.G , which saw them lift not just the organization's first trophies in VCT history, but also the Pacific region's first international trophy. He previously spent time with Japanese VCL team NORTHEPTION and Korean VCL side TNL Esports . In 2024, Meteor was the longest-tenured player remaining on Gen.G's roster, having been on the roster since October of 2022. The season began with the team defeating Pacific powerhouses Paper Rex in the grand final of Pacific Kickoff . That qualified them to Masters Madrid , where they would fall short in the grand final to American team Sentinels . To open Pacific Stage 1, Gen.G went 3-3, qualifying for the playoffs as the top seed of Group Alpha. They followed that up with a run to the grand final, where they this time lost to Paper Rex. The top-three finish qualified them to Masters Shanghai, where they went on an undefeated run to lift win it all against Team Heretics in the grand final, earning the Pacific region its first-ever international trophy. They carried their form into Pacific Stage 2 , wrapping up the regular season with a 3-1 record to qualify for the playoffs. There, they defeated PRX once and fellow Korean team DRX twice en route to lifting their third trophy of the season. Champions Seoul was short-lived for the home team, as they would bow out in the group stages of the so-called 'Group of Death' at the hands of Sentinels. Before Gen.G's 2024 roster came to fruition, Meteor was the team's Duelist, frequenting Jett for the team. This past season, he was mostly on the Sentinel role, frequenting Killjoy and Cypher while still occasionally playing Jett or Yoru. T1's 2024 season ended in disappointment. They fell short of reaching Masters Madrid with a semifinal finish at Pacific Kickoff. Then, they showed signs of promise following a third-placed finish in Stage 1, which qualified them for Masters Shanghai. The team would then bow out in the competition's Swiss Stage, and fail to qualify for Champions. Since their season came to a close, T1 has parted ways with Sayaplayer , Rossy , and coach Daeda . They signed a Korean coaching duo of CheongGak and Indigo , and signed former Gen.G player Sylvan , who was teammates with Meteor in the 2023 season. T1 's domestic rebuild is nearing completion, and their roster is now: Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) Kim " Meteor " Tae-oh (김태오) Go " Sylvan " Young-sup (고영섭) Lee " carpe " Jae-hyeok (이재혁) Ham " iZu " Woo-ju (함우주) Kevin " xccurate " Susanto Shin " Norman " Jun-ho (Manager) Yoon " Autumn " Eu-teum (윤으뜸) (Head coach) Lee " CheongGak " Il-ho (이일호) (Coach) Seol " Indigo " Do-hoon (설도훈) (Coach)

title: LEVIATÁN summons Demon1
cleaned_content: LEVIATÁN has added world champion Max " Demon1 " Mazanov to their roster. On this new roster, he will reunite with his Champions winning teammate C0M . After winning Champions in 2023 with Evil Geniuses , Demon1 and his teammate Ethan would leave the organization to join NRG for 2024. Along with three of the old OpTic Gaming members, expectations were set extremely high for the roster, with many proclaiming that it was a North American super-team. However, the year would not play out so favorably for them, as they fell far below what was expected of them. In Kickoff , they were eliminated in the semi-finals by Sentinels , and failed to qualify for Masters Madrid . In Stage 1 , they would miss playoffs with a 3-3 record, being blown out and embarrassed in their losses. Their lack of an experienced IGL was proving a major issue and one they would need to solve going into Stage 2. As a result, Demon1 was benched in order to make room for FiNESSE to take the reins of the roster and attempt to salvage NRG's year. Demon1 would remain on the bench for the rest of the season until he was released shortly after the transfer window opened. Similarly to NRG, Leviatán was also touted as somewhat of an international super-team, also having two world champions in aspas and C0M, as well as strong existing pieces from their previous roster. Also mirroring NRG, they would miss Masters Madrid when they too were eliminated by Sentinels in the group stage of Kickoff. However, unlike NRG, Leviatán were able to learn from their losses and become a top team in Americas. Across stages one and two , they only lost one regular season match to Cloud9 , and qualified to both Masters Shanghai and Champions . They also were crowned the stage two champions after they took down G2 Esports in the grand finals . Leviatán had a disappointing exit in the Swiss Stage of Shanghai, but would make a run at Champions to finish in third place. Despite ending the year with success, the roster would not stay together, with Mazino parting with the organization. With Demon1 joining the team, the South American organization now sports a predominantly North American roster. LEVIATÁN is now: Francisco " kiNgg " Aravena Max " Demon1 " Mazanov Ian " tex " Botsch Erick " aspas " Santos Corbin " C0M " Lee Juan " Daykiry " Garcia (Manager) Dimitar " Itopata " Staev (Head coach)

title: Sentinels adds Reduxx as their sixth
cleaned_content: Sentinels has signed Yassin " Reduxx " Aboulalazm as their sixth player for the 2025 season. This addition comes after their previous sub, curry , was removed from the roster. Before joining Sentinels, Reduxx spent most of his career with Oxygen Esports in the tier two scene. When he became old enough to compete in NA Challengers in 2023, he stepped into the starting roster and placed fourth in the playoffs. In the following year, Oxygen were strong contenders for a shot at Ascension, but they once again fell short at fourth place. Following this result, Oxygen disbanded , leaving Reduxx free to explore his options. Prior to announcing their two newest additions to their team, Sentinels played in the Red Bull Home Ground NA play-ins . For this tournament, Reduxx unofficially debuted under the org along with curry. In this tournament, Sentinels narrowly beat YFP 2-1 before being defeated by Cloud9 in the grand finals . Reduxx find his first ace as a Sentinel. Sentinels are now: Mohamed " johnqt " Amine Ouarid Marshall " N4RRATE " Massey Sean " bang " Bezerra Jordan " Zellsis " Montemurro Zachary " zekken " Patrone Yassin " Reduxx " Aboulalazm Bryan " Zyto " Ybanez (Manager) Kevin " Kez " Jeon (Manager) Adam " kaplan " Kaplan (Head coach)

title: DRX signs HYUNMIN and freeing
cleaned_content: DRX has signed Song " HYUNMIN " Hyun-min (송현민) and No " free1ng " Ha-jun (노하준) . Both players look to fill the void left by departures from last year's squad, and boast experience from different Challengers leagues in VCT's Pacific region. HYUNMIN, who was most recently on Japanese Challengers side CREST GAMING Zst , has been a Duelist player throughout the course of his young Valorant career. He only has 40 rounds of professional Valorant recorded, with 35 of those being on Jett or Raze. He will be one of the younger players in VCT, having turned 18 in February 2024. freeing joins from Rare Atom , who before falling in the grand final of China Ascension were on a dominant run. He played Sentinel most often for Rare Atom, but has also shown the ability to play the Controller role effectively. He joined Rare Atom shortly after being eliminated from the Korean Challengers VCL with Dplus Esports , with whom he had spent all of the 2024 season with until that point. DRX looks to follow up a tumultuous 2024 season by ushering in a new generation of players. The offseason leading into 2024 saw the Korean powerhouse depart with Rb and Zest , and then part ways with stax mid-season. Since the end of their season at Champions Seoul, they've also announced the departures of longtime duelist BuZz , who had been with the team since its Vision Strikers days in 2021, and 2024 newcomers BeYN and Foxy9 . DRX is now: Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) Song " HYUNMIN " Hyun-min (송현민) No " free1ng " Ha-jun (노하준) Pyeon " termi " Seon-ho (편선호) (Head coach) Kim " glow " Min-soo (김민수) (Coach) Kwon " Argency " Soon-woo (권순우) (Coach)

title: NRG completes roster, signs mada, Verno, and bonkar
cleaned_content: NRG has announced their 2025 roster, including the signing of former Moist x Shopify duelist Adam " mada " Pampuch , and Oxygen Esports ' star initiator Andrew " Verno " Maust . Also coming from Oxygen, they have signed Malkolm " bonkar " Rench as their new head coach, stepping in for their previous coach of two years, Chet . Verno, the former Oxygen Esports initiator, became a free agent after the team's disbandment and was one of the most sought-after players in tier 2. He was ranked the third-highest-rated player in VCL North America , boasting a 1.19 rating while excelling in multiple roles. Verno will be reunited with his former Oxygen head coach bonkar, who also joins NRG for 2025. With Oxygen, bonkar was highly praised for transforming the team into an Ascension contender. Their hype heading into the 2024 season began with wins in off-season tournaments, including the Ludwig x Tarik Invitational 2 . In the 2024 season, Oxygen lifted the North American Challengers League Mid-Season Cup , and continued their dominance into Stage 2 of the competition. They finished the regular season on top of the table, but a surprise loss to TSM in the lower semifinals ended their season in fourth place. Finishing one spot above them was Moist x Shopify, spearheaded by duelist player mada. The Canadian had been with the original Shopify Rebellion Black core since mid-2022 and now makes a long-awaited jump to tier one Valorant. NRG Esports experienced a chaotic 2024 season themselves. The year started with the organization bringing back Marved , and signing the Champions 2023-winning duo of Demon1 and Ethan . They fizzled out in the semifinals of Americas Kickoff , losing to eventual champions and Masters Madrid -clinching Sentinels . NRG went 3-3 in Americas Stage 1 , finishing at the bottom of Group Alpha and missing out on yet another international event. It was at this point that they decided to bench Demon1 and release Marved, bringing back FiNESSE and s0m while their chances at qualification for Champions Seoul were slim. With bonkar now at the helm and bringing two players he is familiar with, NRG look to enter a new era centered around a team that fuses an OpTic Gaming veteran with core NRG members, along with some key pieces that look to round out the squad. NRG is now: Pujan " FiNESSE " Mehta Sam " s0m " Oh Andrew " Verno " Maust Adam " mada " Pampuch Ethan " Ethan " Arnold Zachary " Ry " Parr (Manager) Malkolm " bonkar " Rench (Head coach)

title: BBL Esports signs LewN
cleaned_content: BBL Esports has signed Turkish duelist player Burak " LewN " Alkan from Galatasaray Esports . He is seen most often on Jett and Raze, but has also shown an ability to play Iso and Neon this past season. According to BBL's announcement , he joins on a three-year contract pending approval from Riot, whose minimum age requirement for VCT is 18. LewN will turn 18 in November. According to an announcement by his former team, LewN's move from Galatasaray to BBL includes a transfer fee and bonuses. LewN joined Galatasaray ahead of the 2024 season, and previously played for PCIFIC Esports . Competing in the Turkish VCL this past year, he helped Galatasaray to a fourth-place finish, missing out on Turkey's lone EMEA Ascension slot. In 2024, BBL failed to qualify for the knockout rounds of any competitions they were in. A 3-3 start in EMEA Stage 1 saw them narrowly miss out on the playoffs due to a five-way tie in Group Alpha placing them in fourth. In Stage 2 , they went 1-3 and again narrowly missed out on playoffs, finishing with the same overall record as Karmine Corp but finishing behind them by two maps. BBL ended their 2024 season ranked seventh in Europe. BBL Esports is now: Efe " Elite " Teber Eren " Brave " Kasırga Burak " LewN " Alkan Kaan " reazy " Ürpek Doğukan " QutionerX " Dural Eren " Reen " Gül (Manager) Salih " marqnue " Onaran (Head coach) Juan " McJuankar " Carlos Mesa Ciruelo (Assistant coach)

title: RRQ round off roster with Kush and Warbirds
cleaned_content: Rex Regum Qeon has signed Bryan " Kushy " Carlos Setiawan and Evan " Warbirds " Olzem . The former is joining as the team's new initiator player while Warbirds is the team's new assistant coach. Kush spent three years with Alter Ego 's Valorant division, having been with them since October 2021. He was a member of team GARUDA , Indonesia's representative at the 2023 Redbull Campus Clutch event and the MVP of the grand finals which his team won. In 2024, he and Alter Ego won Stage 1 of the Indonesia Challengers event, but missed out on qualifying for Ascension Pacific after a close 3-2 grand final loss to BOOM Esports. Warbirds spent the past two years with Team Secret . While the organization has consistently qualified for the playoffs stage in 2024, they have not yet made a Masters or Champions event after partnerships were announced. Warbirds will be working as assistant coach alongside the team's head coach Ewok . RRQ had a rocky 2024, failing to qualify for the VCT Pacific Stage 1 playoffs, and bombing out of the Stage 2 playoffs. They have kept their roster from this year, with only Lmemore announcing free agency. RRQ's finalized roster will make their debut at the Red Bull Home Ground APAC qualifier on Oct. 19. Rex Regum Qeon is now: David " xffero " Monangin Cahya " Monyet " Nugraha Maksim " Jemkin " Batorov Bryan " Kushy " Carlos Setiawan Park " Estrella " Gun (박건) Marthinus " Ewok " Jacobus Van Der Walt (Head coach) Evan " Warbirds " Olzem (Assistant coach)

title: JDG parts ways with Anaks and Billyo
cleaned_content: JDG Esports has parted ways with their coaching staff of Ye " Anaks " Sang-jun (예상준) and Li " Billyo " Xinyu (李新宇) . Anaks joined JDG in June of 2024, joining before the start of China Stage 2 . With him at the helm, JDG saw improved results in comparison to Stage 1 , when they finished with a 2-4 record and missed out on the playoffs. JDG Esports finished Stage 2 ranked 5th-6th. In the organization's history, they are yet to reach an international VCT event. Before joining JDG, Anaks was the head coach of DRX Academy , and also spent time with Korean Challengers team GoNGo Prince as a coach. He started his coaching career in 2022, following a playing career with Korean VCL teams GoNGo Prince and TUBEPLE Gaming . He started his playing career with T1 Korea . Billyo had been with JDG since September 2024. He briefly joined as the head coach but was named the assistant coach for the start of the 2024 season. Before joining JDG, he spent time on Bilibili Gaming and FunPlus Phoenix as a coach. JDG Esports 's roster is now: Chen " YHchen " Yuhan (陳昱瀚) Park " stew " Young-chan (박영찬) Lifan " Viva " Ran (冉立凡) Yong " jkuro " Haochong (杨浩聪) Liu " Z1yan " Zihan (刘紫涵) Jiang " Jayce " Yudong (蒋昱栋) (Manager)

title: NRG releases Demon1
cleaned_content: NRG has released Max " Demon1 " Mazanov . He will be a free agent after spending just one season with the team. "He's too good to keep on the bench, so we're giving him the chance to shine elsewhere," the organization said in their announcement. The Duelist played a big role in lifting North America's first-ever Champions trophy with Evil Geniuses . Before Evil Geniuses, he played for sqn 2.0 and Flex Gaming . He has also been known to play the Controller role on occasion, but is most well-known for his play on Jett and Raze. Following the season, he was part of a four-man Evil Geniuses class that was poached away by teams. C0M joined LEVIATÁN and Boostio joined 100 Thieves . The Champions 2023 MVP joined NRG as part of an ambitious offseason signing class that saw them pick up fellow world champion Ethan and bring back former OpTic Gaming player Marved . The signings joined fellow OpTic players crashies and Victor , while FiNESSE and s0m parted ways. After failing to qualify for Masters Madrid through Americas Kickoff and missing out on the Stage 1 playoffs, NRG benched Demon1 and released Marved, bringing back FNS and s0m with their chances at reaching Champions Seoul slim. After their 2024 season came to an end, NRG released Chet and Victor, both of whom had been with the NRG/OpTic core since 2022. The announcement coincided with the return of Demon1 to the active roster, but the stint was short-lived. NRG is now: Pujan " FiNESSE " Mehta Sam " s0m " Oh Ethan " Ethan " Arnold Zachary " Ry " Parr (Manager) Tanishq " Tanizhq " Sabharwal (Assistant coach)

title: T1 signs Sylvan, Indigo, and CheongGak
cleaned_content: T1 has announced the signing of Go " Sylvan " Young-sup (고영섭) , adding the talented Korean controller to their roster as a part of their domestic rebuild. They also signed Seol " Indigo " Do-hoon (설도훈) and Lee " CheongGak " Il-ho (이일호) , the latter being a former T1 coach. T1's 2024 roster mixed players from different regions of the world, bringing in Rossy as the lone import, while also signing Indonesian player xccurate following the end of the 2023 season. Veteran Sayaplayer and carpe were the only players remaining from the 2023 roster, and preparations for the 2024 season finished with the team signing Japanese Challengers player iZu . Sayaplayer has since been released by T1. Sylvan joins after spending the 2024 season unattached to a VCT roster. In the 2023 season, he played for Gen.G before being released at the end of the VCT season. He signed with Chinese Challengers side TOP Esports , but was soon again a free agent following their elimination at China Evolution Series Act 3: Heritability . Indigo joins after spending time with Korean Challengers side Nongshim RedForce . NongShim fell in the grand final to eventual Korean VCL champions Sin Prisa Gaming , who also went on to lift Pacific Ascension . CheongGak was a coach for T1 in the 2023 season, departing for Chinese side Wolves Esports in June of this year. He re-joins a T1 side that is more Korean than when he left. Former coach Daeda revealed that the organization was looking to build a roster with a more domestic focus, and they have done just that, signing two Korean coaches and a talented Initiator/Controller to jumpstart the transition. T1 is now: Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) Lee " carpe " Jae-hyeok (이재혁) Ham " iZu " Woo-ju (함우주) Kevin " xccurate " Susanto Go " Sylvan " Young-sup (고영섭) Shin " Norman " Jun-ho (Manager) Yoon " Autumn " Eu-teum (윤으뜸) (Head coach) Lee " CheongGak " Il-ho (이일호) (Coach) Seol " Indigo " Do-hoon (설도훈) (Coach)

title: BOOM Esports part ways with ZesBeeW and Meow
cleaned_content: BOOM Esports Controller player Sha " ZesBeeW " Mohtar and coach Ji " Meow " Dong-jun (지동준) have announced that they have been allowed to explore their options. The announcements come days after it was revealed that the Pacific Ascension runners-up would be promoted into VCT following the removal of 2023 Ascension winners BLEED . ZesBeeW announced that he is looking to play Duelist, Controller, or the in-game leader roles, while also willing to relocate anywhere in the world. The Singaporean had been with BOOM since the Indonesian VCL's second split began. He previously played for a few Singaporean teams, including Team Ender , Bigetron Arctic , and Team SMG . Meow had been with BOOM since June of 2021, ending a stint of nearly three years with the Indonesian organization. Before BOOM, he was the head coach of Korean Challengers side TUBEPLE Gaming , where current SPG player Persia was. Meow said that he is: "[An] unrestricted free agent, hoping to join a team long term as the Head Coach/Coach." BOOM's eventual ascension into VCT was yet another twist in BOOM's eventful 2024 season. The Indonesian side started the year losing in the grand final of the Indonesian Challengers League Split 1 to Alter Ego . They suffered just two losses in the campaign, with both coming to Alter Ego. In the Split 2 playoffs, they were sent into the lower bracket by Alter Ego. It appeared as though history may repeat itself, but they fought their way into the grand final and got revenge against them, winning 3-2 to claim Indonesia's lone Ascension slot. BOOM's run to the Ascension grand final followed a similar script. After being sent to the brink of elimination by Sin Prisa Gaming , they dominated the lower bracket, setting up for a rematch with SPG. After falling down 2-0, they forced a map 5, where they lost in overtime in heartbreaking fashion . While they would not find ascension via lifting the Ascension trophy, BOOM will be in the Pacific league for the 2025 season. As they prepare for their first offseason as a VCT team, BOOM Esports 's roster is now: Fikri " Famouz " Zaki Hamdani Hildegard " Shiro " Arnaldo Sheldon " NcSlasher " Andersen Chandra Rizkie " BerserX " Adla Kusuma Heru " 5ynz " Prasetyo (Manager) Harry " 6fingers " Tjahjadi Putra (Assistant coach) Fidel " Fidelwow " Saputra (Analyst)

title: Cloud9 signs Rossy and v1c
cleaned_content: Cloud9 has announced the signings of Rossy and Victor " v1c " Truong . Rossy, a former TSM and Turtle Troop player joins his second VCT organization since making the move to T1 last year. He joins after an up-and-down 2024 campaign with the Korean organization, which underwent a midseason roster realignment of its own. An early elimination at the hands of eventual runner-ups Paper Rex at Pacific Kickoff denied them the chance to appear at Masters Madrid. A 2-4 showing in the regular season of Pacific Stage 1 was enough to qualify for the playoffs, and a third-place finish in the playoffs qualified them for Masters Shanghai . Two straight losses to open the competition eliminated them in the Swiss Stage. With just four games to play in Stage 2, T1 went to the drawing board after two losses all but guaranteed they would miss out on playoffs. They hit the reset button, signing former DRX in-game leader Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) , which resulted in the benching of Rossy. Ha " Sayaplayer " Jeong-woo (하정우) has also since announced that he is LFT. In an LFT announcement of his own, former coach Jacob " Daeda " Hale revealed that “rumblings of a domestic focus [were] planned for 2025.” Rossy announced that he was looking for a team weeks after T1's season ended, and said that he would prioritize offers from North American franchises. Most recently, Moist x Shopify player v1c was a stand-in for Cloud9 at the North American play-ins for Redbull Homeground . v1c makes the jump to the top tier of professional Valorant after spending the last three seasons on teams at various levels within the North American Challengers League circuit. v1c was a part of the Shopify Rebellion Gold core before its merge with Moist Moguls . He was also on NSIC and SoaR in years prior. With Moist x Shopify in 2024, v1c reached the lower final of the North America Challengers League Stage 2 , falling to eventual runners-up TSM. Following a 2024 season that saw them fail to qualify for any international events, Cloud9 announced that longtime players Anthony " vanity " Malaspina and Dylan " runi " Cade , both of whom have had a second stint with the organization, were benched and allowed to explore options with a new team; runi has announced his retirement from professional Valorant. They finished Americas Stage 2 ranked 5th-6th, two spots below qualification for Champions Seoul . Cloud9 is now: Erick " Xeppaa " Bach Kaleb " moose " Jayne Francis " OXY " Hoang Victor " v1c " Truong Daniel " Rossy " Abedrabbo Ian " Immi " Harding (Coach) Guglielmo " GUGLi " Carraro (Assistant coach)

title: 100 Thieves pick up zander
cleaned_content: 100 Thieves has rounded out their roster with the addition of Alexander " zander " Dituri , formerly of M80 . With this pickup, the team has confirmed their roster for the 2025 season. zander joined M80 at the beginning of the partnership system for a chance to win Ascension and join the Americas league. M80 were dominant throughout the duration of North American challengers, coming out as champions of both splits. They were favorites to win Ascension , but their fellow North Americans at The Guard were the better team at São Paulo, and defeated M80 in the grand finals to take the Ascension slot. zander ran it back the next year with M80 for another shot at ascending, albeit with two new players, BcJ and nitr0 . M80 faced more challenge in North America than they had the previous year, struggling towards the end of Split 1, ending with only a top-four finish in the Mid Season Cup . It was around then when nitr0 left the roster to return to Counter-Strike, and previous Ascension winner neT took his place. With this change, M80 seemed to return to their former dominance, and swept through the playoffs to win Split 2. At Ascension , M80 were once again favorites, but the South American competition was much stronger than the previous year, and M80 were once again defeated in the grand finals at the hands of 2Game Esports . Having missed out on ascending twice in a row, M80 released their roster , allowing their players to pursue other endeavors. Throughout the 2024 season, zander was a standout player and became a hot commodity for partnership teams after M80's loss. 100 Thieves had an up and down season in 2024. Their highs saw them lift the Americas trophy in Stage 1 and place top four at Shanghai , while their lows saw them miss both Masters Madrid and Champions. Following the season, bang parted ways with the organization, leaving room for zander to fill his place as the controller player for the team. With this move, zander rejoins two of his former teammates: Cryocells from SoaR and eeiu from M80. 100 Thieves are now: Kelden " Boostio " Pupello Matthew " Cryocells " Panganiban Daniel " eeiu " Vucenovic Peter " Asuna " Mazuryk Alexander " zander " Dituri Anthony " Zikz " Gray (Head coach)

title: Flex1n splits with Bilbili Gaming
cleaned_content: Bilibili Gaming has announced that Lo " Flex1n " Rui (罗瑞) has departed the team after approximately four months. Flex1n began the 2024 season as part of Trace Esports , a team he originally joined back in June 2023 with Trace's signing of the Totoro Gaming roster. The team was a contender but failed to qualify for Champions 2023 after placing outside of the top-three in the Champions China Qualifier . At Kickoff , Trace came even closer to the international stage as they made it to playoffs but were denied in the semifinal by EDward Gaming . After Kickoff, Flex1n was traded to TYLOO in exchange for Zhang " LuoK1ng " Zhanpeng (张展鹏) and coach Zhang " Yiyee " Tianyuan (张天元) . He played for the team throughout Stage 1 , where they achieved a 2-3 record and missed out on playoffs. Flex1n made yet another switch coming into Stage 2 , joining BLG to replace Zhong " Biank " Jianfei (钟剑飞) after the latter's transfer to Trace. Following a middling Stage 1, BLG recovered with a 3-1 record in Stage 2; they went on to place fourth in playoffs and qualify for Champions 2024 off of circuit points. Flex1n recorded the highest assists per round of any controller player in the league during the stage with 0.50 APR. BLG ended their year in Seoul with a 0-2 group stage exit. Bilibili Gaming is now: Yang " B3ar " Zhanxiong (杨瞻雄) Wang " whzy " Haozhe (王昊哲) Lu " Levius " Yinzhong (卢胤中) Marcus " nephh " Tan Liu " Knight " Yuxiang (刘宇翔) Wang " yosemite " Lei (王磊) Hu " Robot " Leiyu (扈雷雨) (Manager) Lee " bail " Sung-jae (이성재) (Head coach) Wang " Jexen " Lin Xiao (王林骁) (Coach)

title: Talon Esports announces departures of Patiphan and b0i
cleaned_content: TALON has announced the departures of inactive player Patiphan " Patiphan " Chaiwong and coach Aaron " b0i " Thao . Patiphan joined Talon before the 2023 season. Before the move to the Thai organization, he had short stints with FULL SENSE and X10 Esports . He made his debut in professional Valorant in 2020, following an Overwatch career that saw him win several titles. After participating in X10's Champions Berlin campaign in 2021, which saw them eliminated in the quarterfinals by eventual runners-up Gambit Esports , Patiphan returned to Overwatch for 2022. He came back to Valorant in 2023, joining Talon's active roster following LOCK IN//São Paulo. He competed in all nine league matches and two LCQ matches for the team, finishing with a 3-6 record. Patiphan flexed his versatility with Talon, frequently playing the Controller role towards the end of his tenure but also showing the ability to play as an effective Duelist or Initiator. After the 2023 season, Patiphan announced that he would take an indefinite break from competitive Valorant. b0i joined Talon as a coach ahead of the 2023 season. Before joining Talon, he spent time on 100 Thieves as an analyst and then as a substitute player. Following that, he joined Zero MarksMen Black . He was also a stand-in for TSM Academy and Built By Gamers . Talon Esports' 2024 season seemed to be in constant evolution. After being eliminated in the group stages of Pacific Kickoff , they posted a 4-1 record in Stage 1 , a mark that was good enough to qualify them for playoffs from a strong Group Omega that had two other teams with one or fewer losses. After being knocked out in the first round by eventual champions Paper Rex , Talon changed their approach before Stage 2 . They parted ways with lenne , reducing their active roster to five members. They then went 2-2 in Stage 2, narrowly qualifying for playoffs as the sixth seed. They then signed young phenom primmie ahead of their knockout match, benching Surf . In his professional debut, primmie posted a server-leading 52 kills and 305 ACS. Talon would lose their next two matches, failing to reach the top three. Their knockout stage win over Team Secret , however, was enough for them to qualify for Champions Seoul through championship points. While they would be eliminated in the group stages, it was the Thai organization's first time appearing at an international event under the Talon name. TALON 's roster is now: Thanamethk " Crws " Mahatthananuyut Jittana " JitBoyS " Nokngam Papaphat " primmie " Sriprapha Joseph " ban " Seungmin Oh Peter " Governor " No Thanachart " Surf " Rungapajaratkul Jirawat " HeadHawk " Kalumpanun (Manager) Hector " FrosT " Rosario (Head coach)

title: Cloud9 announces departures of runi and Vanity
cleaned_content: Cloud9 has announced the departures of Anthony " vanity " Malaspina and Dylan " runi " Cade , two players who were both in their second stint with the American organization. runi, who played a part of the team's in-game leader duties, announced his retirement from professional Valorant shortly after the announcement was made by his former. "It just feels like time to move on from playing, unfortunately didn't get where I wanted to but still happy to have experienced something once in a lifetime," runi said . "Not sure what's next but for now it's time to just enjoy time with friends and family." runi was a part of the Cloud9 team in 2023, joining after spending time with Challengers sides Soniqs and Zero MarksMen Black . He departed Cloud9 in the offseason following 2023, but rejoined the squad following their elimination from Americas Kickoff and before the start of Americas Stage 1 . A month after the conclusion of their 2024 season, Cloud9 announced that Vanity had been benched and allowed to explore options with a new team as a restricted free agent. With the newest announcement, he is now an unattached free agent. Like runi, vanity was also in his second go-around with Cloud9. He also assumed the team's IGL duties throughout the course of his C9 career. He played for them from 2021 to 2023, with LOCK IN//São Paulo marking the end of his time. He rejoined ahead of the 2024 season. In 2024, Cloud9 fell short of the heights that they'd hoped for. They failed to qualify for any international events, being eliminated in the group stages of Kickoff and bowing out early in the knockout rounds of the Stage 1 and Stage 2 playoffs. Cloud9 is now: Erick " Xeppaa " Bach Kaleb " moose " Jayne Francis " OXY " Hoang Ian " Immi " Harding (Coach) Guglielmo " GUGLi " Carraro (Assistant coach)

title: runneR, Gorilla, temoc, Placido part with Team Vitality
cleaned_content: UPDATE: This article has been updated to include the departures of runneR and Placido. Emil " runneR " Trajkovski , Harry " Gorilla " Mepham , and Laike " temoc " Lewis have each announced their departures from Team Vitality . Marceau " Placido " Lambert also departed the team last week after a four-year tenure with the organization. Gorilla added that he is actively seeking new head coaching opportunities. runneR joined Vitality to play duelist at the beginning of the 2024 season after previously playing with Diamant Esports , while Gorilla originally joined the French organization in May 2022 as an assistant coach. After failing to qualify to the playoffs of both Kickoff and EMEA Stage 1 , Vitality moved head coach Salah " salah " Barakat to the bench and promoted Gorilla to the position in his stead. Shortly after, temoc was brought on to the team as assistant coach and runneR switched to sentinel role, with Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel taking on the duelist mantle. Following these changes, Vitality came into Stage 2 renewed. The golden hornets not only qualified for playoffs but went on a run to an impressive second-place result, securing a spot at Champions 2024 and the first international qualification in the organization's history. Vitality ended their year with a 1-2 exit in the group stage in Seoul, ultimately facing elimination at the hands of eventual third-place finishers in LEVIATÁN . “It's not been easy and I continue to learn that each year is harder than the last but I've met some amazing people and created memories that I'll keep with me for the rest of my life,” Gorilla said of the season in his announcement. Team Vitality is currently: Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Robert " Mulgan95 " Mulgan (Manager) Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: Sentinels announce N4RRATE and bang
cleaned_content: Sentinels has signed Marshall " N4RRATE " Massey and Sean " bang " Bezerra to their roster for the 2025 VCT season. They will replace TenZ and Sacy , who both recently retired from competitive play, leaving a hole in the Masters winning roster of 2024. The signing marks N4RRATE's return to North America after his one-year stint in EMEA under Karmine Corp . After playing for a struggling MAD Lions in 2023's NA Challengers, N4RRATE made waves in his franchising debut. Coming off a disastrous season, Karmine Corp looked to turn a new leaf in 2024 with a fresh new roster . They found early success, toppling the previously dominant FNATIC and the hot new Team Heretics to qualify for Masters Madrid as the first seed from EMEA. While they were eliminated in the Swiss Stage at Madrid, N4RRATE gave a standout performance, being the highest rated player in the tournament. He would remain a strong performer throughout the rest of the season, but Karmine Corp would fail to qualify for any more internationals. N4RRATE's first tier one tournament saw him lift a trophy (Photo by Wojciech Wandzel/Riot Games). bang had become a staple of the 100 Thieves roster, having played the controller role under the organization for nearly three years. Throughout their time together, they have found various levels of success. Their first accomplishment was winning the North American LCQ in 2022 to qualify to Champions . More recently, in 2024, they won Stage 1 of the Americas league and reached top four at Masters Shanghai . However, after Shanghai, the team slipped in form and failed to qualify to Champions. 100 Thieves recently announced his departure from the organization, with bang stating that it was the “hardest decision of [his] career.” bang and 100 Thieves peaked at the top of Americas last year (Photo by Tina Jo/Riot Games). N4RRATE and bang have big shoes to fill, replacing two of Valorant's most prolific players, especially coming off of Sentinel's 2024 season. With a tournament victory at Masters Madrid and a top-four placement at Champions , they were arguably the most successful team from Americas throughout the year. Sentinels are now: Mohamed " johnqt " Amine Ouarid Jordan " Zellsis " Montemurro Zachary " zekken " Patrone Marshall " N4RRATE " Massey Sean " bang " Bezerra Rahul " curry " Nemani Bryan " Zyto " Ybanez (Manager) Kevin " Kez " Jeon (Manager) Adam " kaplan " Kaplan (Head coach)

title: jawgemo signs with G2 Esports
cleaned_content: After three years with Evil Geniuses , star duelist Alexander " jawgemo " Mor has signed with G2 Esports . The move comes just over a year after Evil Geniuses and jawgemo's successful 2023 season. A second-place finish at Masters Tokyo and a triumphant victory at Champions Los Angeles saw the organization lift not just its first world championship, but a first for any North American team. jawgemo holding the Champions trophy in 2023. (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) Following the trophy-capped campaign, other teams in the Americas region poached away much of the 2023 roster. Ethan and Demon1 , the latter of whom was named the MVP of Champions 2023, were signed by NRG . C0M and Boostio were signed by LEVIATÁN and 100 Thieves , respectively. Assistant coach Zikz was also signed by 100 Thieves to be their head coach. That left jawgemo, who had a server-leading 85 kills in the grand final against Paper Rex , as the only remaining player from the world championship-winning team. Former reserve player Apoth , former 100T players NaturE and Derrek , and FaZe Clan 's supamen rounded out a crew of former tier one players to complete the EG rebuild. Evil Geniuses performed below the heights they reached in 2023 with their new-look roster. They failed to qualify for any international competitions in 2024, and finished Americas Stage 2 ranked ninth, a far cry from their third-place finish in the 2023 Americas League . In their first match of the new season, EG and jawgemo defeated G2 Esports 2-0. The match was the first domino to fall in a 3-2 start to the season that saw the rookie VCT organization miss out on Masters Madrid . As a result, G2 shuffled their roster, replacing one of the members from their Ascension-winning squad. Five months later, in a blockbuster move now looking to build on a roster that's become one of the region's strongest, G2 Esports upgrade a duelist position that has been shaky as of late. In their maiden year in the VCT, G2 took the Americas region by storm. After a slow start at Americas Kickoff , they finished second in both Americas Stage 1 and Stage 2 , third at Masters Shanghai , and qualified for Champions Seoul , achieving a top-8 finish. Former tier two player icy had assumed the duelist role for most of the 2024 season, joining after Kickoff, but had been shaky at times. The team fielded a number of compositions that saw them play without any duelists, most recently on Icebox against Leviatan at Champions Seoul. Three players from the Americas Ascension-winning team The Guard remain on G2 Esports, with their roster now being: Jacob " valyn " Batio Alexander " jawgemo " Mor Trent " trent " Cairns Jonah " JonahP " Pulice Nathan " leaf " Orf Myungjun " Seowulf " Seo (Manager) Josh " JoshRT " Lee (Head coach) Peter " shhhack " Belej (Assistant coach)

title: DetonatioN FocusMe releases Medusa, Anthem, neth, Astell
cleaned_content: DetonatioN FocusMe has announced the release of An " Medusa " Min-cheol (안민철) , Yoshitaka " Anthem " Enomoto , Yusuke " neth " Matsuda , and head coach Moon " Astell " Ji-won (문지원) . The release includes three members who were a part of the Crazy Raccoon core that was acquired by DFM in late 2023. Medusa and Anthem had previously announced that they were restricted free agents and looking for new teams, but the latest announcement by DFM now confirms they are unattached free agents. Astell, who had been with the core since 2022 and a head coach since the 2023 season, leaves having amassed two full seasons of head coaching experience. neth, alongside Medusa, had been with the Crazy Raccoon core since 2020, and will be split from his teammates for the first time in nearly four years. Meiy and coach NorthernLights are the only remaining members from Crazy Raccoon. DFM's 2024 season was disappointing. One year after finishing dead last in the 2023 Pacific League , they finished second from last place in Pacific Stage 2 – just one spot above 2023 Pacific Ascension champions and now relegated BLEED . They won just two matches in the 2024 season, failing to qualify for any international events in the process. DetonatioN FocusMe is now: Ibuki " Meiy " Seki Tomonori " SSeeS " Okimura Hirotaka " Melofovia " Okazaki (Coach) Tsubasa " NorthernLights " Ando (Coach)

title: DRX part with BuZz, Foxy9, and BeYN
cleaned_content: DRX has bid farewell to long-standing player Yu " BuZz " Byeong-cheol (유병철) . They have also allowed Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) , and Kang " BeYN " Ha-bin (강하빈) to explore their options as restricted free agents. BuZz has been a pinnacle of Korean Valorant for almost its entire existence. Joining Vision Strikers in 2021, he helped bring them to their first international event at Masters Berlin . They would prove themself as a prominent force internationally, being one of the few teams outside of North America and EMEA that could compete with the best. At Berlin, they would make it out of their group without dropping a map before they would fall to the eventual winners in Gambit Esports . In 2022, DRX acquired the Vision Strikers roster that would go on to become a mainstay in VCT. BuZz, along with MaKo , Zest , stax , and Rb , were untouchable in Korea. Apart from one series loss to Incheon On Sla2ers , DRX rarely even lost a map against their domestic competition. At international events, their legacy would become that of dominating the group stage and then falling in the top six of playoffs, as they did at Masters Reykjavík and Masters Copenhagen . It seemed they were doomed to repeat this fate in Champions , when they were facing another top six elimination against FNATIC . However, they would finally break through that barrier when they defeated Fnatic as well as FunPlus Phoenix in the following round . They would then be eliminated in a five map thriller against OpTic Gaming , but a third place finish was a new height for the organization. One of the most historic rosters of the pre-partnership era of VCT (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games). Heading into the partnership leagues, DRX signed Foxy9 , hoping to have him join the active roster in place of Zest. However, they had trouble integrating him into their system, and would not start at LOCK//IN . Instead, the original five from 2022 would earn a top four finish and continue their reign as the best team from Pacific. Foxy9 would debut in the regional league , where he would help DRX earn an 8-1 record. In playoffs, however, their Pacific dominance would come to an end when they were defeated by Paper Rex . Foxy9 would make his international debut at Masters Tokyo , but when DRX lost to Evil Geniuses in the group stage, he was subbed out for Zest and would not play another game that year. With their roster troubles, DRX would fall in the first round of playoffs. In Champions , the original five members played their final tournament together, completing one last top six finish. In 2024, DRX released Rb and Zest, making Foxy9 and Flashback permanent additions of the starting roster. With this new roster however, DRX failed to qualify for Masters Madrid , their first time missing an international event since 2021. Shortly after their loss, Flashback had to temporarily step down from the roster, allowing BeYN to take his place. BeYN had been part of DRX Academy for some time, but was finally getting a shot on the main roster. His addition revitalized the team, as they went a flawless 5-0 in stage one , but fell just short of making it to Masters Shanghai . Stage two saw yet another change, as another of their long-standing members, this time the IGL stax, was released , and Flashback returned to the active roster. This new combination of players would take DRX back to the international stage at Champions , where they would once again finish in the top six. DRX's resurgence maintains their Champions streak, as well as making MaKo and BuZz two of very few players to attend every Champions event. Foxy9 found his first win at Champions this year (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games). With these roster changes, MaKo remains the lone original member of DRX. He along with Flashback will be the only two members returning from the 2024 roster. DRX is now: Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) Pyeon " termi " Seon-ho (편선호) (Head coach) Kim " glow " Min-soo (김민수) (Coach) Kwon " Argency " Soon-woo (권순우) (Coach)

title: Gen.G announce free agency of Munchkin, Lakia, and Meteor
cleaned_content: Gen.G have announced the free agency of Masters-winning trio Byeon " Munchkin " Sang-beom (변상범) , Kim " Lakia " Jong-min (김종민) , and Kim " Meteor " Tae-oh (김태오) amidst the end of their contracts. Gen.G, who signed the three for only one year before the start of the season, have also stated that they are "continuously in talks" to re-sign them. Meteor, having been on Gen.G since late 2022, first joined in the beginning of the VCT partnership era alongside familiar names formerly from TNL Esports including Yeom " eKo " Wang-ryong (염왕룡) and Yu " TS " Tae-seok (유태석) . A tight first-round loss in VCT LOCK//IN against eventual finalists LOUD attracted attention to the Korean squad, but hope ultimately fell flat in the Regular Season by finishing fourth in Playoffs and third in the LCQ to miss out on both international events for the year. For the 2024 season, Gen.G decided to rebuild, releasing all players with the exception of Meteor. Bringing in a new core of hopefuls, all looking to one-up previous setbacks, the organization signed veterans Munchkin, Lakia, and t3xture – coming from T1 , Dplus Esports , and Global Esports respectively – alongside at-the-time unknown rookie Kim " Karon " Won-tae (김원태) . Munchkin and Lakia in particular ended 2023 as rough as their teammates, with Munchkin bowing out in the Champions group stage under T1, while Lakia saw a similar group stage elimination in Ascension with Dplus. The team entered Kickoff as an unknown quantity, but shocked the world by taking down both tournament favorites in the finals, defeating both DRX and Paper Rex to emerge as Pacific champions heading into Madrid . Gen.G set foot into Spain by tearing through their competition throughout their first Masters event, going undefeated until the grand finals with a narrow 2-3 loss to Sentinels . After qualifying as the second seed to Shanghai , Gen.G would make history for the region by being the first Asian team to win an international event. The lead-up to their victory involved a three-year drought that saw Western teams win every VCT title up until Masters Shanghai. In the process, the team made it through Masters flawlessly, going 6-0 in matches against top seeds such as FNATIC and 100 Thieves. With a third championship to their name in one year following a 3-1 grand final against DRX in Stage 2, Gen.G entered Champions as the overarching favorites to win the event as a whole. Pitted into a group of death against fellow Masters finalists Sentinels and Team Heretics, alongside Chinese dark horse FunPlus Phoenix, Gen.G's expectations were quickly subverted with a collapse against Heretics and Sentinels to knock the home team out 9th-12th. Kim " t3xture " Na-ra (김나라) 's contract also expires at the end of the 2024 season, however no announcement regarding his future on the organization has been made as of yet. Gen.G are now down to: Kim " t3xture " Na-ra (김나라) Kim " Karon " Won-tae (김원태) Kang " solo " Geun-chul (강근철) (Head coach) Kim " HSK " Hae-seong (김해성) (Staff)

title: jawgemo and Evil Geniuses part ways
cleaned_content: After spending three seasons with the organization, Evil Geniuses has announced that they have parted ways with duelist player Alexander " jawgemo " Mor . "This ends an era of my time at Evil Geniuses since I first joined," jawgemo said . "Never thought I would accomplish all these goals I dreamed of. Never thought that I'd meet all these great people along the way. Through all the hardship and long hours to see it finally pay off." jawgemo played a key role in the Champions 2023-lifting campaign for Evil Geniuses, playing alongside current NRG players Ethan and Demon1 , LEVIATÁN 's C0M , and 100 Thieves IGL Boostio . jawgemo was the only surviving member of that roster, alongside head coach potter . That 2023 season was full of ups and downs for EG. After being eliminated in the second round of LOCK IN // São Paulo , they finished sixth place in the regular season of the Americas League , clinching the final playoff spot. After defeating the regular season's third place NRG and second place Cloud9 , Evil Geniuses had done enough to qualify for the group stages of Masters Tokyo and Champions Los Angeles . A dominant showing out of the gates saw EG win four straight matches without dropping a single map, even clinching revenge over Americas League Champions LOUD in the process. A loss to Fnatic sent them down to the lower final, where they defeated Pacific Champions Paper Rex in five maps. In the rematch against Fnatic in the grand final, they would be swept 3-0. EG started their Champions Los Angeles campaign in a similar vein of form to their Masters run. They won four straight matches, only dropping one map, before losing in the upper final, this time to Paper Rex. They defeated LOUD in a five-map lower final, and then secured revenge against Paper Rex in the grand final, bringing North America its first international trophy. In the grand final , jawgemo dropped a server-leading 85 kills The 2023 season came off of a 2022 season that saw the organization, while competing in North America Challengers , fail to qualify for any international events. Before landing with his now former long-term employers EG, jawgemo had bounced around several American teams, most notably T1 Academy . Evil Geniuses is now: Nicholas " NaturE " Garrison Derrek " Derrek " Ha Phat " supamen " Le Vincent " Apoth " Le Christine " potter " Chi (Head coach) Mike " pho " Panza (Assistant coach)

title: sScary and LEGIJA announce free agency
cleaned_content: Nutchapon " sScary " Matarat and Nikola " LEGIJA " Ninić have each announced that they are now free agents and are seeking new opportunities. This comes after Riot's announcement earlier today that BLEED had been removed from the VCT Pacific League due to a "failure to comply with critical reporting requirements and other key obligations under the Team Participation Agreement.” The team's slot has subsequently been filled by BOOM Esports , who finished second at Pacific Ascension 2024 . A seasoned mainstay of Southeast Asian Valorant, sScary qualified to five international events over the course of 2021 and 2022 with X10 Esports and XERXIA Esports respectively. He then joined BLEED along with LEGIJA, who transitioned from Counter-Strike, in 2023 to compete in Challengers Malaysia/Singapore and went on to win Pacific Ascension 2023 . sScary stood out as the most dominant player in the playoffs of the event with a 1.47 rating and a 1.23 rating for the tournament overall. The Singaporean organization struggled in VCT Pacific in 2024, undergoing multiple roster changes throughout the year and ultimately only finding one win against DetonatioN FocusMe over the course of the season. In August, BLEED announced the restricted free agency of Derrick " Deryeon " Yee , Jorell " Retla " Teo , Kim " Zest " Ki-seok (김기석) , and Jaccob " yay " Whiteaker with the intent to overhaul their roster. yay recently confirmed that he is now an unrestricted free agent. BLEED has stated that they are still eligible to compete in Challengers in the future, but it is unknown at this time whether or not they will do so. BLEED is currently: Ngô " crazyguy " Công Anh Benedict " Benedict " Tan (Manager) Sushant " Ominous " Jha (Analyst) Anthony " ImpressioN " Lim (Staff)

title: Riot removes BLEED from VCT Pacific, BOOM promoted
cleaned_content: Riot has announced the removal of BLEED from the VCT Pacific League ahead of the 2025 season, citing a "failure to comply with critical reporting requirements and other key obligations under the Team Participation Agreement". Their slot will be taken up by BOOM Esports , who most recently finished second at Pacific's Ascension . Entering the competitive scene back in 2021, BLEED managed to hold its own within APAC's Challengers, but was never able to break into an international event. Despite not being among the initial batch of orgs accepted into the partnership leagues, BLEED fought through Challengers and secured the Malaysia/Singapore ticket to Pacific Ascension 2023 . Fighting through the group stage and making it all the way to the grand finals, BLEED became the first APAC team to secure a spot in the VCT by sweeping SCARZ 3-0. The organization rode the momentum into 2024 and signed big names throughout the season, but managed to pick up only a single win against DetonatioN FocusMe throughout Kickoff , Stage 1 , and Stage 2 . BOOM on the other hand looked ready to mirror the achievements of 2023 BLEED in this year's Ascension . The team dominated the Indonesian Challengers scene and made their way all the way to the grand finals of Pacific Ascension 2024, but fell in a heartbreaking five-map thriller to Sin Prisa Gaming . Initially promised two years within the Pacific League, BLEED were slated for one more year of participation before being removed from the VCT. Riot has stated that their vacant slot will now be occupied by BOOM, while the Pacific League will continue with 12 teams this year.
