title: MxS release thief
cleaned_content: Moist x Shopify have released Brady " thief " Dever ahead of the NA Challengers League . The organization has less than two months to find a replacement before they fight for a chance at this year's Americas Ascension. The Controller player fought his way through last year's open qualifiers to secure a spot within 2023's Challengers League , and entered Split 1 alongside the rest of the then- BreakThru roster. A stellar performance sent the newly-acquired Moist Moguls to the Mid-Season Invitational, where they failed to achieve ideal results. However, the team turned things around in Split 2, where they finished first and secured a third-seed position at playoffs behind M80 and The Guard . Eager to prove themselves further at the 2023 Americas Ascension, Moist Moguls took down TSM and The Guard on their path to the grand final. One match away from qualifying for Brazil's international stage, the team fell to M80 in a shaky series. Unfortunately, an anticipated rematch against The Guard went the way of their opponents, and Moist Moguls were sent home from playoffs with a bronze medal. With their season over and a spot at next year's Challengers League secured, the Moguls joined forces with Shopify Rebellion Black and merged rosters. Joined by Xavier " flyuh " Carlson and brawk , thief rounded out the core of MxS and began preparing throughout the off season by participating in numerous tournaments. Although their results in OFF//SEASON events varied, MxS went head-to-head with many notable North American and partnered teams. Their best performance was at the LxT Invitational 2 , where the team upset Cloud9 and secured a second-place finish behind Oxygen Esports . Shorty after, the MxS announced that thief would no longer be on the roster moving forward. Head coach Jared " mac " Schneider took to Twitter/X and explained that thief's departure was due to the team looking for someone “with a different skill set.” The now-teamless player is current searching for a new home while MxS scour the scene for a potential replacement. Moist x Shopify is now: Xavier " flyuh " Carlson Victor " v1c " Truong Adam " mada " Pampuch Brock " brawk " Somerhalder Jared " mac " Schneider (Head coach) Chad " Oderus " Miller (Coach)

title: Evil Geniuses complete 2024 rebuild
cleaned_content: Evil Geniuses have unveiled their new roster ahead of the 2024 VCT. World champion jawgemo is joined by Derrek , NaturE , Apoth , and supamen with potter and pho returning as Head and assistant coaches. After two years of poor results, the organization finally turned their luck around in 2023. Despite exiting LOCK//IN with only one win, the remade squad fought hard in the Americas League and secured a spot at playoffs thanks to a five-way tiebreaker courtesy of MIBR . With three tickets to Masters: Tokyo on the line, the new villains of the VCT booked their trips to Japan alongside NRG and Brazilian juggernaut LOUD , where they finished second after being subdued by FNATIC , the first team to ever secure back-to-back international trophies. Having already qualified for Los Angeles' Champions , potter and the rest of her geniuses entered Group B prepared and advanced to the playoffs without dropping a map. After battling their way to the upper final, EG were stopped by a trophy-hungry Paper Rex , who sent them to the lower final after a three-map thriller. In a villainous turn of events, North America's last hope eliminated LOUD and crushed APAC's dreams of an international trophy by stealing the prize from PRX 3-1. EG enter 2024 with a target on their back. (Photo: Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) Despite being the first North American team to ever win Champions as well as achieving EG's best results in Valorant, the medal-bearing roster would soon be broken up as members departed left and right following rumors of pay cuts and contract jail. Of the former players, only jawgemo remained, and a long-awaited announcement has surrounded him with teammates hailing from 100 Thieves , FaZe Clan , and EG's reserve roster. Derrek and Apoth both have experience within the Tier 1 scene, with the former falling short of Tokyo and L.A. with 100T and the latter contributing to EG's championship run. NaturE and supamen both competed in the NA Challengers League for TSM and FaZe, but ended up missing out on the Americas Ascension after failing to make deep runs in the playoffs. potter continues to act as the brains behind the operation, with pho plotting in the shadows as the former teammates reunite under EG once again. The organization's new roster will debut in the upcoming Americas Kickoff where two slots at Masters: Madrid are up for grabs. Fresh off a championship win, Evil Geniuses ' 2024 roster is: Nicholas " NaturE " Garrison Derrek " Derrek " Ha Phat " supamen " Le Vincent " Apoth " Le Alexander " jawgemo " Mor Christine " potter " Chi (Head coach) Mike " pho " Panza (Assistant coach)

title: Bleed and Disguised announce affiliate partnership
cleaned_content: BLEED and Disguised have confirmed an Affiliate Partnership for the upcoming season. The announcement means Disguised will now participate in the Malaysia/Singapore Challengers, as both teams must operate in the same region. First announced in October of last year, Affiliate Partnerships allow VCT partner teams to collaborate with a Challengers or Game Changers organization, enabling the use of Two-Way players and closer content collaboration. The Two-Way system allows the option for player substitutions while avoiding the possibility of a substitute playing one or two games in the year, as was the case for many in 2023. With this partnership, BLEED may designate players who have previous synergy with their main roster as Two-Way players, cushioning to an extent the issues that may arise from emergency substitutions. Notably, the new Disguised roster features ex-BLEED player Juicy , who helped the team win Ascension but was too young to participate in VCT Pacific . He is joined by former Ninjas In Pyjamas duo bryce and JayH , the latter also being an ex-BLEED player, as well as one of Egoist 's previous teammates, wayne . Disguised was previously participating in North America, with a Challengers and a Game Changers roster. They qualified for their respective main events in 2023, but were unable to advance to Ascension or the Game Changers Championship. Despite changing regions, Disguised will be able to take advantage of BLEED's previous ecosystem, as BLEED moves to Seoul to participate in VCT Pacific. BLEED is now the second VCT team to announce an Affiliate Partnership, after FNATIC confirmed their own collaboration with Mandatory .

title: Turtle Troop fortify defenses with stellar, corey
cleaned_content: Challenger contenders Turtle Troop have bolstered their roster with the additions of Brenden " stellar " McGrath and Corey " corey " Nigra ahead of the 2024 NA Challengers League . The ex- Squirtle Squad roster struggled against 11 other teams in the 2023 NA Challengers League . Two low placements in both splits shattered their dreams of qualifying for the Americas Ascension and sent the troop to Play-In Relegation, where they fortunately retained their spot at next year's League. Throughout the off season, players shuffled around until – of the initial five members – only Jack " Add3r " Hayashi and Matthew " wedid " Suchan remained, joined by Brandon " bdog " Sanders of Shopify Rebellion Black . Under 100 Thieves , stellar made appearances at two VCT international LAN events, 2022's Champions Istanbul and São Paulo's LOCK//IN . Despite a strong top-eight finish on Brazil's stage, 100T were unable to replicate their success within the Americas League , where they were denied playoffs access after being backstabbed by MIBR and forced into an unfavorable tiebreaker. Relegated to the Americas LCQ , 100T were only able to take one map off Sentinels before their opponents quickly took the next two, ending the season for stellar and his teammates. TSM started their NA Challengers season with a bang, ending Split 1 with a 4-1 record and qualifying for the Mid-Season Faceoff, where they placed among the top six. Although the team stumbled in Split 2, they still managed to keep their dream of making Ascension alive by qualifying for playoffs thanks to their accrued circuit points. Unfortunately, TSM were immediately sent to the lower bracket by Moist Moguls , and subsequently eliminated by FaZe Clan in a nail-biting series. Shortly after, the organization announced that it was temporarily departing the competitive scene and released corey alongside the rest of the roster. After a brief stint with BackOutsideBoys , corey managed to find a new home with Turtle Troop, setting him up for another appearance at Challengers. Turtle Troop are one of the four confirmed teams set to compete at the main event of the 2024 NA Challengers. M80 , Oxygen Esports , and Moist x Shopify are all that remain of last year's contenders, as the other organizations slowly dropped out or did not advance through relegation. The Turtle Troop now consists of: Brenden " stellar " McGrath Matthew " WeDid " Suchan Jack " Add3r " Hayashi Corey " corey " Nigra Brandon " bdog " Sanders

title: BONECOLD departs Team Vitality, retires
cleaned_content: UPDATE: BONECOLD has announced his retirement from competitive play. This article has been updated to reflect that. World champion Santeri " BONECOLD " Sassi has mutually terminated his contract with Team Vitality and is retiring from competitive play. This announcement comes nearly six months after his benching last July. Among the first five players to ever win Champions back in 2021, BONECOLD pivoted from purple to gold in 2022 as he departed Acend for Vitality. That year, he and the rest of the hornets took home a second-place finish at the Valorant Regional League: Finals following a reverse-sweep by FUT Esports . As Vitality restructured their roster prior to the 2023 season, BONECOLD and fellow teammate Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis were all that remained as three new players were onboarded in hopes of reaching new heights. Unfortunately, the team only managed to win one match against Global Esports throughout their international debut at LOCK//IN before being sent home by LEVIATÁN . Returning home to compete in the EMEA League , BONECOLD and Vitality narrowly avoided early elimination and advanced to the playoffs with a 4-5 record. Eager to snatch tickets to Masters: Tokyo , Vitality attempted to battle their way to the top, but were eliminated by Team Liquid and FUT in two close series. Farewell, BONECOLD. (Photo: Lance Skundrich/Riot Games) Although the team was set to compete in the EMEA LCQ , they were given special permission by Riot to withdraw from the event following the passing of Karel " Twisten " Ašenbrener . Shortly after the end of their season, Vitality announced the benching of BONECOLD as the organization looked to restructure their roster ahead of 2024. As players shuffled in and out , BONECOLD remained on the bench until he and Vitality mutually agreed to terminate his contract. Shortly after his release from Vitality, BONECOLD announced on Twitter/X that he would no longer be pursuing a career in professional Valorant, citing that after a successful three years of competing, the arduous practice times and hours had begun to take a toll on him. BONECOLD is the first world champion to ever retire from competing. Vitality remains without a full roster ahead of the 2024 VCT. The organization still needs to sign one more player to compete before Kickoff commences. Still incomplete, Team Vitality is: Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Emil " runneR " Trajkovski Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Tomas " Destrian " Linikas (Inactive) Salah " salah " Barakat (Head coach) Joseph " Strong " Edwards (Coach) Harry " Gorilla " Mepham (Assistant coach) Marceau " Placido " Lambert (Performance coach) Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)

title: FNATIC announce first affiliate partnership with Mandatory
cleaned_content: FNATIC have become the first partnered VCT team to take advantage of the 2024 Affiliate Partnership system by announcing Mandatory as their Partnered Affiliate Team. Last year, Riot shared their vision for the upcoming season, which highlighted the company's strategy for Challengers Leagues heading into the 2024-2025 season. In their announcement, the concept of Affiliate Partnerships between teams was introduced. International teams would have the opportunity to build partnerships with Challenger and Game Changers teams, which in turn would unlock more opportunities to collaborate content and commercial partnerships. Affiliate partnerships with Challengers teams were region-locked, meaning that an organization competing in the EMEA League could only partner with an EMEA Challengers team, for example. However, Riot detailed that partnerships with Game Changers teams were not restricted to the region in which an organization was competing in. By participating in the Affiliate Partnership system, teams unlock the ability to utilize Two-Way Players. Players – such as a team's sixth man – who may not see as much playtime as their teammates may play in an Affiliate Partner Team's roster down in Challengers and Game Changers. Riot explained that this system helps give players “valuable competitive experience instead of being relegated to the bench.” FNATIC enter 2024 as EMEA's pride and joy after taking home the trophy in both São Paulo's LOCK//IN and Japan's Masters: Tokyo last year. Despite falling short at Champions with a fourth-place finish, the organization retains the same roster as last year, save for a vacant sixth-man spot previously occupied by Maks " kamyk " Rychlewski . Mandatory advanced all the way to the Play-Ins Playoffs of EMEA Ascension , where they were unfortunately denied access to the Group Stage following a fifth-place finish. Throughout their time within the French Challengers League , they played second fiddle to Gentle Mates , the eventual Ascension champions who secured their place within the 2024 EMEA League. Through their partnership with Mandatory, FNATIC have become the first VCT team to unlock the benefits of the Affiliate Partner system. As the season looms closer and closer, other organizations may choose to follow suit.

title: Talon reunite Surf and Crws
cleaned_content: TALON have signed former XERXIA Esports duelist Thanachart " Surf " Rungapajaratkul to their roster, bringing their active player count to six ahead of the Pacific Kickoff . Entering the competitive scene in 2022, Surf signed with XERXIA ahead of the TH Challengers: Stage 1 group stage and helped take them all the way to the APAC Challengers: Stage 1 playoffs, where they qualified to Masters: Reykjavik alongside Paper Rex . Leading with an upset against eventual-victors OpTic Gaming , XERXIA were one win off of advancing to the playoffs, but fell to Team Liquid and OpTic in their rematch. Eager to make an appearance on the international stage once again, Surf and his teammates qualified to Masters: Copenhagen , but were sent home quickly by NORTHEPTION and future champions FunPlus Phoenix . Having qualified for that year's Champions , XERXIA stumbled again in Group C, exiting winless following losses to XSET and KRÜ Esports . Surf continued competing briefly for XERXIA in 2023, but was released from the organization last March. XERXIA qualified to all three international events in 2022. (Photo: Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) Talon were unable to keep up with the competition last year. Despite finishing among the top eight at LOCK//IN , the organization was unable to reach higher heights within the Pacific League as a winless DetonatioN FocusMe was all that separated Talon and a last-place finish by the time League Play had concluded. Forced to fight for survival in the Pacific LCQ , Talon eliminated DFM in two brief maps, but fell to Gen.G shortly after in a heartbreaking reverse-sweep that put a stop to their 2023 season. Hungry for a trophy, Talon began making roster changes and bid farewell to three players and a coach. North American import Governor joined T1 's ban and Team Secret 's lenne on the active roster, with FrosT filling in the Head Coach slot. Surf's signing follows the transition of Patiphan " Patiphan " Chaiwong to the reserve roster as the talent stepped back from competitive play last month. With six active players, Talon have yet to announce their starting five ahead of their appearance in the Pacific Kickoff, set to commence in February as teams fight for tickets to Masters: Madrid . TALON is now: Thanamethk " Crws " Mahatthananuyut Jittana " JitBoyS " Nokngam Thanachart " Surf " Rungapajaratkul Lim " lenne " You Xiang Lionel Joseph " ban " Seungmin Oh Peter " Governor " No Hector " FrosT " Rosario (Head coach) Aaron " b0i " Thao (Coach)

title: Wolves Esports sign eight players
cleaned_content: Wolves Esports have signed eight players, the most among all partnership leagues. Huang " Yuicaw " Yung-chieh (黃湧傑) , Liu " Spring " Jiunting (刘俊霆) , Christopher " pl1xx " Li , Xiang " coldfish " Pengzhi (向鹏志) , Zhong " balua " Haojun (钟皓钧) , Deng " Cyah " Enping (邓恩平) , Leung " FFs " Cheuk Nam (梁卓南) , Geng " Babyblue " Haoran (耿浩然) , coaches Mingiyan " Naint " Goldaev and Xie " jungleDSL " Zhilin (谢志凛) all join the roster. Yuicaw is known for his time with the FunPlus Phoenix organization, first under academy team FunPlus Phoenix ZHUQUE in 2022, then the main team in 2023. After their international debut against Karmine Corp , FPX became a driving force for China – coming in the top four at both acts of the FGC Invitational and being the third Chinese seed for Champions . Following a 0-2 exit at Champions, Yuicaw left to join rivals Attacking Soul Esports , where they placed fourth in CN Evolution Series Act 2 and top six after a loss to FPX in Act 3 . Yuicaw's last showing for ASE was at Ascension , ending the year with a third-place finish. Spring began his career at Shenzhen NTER , one of the first teams to make a mark in the blooming Chinese scene in 2022. However, NTER could not carry over the same momentum in 2023. As such, Spring went on to Ninjas In Pyjamas , aiding their campaign for the CN Evo Series and a fourth-place finish at Ascension. pl1xx has been a staple for the OCE scene since beginning his career in 2020. After spending a year in North America with various teams – notably Soniqs and Andbox – he returned to Oceania in 2022. In 2023, pl1xx again went overseas, this time to China for Weibo Gaming , where they found marginal success but not enough for solid showings as they would get eliminated early on in all tournaments. After spending most of 2022 with Tales of Eastern , Coldfish hopped from team to team. First with TYLOO for FGC Invitational Act 1, getting eliminated in open qualifiers. A brief stint at Gank Gaming – where he played with future teammate Babyblue – resulted in a group stage exit for Act 2, then one game away from VCT China Champions Qualifier playoffs. Coldfish finally joined TOP Esports , finishing fourth in CN Evo Series Act 3. FFs, Cyah, and alulba made up the Monarch Effect core for 2023. ME had midding results, prone to exiting the open qualifiers early. Following a top twelve showing at Champions qualifiers and before CN Evo Series Act 3, the roster signed Babyblue, rejoining synergy with alulba and FFs from O2 Gaming . Monarch Effect played in the play-ins group stage and went out 0-2. Little is known about Wolves Esports except for two quick losses in open qualifiers for the Evolution series. Due to their reputation in Rainbow Six eSports and as the owners of Premier League team Wolverhampton Wanderers, Wolves were accepted as one of 11 teams for the upcoming VCT China League. With a roster this large, any combination of players can happen. The starting roster seems to point to Yuicaw, Spring, pl1xx, Coldfish, and alulba, with the rest on the bench. Wolves Esports are now: Huang " Yuicaw " Yung-chieh (黃湧傑) Liu " Spring " Jiunting (刘俊霆) Zhong " alulba " Haojun (钟皓钧) Geng " Babyblue " Haoran (耿浩然) Pengzhi " coldfish " Xiang (向鹏志) Deng " Cyah " Enping (邓恩平) Leung " FFs " Cheuk Nam (梁卓南) Christopher " pl1xx " Li Mingiyan " Naint " Goldaev (Head coach) Xie " jungleDSL " Zhilin (谢志凛) (Coach)

title: All Gamers unveil 2024 squad
cleaned_content: All Gamers have announced a new roster in preparation for the upcoming VCT season. The rebuild includes the acquisition of Jiang " bunt " He (姜河) , Wang " monk " Haoyu (王浩宇) , and coach Yang " EGO " Haozun (杨皓尊) from Attacking Soul Esports , with Delbert " deLb " Tanoto , Xin " Spitfires " Mingyan (辛明阳) , and Li " sword9 " Wei (李卫) joining as well. Only Zhang " X3B " Chongtian (张丛天) remains from their previous lineup. Aided by coach EGO , bunt and monk made it as far as Masters Tokyo with their previous org, Attacking Soul Esports, but barely missed qualifying to Champions. After China Evolution Act 1 , bunt was benched and monk was no longer a guaranteed starter. bunt and monk are among the few Chinese players with international experience. (Photo by Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) Joining as in-game leader is sword9 , recently an assistant coach for EDward Gaming . Originally an initiator player, he joined EDG as staff ahead of their Masters Tokyo qualification campaign. As a player he is best known for his time on KONE eSports Club , where, alongside Knight and yosemite , he managed to reach fourth place in the 2022 East Asia LCQ . Indonesian player deLb joins as their import and likely duelist. He spent most of his career on Alter Ego , but joined 17Gaming in the tail end of 2023 for their Ascension bid. They went out in groups, but deLb still boasted the fourth-highest ACS of the tournament. The final pickup is Spitfires , formerly Rare Atom 's substitute player. He was a part of their original lineup back in February 2023, but was eventually replaced by yoman entirely. Despite being one of the first Chinese organizations to sign a Valorant roster, All Gamers have never been successful, failing to place in the top four in any event. Most recently, they featured miKa and BeYN , loaned from DRX Academy , but the team was unable to make it past the China Evolution play-in stage . The following lineup will debut next month at the VCT CN Kickoff : Zhang " X3B " Chongtian (张丛天) Jiang " bunt " He (姜河) Wang " monk " Haoyu (王浩宇) Delbert " deLb " Tanoto Xin " Spitfires " Mingyan (辛明阳) Li " sword9 " Wei (李卫) Yang " EGO " Haozun (杨皓尊) (Head coach)

title: VCT Kickoff format and points distribution revealed
cleaned_content: Riot has announced the VCT Kickoff format, which will be consistent across the four regions, as well as the way Championship Points will be distributed throughout the year. Kickoff will be this year's way to start the year. Instead of a big international tournament like LOCK//IN , Riot has opted for one tournament per region. Each region's Kickoff Tournament will be split into three stages: groups, play-ins, and playoffs. The eleven teams will be seeded into three groups, one of which will have just three teams. Each region's best squad — their highest placed team at Champions — will be put into that group, which will be played in a modified GSL bracket. The seeding details are not clear — they are “based on 2023 performance” — but it is safe to assume FNATIC (#1) and Gentle Mates (#11) may be in Group 3, the latter due to being VCT newcomers. The remaining eight teams will be split into two four-team groups played in a regular GSL format. While the winners of each group will move straight to the playoffs, the second-placed teams will face off in the play-ins in a single round-robin. The winner will round out the playoffs stage as the fourth team. The playoffs of Kickoff will be a single-elimination bracket, with both finalists heading to Masters Madrid . The winner will also receive preferential seeding in Spain. Image by Riot Games Championship Points will be distributed this year, but will work differently from 2021 and 2022's VCT Points. Winning any tournament — Kickoff, Masters Madrid, Masters Shanghai, Stage 1 Playoffs, or Stage 2 Playoffs — will earn a team three points. Any match win (across 10 matches per team) across Stage 1 and 2 will also award a team with one point. The top three teams at the end of Stage 2 will receive a berth at Champions 2024. Each region will also take a fourth team to the world championship, who will earn their spot via Championship Points. Riot has also dropped a hint regarding each Stage's playoffs: the first and second seed in each Stage will receive a bye to the second round, earning an extra point to compensate for the match they will skip. VCT Americas will open the 2024 season, as competition will begin Feb. 16. A day later, the Pacific region will begin its own kickoff tournament. VCT EMEA begins a few days later, on Feb. 20, and China will be the latest starter, scheduled to start Feb. 22. Masters Madrid will occupy the month of March, with Stage 1 kicking off in early April. Dates for Masters Shanghai, Stage 2, and Valorant Champions 2024 are yet to be revealed. Image by Riot Games

title: G2 Gozen begin rebuild, release Glance, sarah, Carcass
cleaned_content: G2 Gozen have announced the departure of Anastasia " Glance " Anisimova , Sarah " sarah " Ahmed , and coach Robertas " Carcass " Mikuckis nearly a month after their third-place finish at the Game Changers Championship 2023: São Paulo . Glance and Carcass were present throughout their initial dominance of the EMEA Game Changers scene leading up to G2's crowning as the first-ever Game Changers world champions in 2022 . Heading into the 2023 season, G2 saw the departure of Julia " juliano " Kiran and eventually Maryam " Mary " Maher as Vivian " roxi " Schilling and sarah were onboarded in their place. The team still managed to take home two first-place finishes, but stumbled in Stage III , where EMEA's first seed at Brazil was up for grabs. G2 have been the best-performing EMEA team at both Game Changers Championships. (Photo: Adela Sznajder/Riot Games) Despite being matched up against Team Liquid Brazil in their opening match at São Paulo, G2 silenced the crowd with a quick 2-0 to send Team Liquid to the lower bracket. Riding the momentum into their next matchup against Team SMG GC , the squad recovered from a 1-0 deficit to win the series 2-1 and meet Shopify Rebellion Gold in the upper final. Unfortunately, G2's luck began to run out as they were defeated by North America's juggernaut and sent to meet Team Liquid in the lower final. This time around, however, their opponents flipped the script and eliminated G2 after two quick maps in convincing manner, accompanied by the roar of the home crowd. With their season over, the organization began looking ahead at possible roster changes and allowed Carcass to explore his options before releasing Glance. Now down to three, G2 Gozen is: Vivian " roxi " Schilling Petra " Petra " Stoker Michaela " mimi " Lintrup

title: JDG sign Rare Atom core, jkuro
cleaned_content: JDG Esports have announced the acquisition of the Rare Atom core, consisting of Park " stew " Young-chan (박영찬) , Lifan " Viva " Ran (冉立凡) , Zhuo " MarT1n " Zhengjie (卓政杰) , Chen " YiHao " Yihao (陈一豪) , and head coach Ma " ValAnalysis " Hyun-sung (마현성) . Former TOP Esports player Yong " jkuro " Haochong (杨浩聪) rounds out the roster. stew, Chae " yoman " Young-moon (채영문) , and coach ValAnalysis made their mark on Gwangju Shadow , a Korean Challengers team that rivalled top contenders. GJS made a heavy impact during Challengers, reaching playoffs in Splits 1 and 2 – placing fourth in the former and top six in the latter. stew and yoman later left in June, with ValAnalysis following suit days later. jkuro has been an active player since 2021 but found his footing with the Taiwanese Challengers team, Anti Eco Eco Club . AEEC were one of the top dogs as they came fourth in Split 1 and second in Split 2 . jkuro then joined TOP Esports but found slight success, as they went on to properly compete at China Evolution Series Act 3 , where they placed fourth. Rare Atom entered Valorant in February 2023 with a full Chinese roster, with Viva, Mart1n, Yihao, and Xin " Spitfires " Mingyan (辛明阳) as the base. They struggled in the first half of the year, given their eliminations at FGC Invitational Acts 1 and 2 and the VCT China Champion Qualifiers . However, Rare Atom catapulted up the Chinese hierarchy after stew, yoman, and ValAnalysis joined. RA dominated the competition with three consecutive top-three finishes at all three acts of the CN EVO Series and was a favorite for the upcoming Ascension tournament. Unfortunately for Rare Atom, they fell short in the grand finals to Dragon Ranger Gaming , placing second once more. The JDG organization entered after Champions and only competed at the CN Evo Series, where they struggled in the open qualifiers. On December 10, 2023, JDG was announced as one of 11 teams competing in the VCT China League. Aside from assistant coach Li " Billyo " Xinyu (李新宇) staying on, the previous JDG roster parted ways. The JDG Esports 2024 roster is: Park " stew " Young-chan (박영찬) Lifan " Viva " Ran (冉立凡) Yong " jkuro " Haochong (杨浩聪) Chen " YiHao " Yihao (陈一豪) Zhuo " MarT1n " Zhengjie (卓政杰) Ma " ValAnalysis " Hyun Sung (마현성) (Head coach) Li " Billyo " Xinyu (李新宇) (Assistant coach)

title: DRX release Zest
cleaned_content: Shortly after the release of Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) , DRX have parted ways with roster veteran Kim " Zest " Ki-seok (김기석) . The former in-game leader leaves the organization with a squad of five and enters the market as a sought-after free agent. With a competitive career alongside the same core dating back to June of 2020, Zest and the rest of Vision Strikers dominated their regional competition while amassing a famous win streak of 102 matches. Riding the momentum, they took to the international stage by frequenting appearances in the biggest events over the years. Their most successful season was in 2022, where the team took home two top-six placements at both Masters events capped off by a third-place finish at Champions . Eager to reach new heights in 2023, DRX made a run to the semifinals of LOCK//IN , where they eventually fell to LOUD after a failed reverse sweep. Zest and DRX exceeded expectations throughout their stay in Istanbul. (Photo: Lance Skundrich/Riot Games) The team's top four placement at São Paulo was their best achievement of the year, as they exited Masters: Tokyo among the top eight and were unable to break past the top six at Los Angeles' Champions . Shortly after their season was over, DRX participated in the AfreecaTV Valorant League , but could not advance past the group stage after suffering losses to grand finalists Sentinels and Paper Rex . Following their lackluster results on home ground, the organization opted to bench Rb and Zest while promoting Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) to the main roster. After nearly four years with the organization, Rb was eventually released, but quickly signed with Titan Esports Club to compete in the upcoming Chinese Kickoff . No longer contracted to DRX, Zest remains a free agent and has almost a month to sign with an organization should he choose to turn his attention to the regional leagues set to commence in February. DRX is now: Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) Yu " BuZz " Byung-chul (유병철) Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) Pyeon " termi " Seon-ho (편선호) (Head coach) Kim " glow " Min-soo (김민수) (Coach) Kwon " Argency " Soon-woo (권순우) (Coach)

title: Nova Esports announce VCT roster, neveR joins
cleaned_content: UPDATE: As of January 15, 2023, Nova Esports have announced their VCT CN roster. neveR joined the team in December 20, 2023. This article has been updated to reflect the current roster. Nova Esports have announced their VCT China roster including Russian import Vsevolod " neveR " Suslov . neveR joined his first-ever professional team, Team RA'AD , in January 2023. RA'AD found immediate success and dominated their regional competition, winning VCT MENA North Africa Split 1 . They continued to be a powerhouse, with a back-to-back in Split 2 . However, neveR was subsequently moved to the substitute role and later left in July. Nova Esports entered the Chinese scene in March 2023. Their first competition was qualifying for FGC Invitational Act 1 , which they could not do. Nova found little success throughout the year; they were consistently eliminated in open qualifiers in all competitions, including the VCT Champions China Qualifier , save for a win against Invincible Gaming . On December 10, 2023, Nova were announced as one of 11 teams participating in the upcoming VCT China League. They made their first roster move on December 20, 2023, by signing neveR, then added Guang " GuanG " Honglin (光洪霖) from Royal Never Give Up on January 14, 2024. Nova Esports are now: Vsevolod " neveR " Suslov Song " PangH " Wenhao (宋文浩) Ye " o0o0o " Xiaodong (叶晓东) Chen " OBONE " Yijie (陈怡洁) Wang " CB " Qingchuan (王庆川) Guang " GuanG " Honglin (光洪霖) " 24K " (Coach)

title: Nova Esports begin roster rebuild, sign GuanG
cleaned_content: Nova Esports have signed former Royal Never Give Up player Guang " GuanG " Honglin (光洪霖) following Riot's announcement of the 10 partnered Chinese teams. The organization looks to snatch one of the two tickets to Masters: Madrid in the upcoming Chinese Kickoff tournament. GuanG and RNG competed in the Chinese Evolution Series alongside many of China's best teams. Unfortunately, RNG failed to make deep runs in any of the three events, with their best placement being a top 12 finish at the main event of Act 3: Heritability. After not qualifying for Chinese Ascension nor being selected as one of the 10 partnered organizations ahead of Kickoff, RNG eventually bid farewell to GuanG. Nova Esports produced lackluster results prior to their acceptance to the Chinese League. The team attempted to make an international appearance at Los Angeles' 2023 Champions , but were sent home early from the Champions China Qualifier after only picking up one win against Invincible Gaming in the Preliminary Stage. Despite their shortcomings, the organization has begun preparing for their battle within the Chinese League by restructuring its starters amidst the roster shuffles currently taking place in China. Nova Esports' roster will be finalized come February, when all four regional leagues kickoff. Nova Esports is: " PangH " " JL " " o0o0o " " OBONE " " CB " Guang " GuanG " Honglin (光洪霖)

title: hfmi0dzjc9z7 signs with TYLOO
cleaned_content: Former Attacking Soul Esports flex player Zhang " zjc " Juncheng (张峻程) has joined TYLOO ahead of their run at the Chinese Kickoff event. This signing is the organization's first attempt at restructuring its roster following the announcement of the 10 partnered Chinese teams. Present with ASE throughout their many highs and lows, hfmi0dzjc9z7 was never quite able to reach the upper echelons of the Chinese scene until 2023, when he and his team took home the trophy in the FGC Valorant Invitational 2023: Act 1 by defeating EDward Gaming in the grand final. Having secured one of the two Chinese tickets to Masters: Tokyo , ASE were placed into Group B alongside FUT Esports , DRX , and eventual-runner ups Evil Geniuses . Unfortunately, the team only managed to pick up one map throughout the event against FUT before exiting Japan winless. hfmi0dzjc9z7 was among the third Chinese roster to ever reach the international stage. (Photo: Lee Aiksoon/Riot Games) After participating in three of the Chinese Evolution Series events, ASE had secured enough circuit points to enter Chinese Ascension as the second seed behind Rare Atom . Despite breezing through the group stage and slaying Ninjas In Pyjamas in their opening match of playoffs, ASE quickly fell to Rare Atom and were subsequently eliminated from contention after a five-map series against Dragon Ranger Gaming . TYLOO entered the competitive scene last year, but the roster was never considered one of China's top contenders. The organization had a chance to debut on the world stage through the Champions Tour 2023: Champions China Qualifier , but fell short at the last hurdle to FunPlus Phoenix . The new roster looks to take home one of the tickets to Masters: Madrid in the Chinese Kickoff tournament, set to begin in February. TYLOO is now: Kelun " slowly " Sun (孙克伦) " SORRYMYBAD " Zhang " LuoK1ng " Zhan Peng (张展鹏) Ding " Ninebody " Yi (丁毅) Cheng " ICEKING " Wanpeng (程万鹏) " AAK " Zhang " hfmi0dzjc9z7 " Juncheng (张峻程) " Yiyee " (Coach)

title: Rb to compete in Chinese Kickoff with TEC
cleaned_content: Founding DRX member Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) has signed with Titan Esports Club ahead of the Chinese Kickoff tournament. His relocation places him in a completely new team environment after nearly four years with DRX. One of South Korea's most accomplished players, Rb amassed win after win with the then- Vision Strikers core, being the only team to ever reach a 102 win streak in official matches. Over the years, Vision Strikers dominated the regional competition and were frequent visitors to the international stage. The peak of DRX's achievements culminated in the form of a third-place finish at 2022's Champions . Still reaching for higher heights, the team entered 2023 with a top four finish at LOCK//IN after falling to runner-up LOUD. Unfortunately, the team was unable to outclass their previous results, and only managed to place among the top eight at Masters: Tokyo and top six at Champions . Rb's best international placement was at 2022's Champions. (Photo: Lance Skundrich/Riot Games) Shortly after their run in Los Angeles, the team began experimenting with prospects Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) and Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) in place of Rb and fellow veteran Kim " Zest " Ki-seok (김기석) . Rb's last match under DRX was against Paper Rex in the AfreecaTV Valorant League , where the team exited early in the group stage. TEC recently entered the Chinese scene by competing in the China Evolution Series Act 3: Heritability . The team managed to trudge past the Play-In stage and into playoffs, where they placed among the top six after suffering losses to Dragon Ranger Gaming and Trace Esports . The organization was later revealed to be one of the 10 selected to participate in the Chinese Kickoff, where two tickets to Masters: Madrid were up for grabs. The Chinese scene is currently undergoing a mass outbreak of roster changes as teams look to finalize their starters by February. Titan Esports Club is currently: Xing " LockM " Fuling (邢福凌) " ADe " " XTian " Li " QiuYe " Runtao (李润涛) Li " B1ack " Songtai (李松泰) Wu " shameless " Hongjie (吴洪杰) Han " Abo " Bohao (韩博皓) " kawaii " Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) " 3water " (Coach) Yao " York " Kun (姚堃) (Assistant coach)

title: FPX returns to five with Life
cleaned_content: FunPlus Phoenix have completed their starting roster with the addition of Qu " Life " Donghao (瞿东豪) , after spending the better part of the year in Attacking Soul Esports . Originally known for his time as one of the longstanding duelists in EDward Gaming since its founding in 2020, Life's tenure in EDG was nothing short of dominating, including winning two out of three acts of FGC Valorant Invitational in 2022 , allowing themselves a berth to the following East Asia LCQ that year as one of two Chinese teams. Alongside EDG, Life also became the first Chinese representative on an international LAN during Champions 2022 , ultimately finishing top 16. In late 2022, Life moved over to a struggling Attacking Soul Esports and debuted in the FGC Valorant Epilogue , where his team finished third. Attacking Soul started 2023 off with a bang by surprising and defeating EDG in FGC Valorant Invitational 2023: Act 1 , earning Life his second international appearance at Masters Tokyo . Facing off against Pacific giant DRX and EMEA upstart FUT Esports , Attacking Soul would end up eliminated early in the group stage. After competing through the China Evolution Series , Attacking Soul ends up qualified for Ascension China , being looked on as one of the favourites to win the event, besides Rare Atom . After losing to RA in the upper finals, ASE wound up one step short in the lower final, defeated by the eventual victors, Dragon Ranger Gaming . FPX made their first international appearance during LOCK//IN . There, FPX was able to snatch a map off Karmine Corp in their 2-1 loss. FPX secured a second international appearance on Champions 2023 , where they would end up eliminated after matching up against T1 and eventual world champions Evil Geniuses , losing both matches in their elimination. After competing in the China Evolution Series ahead of Ascension in the second half of 2023, FPX was revealed as one of the 10 partnered teams within the Chinese League. Two days ago, FPX transferred one of their founding members, nizhaoTZH , to DRG, opening up room on the team for Life ahead of VCT CN Kickoff this February. FunPlus Phoenix are now: Zhang " BerLIN " Bolin (張柏霖) Kale " Autumn " Dunne Qu " Life " Donghao (瞿东豪) Zhang " AAAAY " Yang (张杨) Liang " Lysoar " Youhao (梁优好) Deng " NaThanD " Senqiao (邓森侨) (Head coach)

title: B3ar joins Bilibili Gaming
cleaned_content: Bilibili Gaming have signed their newest in-game leader Yang " B3ar " Zhanxiong (杨瞻雄) from Shenzhen NTER . B3ar began his career with NTER in 2022 when the Chinese scene was still finding its footing. Even in the fledgling scene, NTER were one of the first ones to make a mark, with third place at FGC Invitational 2022 Act 2 , several top two finishers at Xyper Arena Weekly Showdowns , and another third-place showing at FGC Invitational Epilogue at the end of the year. However, in 2023, NTER could not replicate the same momentum as they were consistently eliminated in open qualifiers. The storied Bilibili organization entered the scene in February 2023 with the debut of FGC Invitational Act 1 — where they came ninth place. Through a series of roster changes, BLG later solidified their position in the Chinese hierarchy as a top-three team, placing second in both FGC Act 2 and the VCT Champions China Qualifier . Their first international debut was a statement — defeating NRG twice and entering playoffs, in which BLG exited rather quickly to regional rivals EDward Gaming . Post-Champions saw Bilibili lose steam since they faltered at the China Evolution Series, going as far as the top six in all three acts. As of December 10, 2023, Bilibili Gaming were announced as one of 11 teams participating in the VCT China League, alongside the aforementioned EDward Gaming, JDG Esports , FunPlus Phoenix , and Wolves Esports . Bilibili Gaming are now: Yang " B3ar " Zhanxiong (杨瞻雄) Wang " whzy " Hao Zhe (王昊哲) Li " rin " Le Wei (李乐炜) Liu " Knight " Yuxiang (刘宇翔) Wang " Yosemite " Lei (王磊) Zhong " Biank " Jian Fei (钟剑飞) " Levius " Hu " Robot " Lei Yu (扈雷雨) (Manager) " Xpz " (Coach)

title: DRX part ways with Rb
cleaned_content: DRX have announced the departure of founding member Goo " Rb " Sang-min (구상민) from the organization. The announcement comes one month after his initial move to the bench of the starting roster. Rb signed with the then- Vision Strikers roster back in June of 2020 as the first Korean organization to enter Valorant. He, alongside the rest of the Korean MVP PK CS:GO roster, all joined VS in an early swap from Counter Strike to Valorant, accompanied by current DRX members Kim " Zest " Ki-seok (김기석) and Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) . Under his three-year-long tenure with the Vision Strikers core, Rb helped bring home an 102-0 undefeated streak, alongside a collective five regional championships and multiple international qualifications, culminating with a top-three finish in Champions 2022 . Leading into the first year of partnerships and the transition to DRX, the team would fail to reach their previous strides throughout the year in comparison to their results from the seasons prior. Despite initial promise and a placement into the top-four in LOCK//IN , the beginning of the Pacific league and onward would spell unfortunate for the Korean side, losing twice against Paper Rex in the VCT Pacific Playoffs for the first time ever to end off placing second in the Pacific. Their regional finish was followed up by an all-time lowest for DRX with a top-eight finish in Masters Tokyo and a familiar top-six finish in Champions 2023 . The final event for DRX in 2023, the AfreecaTV VALORANT League , resulted in losses to Sentinels and Paper Rex to be eliminated in the group stage, and spelling the inevitable end of Rb's reign with the organization. Rb's time away from a team is expected to be short lived, as recent rumors suggest that he will now be set to join Chinese organization Titan Esports Club , one of the eleven teams participating in the inaugural season of VCT China . DRX are now: Kim " stax " Gu-taek (김구택) Cho " Flashback " Min-hyuk (조민혁) Yu " BuZz " Byung-chul (유병철) Kim " MaKo " Myeong-gwan (김명관) Jung " Foxy9 " Jae-sung (정재성) Pyeon " termi " Seon-ho (편선호) (Head coach) Kim " glow " Min-soo (김민수) (Coach) Kwon " Argency " Soon-woo (권순우) (Coach)

title: FPX transfer nizhaoTZH to DRG
cleaned_content: FunPlus Phoenix have transferred over Tang " nizhaoTZH " Zehao (唐哲昊) to Dragon Ranger Gaming ahead of the VCT 2024 China Kickoff , marking the end of his one year tenure with the Chinese organization. Onboarded just over a year ago, nizhaoTZH made his international debut on São Paolo's stage at 2023's LOCK//IN alongside one of the two Chinese squads invited to Brazil. Although his team managed to raise eyebrows by taking a map off Karmine Corp in their opening series, they were quickly sent home by the French representatives without a win. After missing out on Masters Tokyo following a fourth-place finish in the FGC Valorant Invitational 2023: Act 1 , FPX secured a reappearance on the world stage by placing third at the Champions China Qualifier . Thrown into the villains' lair straight off the bat, FPX were eliminated by T1 and Evil Geniuses , who would later go on to take the trophy on home ground. With the important portion of their 2023 season behind them, FPX made one roster change before being revealed as one of the 10 partnered teams within the Chinese League and transferring nizhaoTZH. DRG were not favored to win China's Ascension . Entering the tournament behind Rare Atom and Attacking Soul Esports , the roster narrowly avoided elimination in the group stage and qualified to playoffs with a win over Four Angry Men . Despite losing their opening match to fan-favorites Rare Atom, the team recovered quickly and eliminated Ninjas In Pyjamas before enacting their revenge on ASE in a five-map series. Against all odds, DRG upset Rare Atom in the grand final 3-1 and claimed their rightful spot in the Chinese League. The transfer of nizhaoTZH is one of the many roster changes expected to shake up the Chinese scene ahead of Kickoff as organizations look to finalize their squads. Dragon Ranger Gaming 's seven-man roster is now: Tang " nizhaoTZH " Zehao (唐哲昊) Ilya " vo0kashu " Ushakov He " YuChEn " Cai (何财) " Nicc " " TvirusLuke " Yu " Zeno " Zhijun (余智竣) " Dingwei " Huang " LT " Biaohong (黄彪宏) (Head coach)

title: SK Gaming enter Valorant
cleaned_content: SK Gaming have officially entered the Valorant competitive scene. The storied German organization looks to expand its collection of trophies in its local scene, with the roster consisting of a German core alongside Bati and Meddo , the latter formerly of G2 Esports . The duo will join German prospects Click , Felix , and murii as the troupe prepares to compete in the 2024 DACH Challengers League. Rounding out the roster are the tenured coaches of joYnt and yaotziN. , with joYnt acting as the brains of the operation for SK. Meddo spent the early stages of Valorant playing for big names such as FunPlus Phoenix , Giants Gaming , and most notably G2, with whom he secured a top six finish at 2022's Masters Reykjavik . After departing the organization prior to 2023, Meddo played in multiple Challengers Leagues for different teams like The Barbers and HSDIRR , maintaining a presence in Tier 2 through multiple Challengers League appearances preluding his signing with SK. Bati was part of the former Arroz squad that was later signed by SAW . The organization found success within the 2023 Portugal Challengers League and qualified for EMEA Ascension , where they battled their way through team after team to book their tickets to playoffs. Three wins away from an invite to the 2024 EMEA League, SAW had their dreams crushed after suffering back-to-back losses at the hands of Apeks and eventual-champions Gentle Mates . Click, Felix, and murii all shared time on Wave Esports for nearly two years before going their separate ways. Despite all playing under different teams at the time, the trio still secured appearances at multiple events in EMEA's T2 scene, with murii even earning himself a brief appearance at Ascension alongside MOUZ . The inception of the SK roster began in October of 2023, when joYnt was tasked with building the roster from scratch. The organization's Head Coach was no stranger to leading notable teams in the past, with a history of coaching different rosters for Entropiq , LDN UTD , and Guild GC . Now, three months later, he has finished reuniting a strong DACH core joined by a storied player and Portuguese import. The first roster of SK Gaming, pending Riot approval, is set to debut in the upcoming DACH Challengers League , which commences on Saturday, Jan 13. SK Gaming is: Miguel " Bati " Batista Felix " Felix " Gerling Haydem " Click " Ali Johan " Meddo " Renbjörk Lundborg Murat " murii " Korkmaz Tommaso " joYnt " Gavioli (Coach) Daniel " yaotziN. " Roczniak (Coach)

title: Founding member AsLanM4shadoW leaves BBL
cleaned_content: BBL Esports have bid farewell to Ali " AsLanM4shadoW " Osman Balta , one of the team's founding members, having joined in the summer of 2020. AsLanM4shadoW leaves BBL after 1268 days together. When AsLanM4shadoW joined BBL, the budding Turkish roster was still fighting for their presence in Europe, while simultaneously dominating regional competition. That became the standard for BBL, who only solidified their spot in EMEA in 2022, with that year's format changes and with 2023's kickoff of the partnered era. During the time leading up to the partnered era, AsLanM4shadoW survived numerous rebuilds. He was the only player from BBL's founding roster to reach the partnered VCT EMEA, and the most tenured member in the squad by over a year at that time; QutionerX was the second-most tenured member, having joined in December 2021. In AsLanM4shadoW's final year under BBL, the roster entered VCT EMEA as one of two Turkish representatives (alongside FUT Esports ). The team struggled to make a mark in 2023, bowing out of LOCK//IN in the first round to DRX and, some months later, finishing the EMEA regular season one victory shy of playoffs contention. In the LCQ , AsLanM4shadoW & co. were eliminated early in their opening match by Karmine Corp . AsLanM4shadoW is the first player BBL let go since September, when the team dropped three of its players. In the final months of 2023, BBL picked up Efe " Elite " Teber , of Papara SuperMassive , and S2G Esports duo Melih " pAura " Karaduran and Kaan " reazy " Ürpek . With AsLanM4shadoW's departure, the team has returned to a standard quintet ahead of the 2024 season, which kicks off next month. BBL Esports ' 2024 roster is: Efe " Elite " Teber Melih " pAura " Karaduran Eren " Brave " Kasırga Kaan " reazy " Ürpek Doğukan " QutionerX " Dural Toprak " lauress " Kaynak (Substitute) Arda " Epic " Yıldız (Head coach)

title: C0M completes Leviatán roster
cleaned_content: LEVIATÁN have picked up world champion Corbin " C0M " Lee after Agustin " nzr " Ibarra was benched recently. C0M had been with the Evil Geniuses core since 2022. The roster didn't qualify for international tournaments, only ending the year with a top-eight finish at VCT North America LCQ . Following their acceptance to the VCT Americas league 2023, EG made their international debut at LOCK//IN , where they fell to TALON . EG continued to make strides after narrowly qualifying for Americas playoffs , leading to their appearance at Masters: Tokyo and Valorant Champions . Evil Geniuses shocked the world in Tokyo as they dominated the competition, only to be stopped by FNATIC in the grand finals. At Valorant Champions, EG continued their dominance from groups to the upper finals – following a setback by Paper Rex , EG bested LOUD in a five-map thriller. Evil Geniuses etched their place in history after exacting their revenge against Paper Rex in the Grand Finals. Following Champions, Evil Geniuses let go of their reserve roster; the shuffles continued with the majority of their roster going their separate ways – leaving only jawgemo and coach potter . After being overshadowed by KRÜ Esports for most of 2021, Leviatán made a statement in their international debut at Masters: Copenhagen , placing top six. LEV continued their momentum at Champions 2022 with a playoff appearance. In 2023, after finishing outside the top four at LOCK//IN, the roster faltered finishing in fifth-place in the playoffs. Americas LCQ marked their last chance to qualify for Champions, ultimately falling short to KRÜ Esports in the grand finals marking the end of their 2023 season. Leviatán bolstered their roster with the additions of aspas and tex joining alongside kiNgg , Mazino , and nzr. The new roster made its tournament debut at Superdome Colombia , hoisting the trophy. Despite their victory, Leviatàn opted to bench nzr , stating that it was a sudden and unexpected change. Francisco " kiNgg " Aravena Ian " tex " Botsch Roberto " Mazino " Rivas Erick " aspas " Santos Corbin " C0M " Lee Agustin " nzr " Ibarra Alex " goked " Kie (Head coach) Dimitar " Itopata " Staev (Assistant coach)

title: Evil Geniuses announce departure of Boostio, C0M, ScrewFace
cleaned_content: Evil Geniuses are parting ways with Kyle " ScrewFace " Jensen , and have bid farewell to Kelden " Boostio " Pupello , who was signed by 100 Thieves , and Corbin " C0M " Lee , who is joining LEVIATÁN . The move follows the departure of Ethan and Demon1 to NRG , as well as the release of their reserve roster. Only jawgemo and coach potter remain from the team that won Champions 2023 . Boostio was a part of the organization since their initial rebuild back in 2021. A number of moves were made, including potter moving from the active roster to a coaching role. The announcement comes just shy of a two year stay for C0M, who joined the team back in April 2022. He helped the team qualify to their first-ever Challengers, but they were unable to obtain meaningful results in VCT. By the end of the year, Evil Geniuses were confirmed to be part of the inaugural Americas League , BcJ . They opted to keep their former roster while signing four additional players, including ScrewFace, who joined as part of their reserve roster. LOCK//IN Sao Paulo would be the organization's first international event. They went out in round two, taking a win against Team Heretics but losing 2-0 to TALON . Ahead of the Americas League, BcJ was benched for Demon1. They ended league play with a 4-5 record, squeaking their way into the playoffs where they made a dark horse run to the lower bracket finals. The third place finish earned them spots at Masters: Tokyo and Valorant Champions . Evil Geniuses were able to carry their playoff momentum into the international events. They finished at the top of their group on both occasions, and only suffered three losses overall, both against the respective grand finalists. However, at Valorant Champions, they were able to overcome defeat, beating Paper Rex 3-1 to hoist the trophy. A few weeks later, Evil Geniuses announced the release of their reserve roster and allowed ScrewFace to look for offers. Yesterday, Boostio was announced to be a part of 100 Thieves' 2024 roster. Despite the departures, the organization has not named any replacements. Evil Geniuses is now: Alexander " jawgemo " Mor Christine " potter " Chi (Head coach)

title: Patch 8.0 introduces new gun, rotation, and map changes
cleaned_content: The first patch of 2024 has arrived, introducing Episode 8 Act 1. To kick off the new year, Riot have added a new gun, Outlaw, as well as announced a new map rotation, Icebox and Lotus updates, as well as Deadlock and Killjoy changes. To debut Episode 8, Riot have also released two videos. Yesterday, the Episode 8 cinematic which shines some light on Omen lore. Today, the day of the patch, a gameplay video which showcases the new Outlaw weapon, as well as some of the Act 1 skins. The full patch notes have been reproduced below. Images of the Icebox and Lotus changes are available on Riot's blog post . GENERAL UPDATES The Gun Buddy Carousel should now appear alphabetical by name. Hopefully, it is much easier to find what you want! AGENT UPDATES Deadlock Continuing in the direction of the previous 7.10 GravNet (C) changes, we're looking to build upon the unique strengths of Deadlock's two other basic abilities: Sonic Sensor (Q) and Barrier Mesh (E). For Sonic Sensor (Q), we're increasing the reliability of the concuss once triggered by shortening its windup time, while also increasing flexibility by allowing you to recall and redeploy it in round. Sonic Sensor (Q) Sonic Sensors are now recallable in round. Sonic Sensor's pickup distance increased 12m >>> 27m Decreased time to concuss once triggered 1.0s >>> 0.5s Decreased time for enemies to destroy Sonic Sensor once triggered 0.65s >>> 0.5s Deadlock and her allies can now hear Sonic Sensor's audio lightly when they are in its area of effect. For Barrier Mesh (E), we increased the max length of the barrier walls to allow it to divide much larger spaces than is possible with comparable utility and make it more reliable at fully blocking chokes when deployed quickly. Barrier Mesh (E) Increased the max length Barrier Mesh walls 6m >>> 10m Killjoy The amount of coverage on Killjoy's Turret (E) outshines other defensive recon tools when paired with the Turret's other strengths, such as its autonomous detection and long range vision. Reducing its vision cone should push Killjoy to make clearer choices about what area of the map her Turret will cover, while the Turret's updated visuals should aid you in quickly understanding what areas it will protect. Turret (E) Vision radius reduced 180 degrees >>> 100 degrees Added a representation of the Turret's vision cone on Killjoy's minimap when she is placing the Turret. Added VFX and updated the Turret's animations to communicate the Turret's new vision radius. MAP UPDATES Doors Refactor We have upgraded the tech behind our interactable doors in order to polish some of your interactions with others and with Agent abilities. Icebox Icebox is back with a few changes to shake up Mid, B Green and B Orange. Our goal with these changes is to add value and impact to Mid for either team controlling it and simplify pathing toward B Site through B Orange and B Green to make fights more predictable. Attacker Side Spawn Storage container has been added on the left side to block line of sight from Attacker Spawn to B Tube. B Green The hanging container in B Green was creating a lot of complexity for both fights on the ground and people boosting up top. Moving the container out of the way should make combat here more manageable. B Tube Exterior We felt that Mid could use more value for either team holding it. We've added a window toward the end of B Tube that overlooks Mid and can see towards A Site and Defender Spawn. It allows Attackers to assert a lot of pressure on rotators and Defenders should be able to hold more space when holding Mid from B Kitchen or Mid Boiler. B Tube Interior Added two boxes stacked flush to the wall B Snow Pile There were multiple parallel paths leading from Mid to B Site. To reduce timings and create more predictable fights we've removed the B Orange route closest to B Kitchen. Adjusted the snowpile leading up to B Kitchen so you can now silently drop off the boxes. Lotus Attackers have felt fairly overwhelming to Defenders on Lotus. Because of this, we're adding more options by adjusting neutral spaces and making some quality of life updates across the map so that Defenders can better hold sites. A Main More room has been added to A Main along with a set of boxes to give Defenders some more options to fight for A Rubble control. The double stack of boxes outside A Stairs has been changed to non-penetrable to reduce the likelihood of being spammed. A Link More room has been added near the breakable door. It was always a little awkward to fight out of the broken door, but now it should be easier to fight out from inside the connector room. A Hut A Hut has been closed to help give some more readability to the plant site, making it easier to retake. A cubby has also been added to the back of A Hut for more defender options to hold the site. B Site More room and boxes have been added to B Site to add some defensibility closer to the choke on site. C Site The Spike plant zone and the stairs in C Bend have been adjusted to allow for more diversity of Spike plant locations in C Site. Boxes on the back of site have been adjusted. C Bend More room and boxes have been added in C Main to also add some defensibility closer to the front of Main. Boxes have been added to C Bend along with some extra room to fight from. Rotating Doors Rotating doors now take 10 seconds to fully complete their spin, up from 8 previously. 8 seconds was not enough time to use utility through the doors or fight, and make it through the doors on the same rotation. The extra time should allow for more fights to happen through the doors, and most everyone to get through the door on time. Increased the time it takes for rotating doors to complete their rotation 8s >>> 10s MODES UPDATE Team Deathmatch We felt that the Sheriff is overperforming in the Stage 2 weapon ecosystem and, as a result, other loadouts have been pushed to the side. This change aims to allow other weapons to be more viable when in an engagement against a Sheriff. Stage 2 - Sheriff Loadout Heavy Shield >>> Light Shield Map Rotation All modes (except Team Deathmatch and Custom games) will use the Competitive map rotation. Current rotation: Icebox, Lotus, Sunset, Breeze, Ascent, Bind, Split Premier Updates Team Captain Role We've added a secondary management role to rosters called Team Captain. Team Captains can help with team management including inviting and removing team members. Captains cannot delete the team or kick the Team Owner out. Team Owners can promote and demote a Team Captain. Standings You can now view standings in other divisions and for previous Stages of Premier using the drop down menus on the top left of the Standings Tab. Divisions You can now see which division you are seeded into before you play your first match. Playoff Qualification The threshold to qualify for this Stage is back to the standard 675 Premier Score. EMEA Zone Updates We've updated our Zones to support the VCT Challengers League Path to Promotion in EMEA. To learn more about how to qualify for Challengers Open Qualifiers and how Premier integrates into esports in 2024, check out this article.~ WEAPONS UPDATES The Outlaw goes live! Learn about our newest weapon on our Arsenal page . GAMEPLAY SYSTEMS UPDATES Starting in Patch 8.0, VALORANT will support third party spatialization software for headphones. Spatial Audio is virtual surround sound for headphones. This software processes sound to help you differentiate sounds that are in front, behind, or even above you, while listening on headphones. For example, figuring out if those footsteps were in front of you or behind you. We are excited to announce that Patch 8.0 will include official support for 3rd party spatial audio solutions! This gives you choices beyond the HRTF option which was already available in VALORANT's audio settings. In Patch 7.06, we made changes to the audio engine that caused issues for those of you who were already using third party spatialization software, which we did not support at the time. When 3rd party spatialization software was active in Windows settings in 7.06, sound levels went haywire and our only solution at the time was to guide those being affected to turn third party spatialization software off for the time being. We implemented a stereo-only fix in 7.07 that was compatible with Spatial Audio, but did not allow it to virtualize surround sound. In Patch 8.0, the Speaker Configuration in VALORANT's audio settings will default to stereo, but you can enjoy all of the features that these spatial audio solutions provide if you choose to opt in by setting the Speaker Configuration to Auto-Detect. How can I experience Spatial Audio in VALORANT? Step 1: Open VALORANT's audio settings and change the Speaker Configuration from Stereo to Auto-Detect. Step 2: Turn on Spatial Audio in your Windows settings. Open the Sound control panel, right click your playback device, choose Properties, and go to the Spatial sound tab. This is where you can turn spatialization software on and select different spatial sound formats. Riot have also left a FAQ in the patch notes regarding spatial audio support, which can be found here . BUG FIXES General Fixed a bug with Raw Input Buffer where swapped primary/secondary mouse keys in Windows mouse settings was not being respected. KNOWN ISSUES Team Deathmatch When the Outlaw is picked up from a weapon spawner, it does not have reserve ammunition. We are currently working on a fix.

title: 100 Thieves bail out Boostio
cleaned_content: 100 Thieves have snatched up reigning world champion Kelden " Boostio " Pupello from Evil Geniuses as their new in-game leader. After two years of lackluster results with Evil Geniuses, Boostio and the rest of his team began to turn things around in 2023. Despite an early exit from LOCK//IN at the hands of TALON , the roster narrowly advanced to the playoffs of the Americas League and claimed a spot at Masters: Tokyo following a risky roster change. Following their return to the international stage, EG tore through the competition and defeated team after team without dropping a map. However, the villains were eventually subdued by fan-favorites FNATIC in the upper and grand finals of the event, sending EG home with a second-place finish. Having already qualified for Los Angeles' Champions , EG once again took the stage by storm as they handled FunPlus Phoenix and FUT Esports in the group stage. Although they managed to reach the upper final without much resistance, the roster was once again sent to the lower bracket, this time by Paper Rex . After a five-map series took both EG and LOUD the distance, North America's last hope emerged victorious and continued their villainous run in the grand finals, where they flipped the script and defeated Paper Rex 3-1 to give North America its first-ever Champions trophy. A spectacular conclusion to an amazing storyline. (Photo: Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) Following their win in L.A. and amid the roster shuffles preluding 2024, EG saw the departure of Ethan " Ethan " Arnold and Max " Demon1 " Mazanov to NRG before Boostio followed suit with 100T. Despite starting off 2023 with a strong top eight finish at LOCK//IN, 100 Thieves were unable to outdo their previous results. The team was denied a spot at the Americas League playoffs after a knife in the back from MIBR forced them into an unfavorable tiebreaker. With one last chance at making Champions in the form of the Americas LCQ , 100T took Pearl from Sentinels in their opening match, but could not close out the series and were eliminated from contention, effectively ending their year. Shortly after, the organization released two players and brought on Daniel " eeiu " Vucenovic from M80 while making changes to their coaching staff. Boostio's acquisition completes the roster ahead of the 2024 VCT as the thieves look to make off with a title this time around. 100 Thieves are now: Kelden " Boostio " Pupello Sean " bang " Bezerra Matthew " Cryocells " Panganiban Daniel " eeiu " Vucenovic Peter " Asuna " Mazuryk Anthony " Zikz " Gray (Head coach) Michael " Mikes " Hockom (Assistant coach)

title: nzr out of starting Leviatán lineup
cleaned_content: LEVIATÁN have made changes to their starting roster by moving Agustin " nzr " Ibarra to a substitute role. Despite recently taking home the crown at the Superdome 2023: Colombia event, the lineup has undergone changes and is now incomplete. Before Leviatán, nzr played under FURIA and helped take them to Champions two years in a row. Prior to the commencement of 2023's LOCK//IN , he found himself signing with Leviatán amidst the roster shuffles following franchising. The roster performed fairly well in Brazil, and took home a top eight finish after falling to semifinalists Natus Vincere . Eager to surpass their previous results in the Americas League , the team advanced to the playoffs, but were sent home winless after suffering losses to FURIA and Cloud9 . Forced to fight in the Americas LCQ for a ticket to Champions, nzr and the rest of Leviatán fell to KRÜ Esports in their opening match and were sent to the lower bracket. After dispatching of Sentinels , Leviatán eliminated Cloud9 in a five-map thriller to secure a grand finals appearance with KRÜ. Unfortunately, the team could not stop the Cinderella run that KRÜ had embarked on, and their 2023 chapter was cut short by the very team that went winless in the Americas League. A series of roster changes ensued as Shyy and Tacolilla were swapped out for aspas and tex . The new iteration of Leviatán enacted their revenge on KRÜ in their opening match of Superdome, and went on to defeat Cloud9 and FURIA to win the event without dropping a map. Despite their success in Colombia, roster changes were still in order. The organization expressed that the sudden change in the team was not planned, and that the future of the lineup would be announced soon. LEVIATÁN are now: Ian " tex " Botsch Francisco " kiNgg " Aravena Roberto " Mazino " Rivas Erick " aspas " Santos Agustin " nzr " Ibarra (Sub) Alex " goked " Kie (Head coach) Dimitar " Itopata " Staev (Assistant coach)

title: nitr0 returns to Valorant, completes M80 roster
cleaned_content: FPS Veteran Nick " nitr0 " Cannella has returned to Valorant and signed with M80 ahead of the 2024 NA Challengers League. He is set to don the mantle of in-game leader as the squad hopes to hoist this year's Americas Ascension trophy. Once part of the initial batch of pros competing in the early stages of the game, nitr0's career in 2020 kicked off as he and 100 Thieves claimed the First Strike: North America trophy. From there, he and 100T remained in the upper echelons of the North American competitive scene, even qualifying for 2021's Masters: Berlin and placing among the top four. After coming up short in the 2021 NA LCQ , nitr0 returned to his roots and signed with Team Liquid as a player for their CS:GO division. After nearly a year and a half of competing with Liquid, nitr0's return to Valorant seemed all but certain after a report by Purest hinted at his signing and return to the title. Welcome back, Cap. (Photo: Colin Young-Wolff/Riot Games) M80 performed well in the 2023 NA Challengers League . The former roster won both the Mid-Season Invitational as well as playoffs, which qualified them to Americas Ascension alongside fellow North American representative The Guard . M80 maintained their composure throughout Ascension playoffs and performed a lower bracket run to meet The Guard in the grand final. Unfortunately, the team stumbled when it mattered most and were sent home empty handed as their opponents claimed the Ascension trophy in a 3-1 victory. Following the departures of Mohamed " johnqt " Amine Ouarid and Daniel " eeiu " Vucenovic , M80 were left with two vacancies. After picking up Brendan " BcJ " Jensen in November, the squad was all but set to welcome nitr0 as the missing piece of the puzzle. Now complete, M80's new roster will make their explosive debut in the NA Challengers League. Only time will tell if the roster has retained its firepower as they duke it out against their North American rivals. M80 is now: Alexander " zander " Dituri Marc-Andre " NiSMO " Tayar Gianfranco " koalanoob " Potestio Nick " nitr0 " Cannella Brendan " BcJ " Jensen Vincent " Happy " Schopenhauer (Head coach) " GUNTER " (Coach)

title: Riot reveal NA GC dates, points, and new organizer
cleaned_content: Riot has announced a number of details for the 2024 NA Game Changers season, which includes the Series' dates for the year, the points distribution and details, as well as Raidiant , who were selected as the organizer for the upcoming season. Akin to last year, three Game Changers tournaments will be held. The three tournaments are scheduled to be played between January and October. While Series 1 will have two open qualifiers, the remaining two tournaments will each have three qualifiers leading up to a four-day main event. The first open qualifier for Series 1 opened earlier today, and will remain open until Jan. 10. Sign-ups can be found here . The NA GC Series 1 dates are: Game Changers Series 1 Open Qualifier 1 Registration Opens: Jan. 4 at 10 a.m. PT Registration Closes: Jan. 10 at 11:59 p.m. PT Competition Dates: Jan. 23-24 & Jan. 26-27 Open Qualifier 2 Registration Dates: Jan. 25 - 29 Competition Dates: Feb. 6-7 & Feb. 9-10 Main Event Competition Dates: March 6-10 Series 2 will kick off its qualifiers in April and end June 16. The final tournament has its first qualifier scheduled for a July 23 kickoff, with the grand final to be played Oct. 20. Full dates for each event can be found in Riot's announcement . Each qualifier will be hosted in a GSL group stage, and then a single-elimination bracket. Barring the winner — the only team that gets a straight shot to the main event — squads will be drafted into the main event via open qualifier points. Teams may also play more than one open qualifier per series in order to maximize their points and chances at the main event. These points will reset between Series. The 2024 format remains the same as last year's from hereon. The main events will be played in eight-team double-elimination brackets, awarding points to each team that will later qualify them to the Game Changers Championship. The Series 3 winner gets a direct ticket to the end-of-year event, alongside the team with the most points. Should the team with the most points win Series 3, the second team in line gets chosen. Two NA teams will go to 2024's GCC, matching last year's slot distribution. The 2024 NA GC points distribution is as follows: Riot has also renewed their partnership with AnyKey as the player eligibility verification partner for 2024. AnyKey has updated their verification process, to which all players must subject themselves. Verification may be submitted starting Jan. 10. Full details on the guidelines can be found in Riot's blog post . The Game Changers Academy program is also making a return as Raidiant Academy. These will be eight events, the first of which in late February, to promote grassroots GC talent. Each of the eight events will have a $2,000 USD prize pool. Full details will be revealed soon on Raidiant's pages .

title: Vitality bench Destrian
cleaned_content: Team Vitality have announced that Tomas " Destrian " Linikas has been moved to the bench nearly one month ahead of the VCT 2024 EMEA Kickoff . He is still contracted to the organization as they search for replacements. Initially brought on alongside the rest of the revamped Vitality crew, Destrian's debut on the international stage took place in Brazil as he and his team eliminated Global Esports from 2023's LOCK//IN before being sent home early by LEVIATÁN . Eager to make an appearance at Masters: Tokyo , Vitality battled their way out of the EMEA League season and into playoffs, but were quickly defeated by Team Liquid and FUT Esports , relegating them to the EMEA LCQ . However, following the passing of Karel " Twisten " Ašenbrener , Vitality announced that they would not participate in the EMEA LCQ, subsequently ending their 2023 season. Throughout the off season, various roster moves saw the departure of Michał " MOLSI " Łącki as fresh talent was onboarded ahead of the new season. Seven months after their last official match, Vitality participated in the Convergence 2023 OFF//SEASON event, where the roster took home a second-place finish behind FUT. Although Destrian remains under contract with Vitality, he has announced that he is looking for offers in any region. Rumors point to Nikita " trexx " Cherednichenko as a potential replacement, but no announcements have been made as of now. Team Vitality is now: Jokūbas " ceNder " Labutis Kimmie " Kicks " Laasner Emil " runneR " Trajkovski Saif " Sayf " Jibraeel Salah " salah " Barakat (Head coach) Joseph " Strong " Edwards (Coach) Harry " Gorilla " Mepham (Assistant coach) Marceau " Placido " Lambert (Performance coach) Marcus " marcus_askildsen " Askildsen (Performance coach)
